loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Teresa T. es una mujer luchadora, responsable y esforzada su gran sueño ha sido colaborar en la infraestructura de su hogar y ofrecerles de esta forma a sus hijos y demas familiares mejores condiciones de vida. Hoy en dia se dedica a la venta de refrescos, gaseosas, zapatos y otros productos. Siendo este su septimo ciclo de credito agradece a la micro-financiera por hacerla participe de la gran familia de creditos. Con el prestamo comprara materiales de construccion tales como: estribos, arena, piedras canteras, hierro, bolsas de cemento, alambre de amarre, clavos, laminas de plycem, perlines, laminas de zinc, soldaduras entre otros y asi empezar la construccion de dos cuartos obteniendo con estos que los suyos gocen de mejor privacidad. Su plan a futuro es seguir construyendo su humilde casa hasta darla por finalizada completamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa T. is a determined, responsible, and strong-willed woman. Her greatest wish is to contribute to the infrastructure of her home and provide her children and the rest of her family better living conditions. Teresa currently sells soft drinks, sodas, shoes, and other products. She is in her seventh loan cycle. Teresa is grateful for the micro-loans because they have enabled her to take advantage of a wide variety of credit products.

This loan will be used to purchase building materials such as supports, sand, quarry stones, iron, bags of cement, wire, nails, sheets of fiberboard, crossbeams, sheets of zinc, welding supplies, and other items so that the construction of two rooms can begin. By obtaining these materials, her family will be able to enjoy more privacy. Her plan for the future is to continue with the construction of her modest home so that it can finally reach completion.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for building two rooms.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Abdukarim, who is in his early 40s, is married with five children who go to school. The owner of a motorcycle business for two years now, he is able to make a good monthly profit working from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, his previous ones, both since repaid, having been used to buy another motorcycle and pay household expenses. Abdukarim is requesting this loan to start building his house, and will share the loan with his loan group "Ununio," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in making their repayments.

loans.use: to start building his house.

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en:
Gerlee is 44 years old, married and lives with her husband and 3 sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Bayanhongor province. Her husband is 44 years old and works as a guard man in a secondary school "Nomgon".  The oldest son, Dayandorj, is 21 years old and he is a student at Ih Zasag university in Ulaanbaatar. The second son, Tsedendorj, is 20 years old and also a student at Mongolian State University. The youngest son, Batzorig, is 8 years old and goes to secondary school.

She has been doing this business for 4 years. Gerlee operates a recycling business. The borrower has been collecting plastics, bottles and cans for recycling, visiting the trading centers of Sanchir, Orgil and Uran Hairhan by herself. Since 2008, she has bought raw materials at the central market. She has been hiring 2 workers at the Central and Ganbogd centers and paying for their work.

The family atmosphere is amiable and warm. The standard of living is prosperous because the couples are running a business besides having a permanent job. The borrower is courteous.  She is requesting a loan with an amount of 500,000 MNT to purchase more raw materials and to increase working capital. In the future she is planning to buy a truck for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials and to increase working capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She works in preparing and selling traditional Saj bread and Manakish (similar to pita bread, it can be topped with special ingredients such as thyme, cheese and many others, just like pizza toppings, but it must be folded and it's usually eaten at breakfast) for the past 20 years. This is a very important source of living for her family.

Her business is good enough to cover her family's expenses and nothing more, so that's why Fatima applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise to increase her business production, which will lead to an increase in her family's income and will improve their social and financial situations at the same time.

Fatima's customers are neighbors, villagers and relatives. She hopes to expand her business more and more and will try her best to finish building her house which she might use part of this loan to make necessary maintenance requested.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise to increase her production

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fish to sell for her dried fish business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing and fish vending business. Petronila has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling seaweeds.

Petronila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is from Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. 

To make a living, Cesaria cooks and sells food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Cesaria has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 13,000 a month. In 2007, she joined GDMPC. Cesaria is now requesting a loan of PHP 17,000, which she will use to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old business lady. She is married to John and they are blessed with three children. Jane has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy cloth materials and a modern sewing machine. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials and a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Habanbai

texts.en:
Habanbai is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in his own house in Hovd province.  His children all go to secondary school.

Habanbai has had an agriculture business since 2005. He has three hectares of his own land in Buyant soum where he runs a business planting and trading potatoes and other vegetables. He also has a storage pit with a capacity of 30 tons. He keeps vegetables there to sell. His standard of living is average and depends fully on his business. His family members' health is good. He is hardworking and chary.  He says, "I am waiting for prices to go up  because the vegetable price is very low now."  He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a freezer.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus used his previous loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed and seeds.  Since he accessed the loan, his business has improved.  He has managed to grow his business and earn more income.  He used the additional income to pay school fees for his children.  He has requested for another loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dairy meal to feed his animals.

loans.use: To buy dairy meal to feed his animals.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is 36 years old. She is married and has six children. She is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City.

Dorina used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 39-year-old poultry farmer in Mombasa. She is a widowed mother of two and has been running her business for the last two years with success. 

This is her third loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more one-year-old chicks for rearing on her farm. She sells chicken and eggs to her customers. 

The proceeds from the business will be used to expand her business and repay her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more one-year-old chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Babie Rose

texts.en:
Babie Rose is 41 years old and single but she has a child. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Babie Rose used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Amarbayar

texts.en:
Amarbayar, aged 40, is not married and lives with his mother in his own house in Selenge Province. His mother is retired. 

Amarbayar operates a vegetable planting business. He has grown potatoes on one hectare of land for the past eight years. He plans to purchase more land with this year's revenue. Amarbayar is humble and responsible. As he lives with mother, the household consumption costs are less and this enables him to focus more on his business.  He has previously taken a loan from XacBank and paid it off at its maturity date. He plans to have savings and receive other products. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase potato seeds and cover the cost of cultivation for further plantation.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and cover the cost of cultivation for further plantation

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en: Rommel, 31 years old, is a single entrepreneur in Gango, Ozamis City.  He earns a living from his transport service business. He has run this business for almost 10 years now and he earns PHP 10,000 per month. To improve business, he is borrowing PHP 28,700 from GDMPC, which he just joined recently in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he is hopeful that he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is married and has four children. 

He sells clothes to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has employed one person in the business.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
  
He hopes to grow his business and employ people in the future. He has requested 80,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a 51-year-old man. He is married and a father of seven children. He lives in Nyathuna in the outskirts of Kangemi. He sells vegetables and he is also a farmer. He has been in business for 13 years and gets a monthly salary of KES 12,000.

This will be Walter’s sixth loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to add more stock of tomatoes, cabbages and onions for sale. In future, he would like to expand his business so that he can improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: To add more stock of  tomatoes, cabbages and onions for sale.

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Nhoek is 40 years old, married, and has a lovely child who is attending school. She lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang province. 

She helps her husband earn income by selling fresh fish in a local market of the province. Typically, she is able to make around USD 2.50 per day from this business. She has been involved in this since 2008. 

Nhoek told us that she is experiencing difficulties in transportation due to the lack of vehicle for home use. She used to spend the daily allowance on transportation services every time she and her family wanted to get everywhere. 

To deal with this matter, she would like to take out a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for home use as well as for business. Also, with the remaining funds, she will purchase more fish to sell in her store. 

In the future, she wants to enlarge her present store and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for home use as well as for business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman. She has two children, and their ages are 5 and 15 years. She describes herself to be a determined and focused woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as kale, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are local residents within the estates. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to be a vegetable wholesaler. Caroline hopes to run another grocery store and purchase some land for the family by using her profits.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Wendy Noelia

texts.es: Wendy Noelia esta emprendedora inicio su negocio  por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo  para la  mantencion de sus hijos, ella se inico hace  algun tiempo lo cual ha adquirido la experiencia necesaria para el desarrollo del mismo, en la actualidad esta emprendora ha logrando mantener y hacer crecer el negocio grancias al apoyo que le ha brindado fundacion leon 2000 con los financiamiento, en esta ococion ella esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mercaderia como es :  blusas, pantalones, ropa de niños, calcetines, camisolas, tuallas, entre otros.
texts.en: Wendy Noelia is an entrepreneur who began her business out of a need to generate income to provide for her children. She has been working in her clothing sales business for some time now, and has learned many lessons through experience. She has been able to maintain and grow her business thanks to the support she has received from the Leon 2000 Foundation. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise for her business, including: blouses, pants, kids’ clothing, socks, camisoles, towels and other items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, kids' clothing, socks, camisoles, towels, and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She is married to Joseph, who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. 

She has been selling second-hand clothes as a primary business and keeping rabbits at the same time. She has done this for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes, more rabbits and feed. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to own a rabbit farm, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and more rabbits and feed.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 53-year-old business man. He is married to Mumbua, who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children. 

He has been running a retail shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Solomon will use the loan to purchase more stock of retail items like sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize flour. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of retail shop items like sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize meal.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 44-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to six sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs.

Fadwa works in agriculture. She plants seasonal crops to sell, which has been a profitable project, but she needs more support to cover the costs.

Fadwa is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a water tank to irrigate the crops. This will increase the size of the crop and so increase sales and improve the family's income.

Fadwa is photographed at her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank to irrigate the crops.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru: Идигул проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Идигул занимается скотоводством. В этой области она четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Idigul lives in the Dangara region. She is 36, married, and has three children. Idigul has been raising cattle for four years. She is taking this loan to purchase calves in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has two children.  

He has a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also rears pigs for more income generation. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ people in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Rocio De Jesus

texts.es: Rocio con su anterior credikiva compró productos que vinieron en sus catálogos con descuentos y también compró bebidas frías que vendió e invirtió nuevamente en la compra de productos naturales, bajo pedidos de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará cervezas en mayor volumen, lavadoras, minicomputadores planchas y electrodomésticos menores, para venderlos, porque los tiene encargados y desde hace 5 meses que se inició en el comercio de estos artículos le ha ido muy bien. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva que muchas gracias por la ayuda recibida y que la tengan en cuenta,  que inviertan en las personas que necesitan de su apoyo y hacer surgir su negocio.
texts.en:
With her last loan Rocio bought discounted products from catalogs as well as cold drinks to sell, and also she invested some of the money in the purchase of natural products ordered by her customers. Now she is applying for another loan to buy beer in large volumes, washing machines, laptop computers, and small appliances to sell. She has orders for them, and since she started selling these items five months ago, sales have gone well. 

Rocio says thank you to Kiva donors for the help she has received. They should always keep in mind that they are helping people who need a hand to help their businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy beer in large volumes, washing machines, laptop computers, and small appliances

loans.name: Aracely Maria

texts.es: Aracely con su credikiva compró articulos para el hogar que comercializó a crédito con pagos diarios; Con ello le fue muy bien y es por ersto que nuevamente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una mayor cantidad articulos para el hogar, con el fin de seguir ganando mas descuentos y una nueva clientela, que aumente su capital. Su mensaje alos finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Un agradecimiento especial, ya que el crédito utilizado me sirvió de mucha ayuda para hacer crecer la cartera y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en: With her Kiva loan, Aracely bought household ítems which she sold on credit for daily repayments. It went very well and so she is applying for another Kiva loan with which she will buy a larger amount of household items, with the aim of continuing to secure discounts, obtaining a new clientele and  increasing her capital. Her message to the Kiva financers is as follows: "a special thanks, since the loan I used has served me very well to expand our portfolio and increase our family's income."

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of household items.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer  de 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  con hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e  hijos en la parte rural  del Distrito de Tambogrande.No cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales. La mayoría de familias viven en estas condiciones.

La actividad principal que desarrolla  Francisca  es la crianza y venta de ovinos, aves de corral y cerdos los cuales los cría, engorda y comercializa en el mercado local, cuenta con experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Su cónyuge cuenta con 1,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón  donde cosecha semanalmente y esto le permite tener otros ingresos.

El monto del crédito solicitado es de S/. 2000 nuevos soles y será para la compra de  una Mototaxi  que lo necesita para transportar  sus animales como: ovinos, cerdos, aves de corral y limón ,para poder comercializarlo en el mercado local de la zona, esto le permitirá una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old, and lives with her civil partner and their children in a rural portion of the district of Tambogrande. They do not have access to electricity, but they do have access to well water. The majority of families in their community live in these same conditions.

Francisca makes a living raising and selling sheep, barnyard birds, and pigs, which she fattens up and then sells in the local market. She has lots of experience in this arena, and her partner owns one hectare of land which he has planted with lemon trees that they harvest once a week to generate additional income. 

The current loan Francisca is requesting is in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, and she plans to use this support to buy a motor taxi to transport her animals, such as: sheep, pigs and barnyard birds. She also will use the motor taxi to take their lemons to market, too. This investment will help her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a motor taxi to transport her animals and lemons to market for resale.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho e vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para as despesas de casa. 
É comerciante há muito tempo, possui um estabelecimento comercial na estrada principal de Namaacha e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, cervejas, vinho, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Para o ano seguinte pretende voltar a Escola Industrial para se formar como mecânico, e pagar os estudos da sua esposa. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios concluir a sua residência através de seus rendimentos para melhor confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Tomas is married and has one child. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother by sending her some money for household expenses.

He has been a businessman for a long time. He has a store on Namaacha's main street and intends to use this loan to buy products (soft drinks, beer, wine, juice and other items) to increase his inventory.

In the coming year, Tomas intends to return to industrial school to train as a mechanic, and to pay for his wife's education. He promises to pay off his loan on time so he can take out more loans.

One of the challenges he faces is finishing his house with his income so he can make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy and sell product (soft drinks, beer, wine, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Mohpora

texts.ru: Мохпора замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и воспитанная женщина. Более 7 лет она занимается купле- продажей мобильных телефонов и аксессуаров для них. Торговая точка находится в центре города возле центрального рынка. Муж помогает ей в видении бизнеса. Имеет постоянных клиентов. Мохпора хотела бы получить займ для покупки новых товаров с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mohpora is married and a loving mother of four children. She is a very hard-working and polite woman. For over 7 years, she has been selling mobile telephones and their accessories with help from her husband. Mohpora's sales spot is located downtown near the central market and has attracted regular customers. Mohpora would like to obtain a loan to purchase new merchandise in order to expand her business. She is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise like pants, blouses, wallets, and beauty products to stock her business and to buy supplies to make tortillas.

loans.name: Henrry Marcelino

texts.es: El socio sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y sigue viviendo en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él se dedica a la construcción de casas, calles y otras obras más, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo clavos, maderas, cemento y otras cosas más. El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Henry is still a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas," and he continues to live in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He is a construction worker who builds houses, streets and other projects.  At this time, he needs a loan to buy construction materials, such as: nails, wood, cement and other materials.  He is happy to be getting this loan, and he promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as nails, wood, and cement

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза разведенная женщина и сама воспитывает двоих детей. Она одна содержит свою семью и усердно работает ради процветания своих детей. Гулноза занимается купле- продажей детской одежды и имеет 4 летний опыт в сфере торговли. Она приобретает товар из соседнего города. Имеет торговую точку на рынке. Среди населения есть большой спрос на ее товар. Гулноза хотела бы получить займ для покупки подростковой одежды. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulnoza is divorced and is raising her two children on her own. She is the sole provider in her family and works hard to ensure the well-being of her children. Gulnoza sells children's clothing and has 4 years of experience in sales. She buys her merchandise in a neighbouring city and sells it at her shop at the market. Her clothes are in high demand with the local populace. Gulnoza would like to obtain a loan to stock up on teenage clothing. She is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a new roof on his house

loans.name: Los Conquistadores Group

texts.es:
Esta Banco Comunal se llama “Los Conquistadores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; pastelería, artesanos, alimentos, venta de abarrotes, bazar, corte y confección de banderas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Verónica, presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste pantalon azul, poleron negro, usa lentes y su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio especificamente se ocupa de su almacén desde hace 2 años, algunas veces trabaja con su marido.
La mercadería que usa en su negocio la compra en distribuidoras de confites, distribuidora de lácteos, y en supermercados.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para su almacén.
Sus metas en su negocio son continuar para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Verónica vive junto a su madre y su marido. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
The Community Bank, “Los Conquistadores” (The Conquerors), is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in various trades, including: cake and pastry making, artisan crafts, food sales, grocery store sales, bazaar, flag making, and other services. All of the members belong to the community of Recoleta, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Verónica is the president of the Community Bank, and in the photo above, she is standing in the front row, the fourth person in from left to right. She is dressed in blue pants and a black jacket, and is wearing glasses. Her hair is short and is down. 

She makes a living operating a general store, which she opened over two years ago. Her husband sometimes works in the store with her. She purchases merchandise from distributors and supermarkets for resale in her store. With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase additional merchandise to stock her business. Her goals for the business are to continue growing and generating increased profits, and to improve her quality of life. 

Verónica lives with her husband, and dreams of growing and continuing in her business. She is very grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo Esperanza, and for their investment in her business. She also is very pleased with the group at the Community Bank, and feels that it is a unified group where the members have respect for one another and confidence in one another.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communities in the greater city of Santiago (the Capital of Chile), and is located in the north-central sector of the Santiago Metropolitan Region. It has an active business and trade district, which is located in the neighborhood of Patronato. The area has welcomed Arab immigrants initially, and now is receiving an influx of Korean immigrants.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Manuel Agustin

texts.es: Manuel  con su anterior credikiva compró muchas cosas, como una vitrina calentadora, 1 bicicarro de reparto y materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, con los que ganó descuentos y vendió muy bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará implementos varios, como un molino, 1 licuadora, un caldero de gran tamaño  y mercancías, varias para responder a pedidos en el día de las madres. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el crédito, fue de gran utilidad para sacar mi negocio adelante, espero que me continúen apoyando para que mi negocio siga creciendo”.
texts.en:
Manuel used his previous Kiva loan to purchase many things, including a heated display case and a bicycle-delivery vehicle to distribute primary materials and supplies in larger volume. He received discounts, and the items sold very well. 

At present, Manuel is applying for a new Kiva loan to purchase various implements, including a blender, a large kettle, and various merchandise, to respond to customer orders for Mothers Day.

Manuel's message to Kiva lenders is the following: "Many thanks for the loan; it was of great utility in advancing my business. I hope you will continue helping so that my business can continue to grow."

loans.use: buy various implements, including a grinder, a blender, a large kettle, and other kitchen items, to respond to his customer orders.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 38 year old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She sells snacks retail from her home and door to door. She has been in this business for the last six years and she dreams of opening a café and wholesale arm in the future. Mishi owns a house that has electricity but no running water. Her major challenge is the high cost of commodities, which lower her profits based on the fact that her business has not yet stabilized. Mishi’s greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

With the loan of KSh 50,000, she plans to purchase a bigger oven for frying her snacks and to add to her stocks of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger oven for frying her snacks and to add to her stocks of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elba Esperanza

texts.es:
Elba  Esperanza tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 2 hijos  y vive en una colonia de el Municipio de Cofradía Cortes.

Doña Elba tiene desde hace 10 años un negocio de pulpería.  Con este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante. Vende productos de la canasta básica como harina, manteca, frijoles, maseca, arroz, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos etc., y también productos de abarrotería, como papel higiénico,  toallas sanitarias, pañales desechables de niño,  pasta dental,  jabón, medicinas, condimentos etc. Ella dice que estos productos tienen mayor demanda en el  negocio ya que son de primera necesidad en el hogar. Su negocio es rentable y por lo tanto ha logrado poco a poco mantenerlo estable, con los financiamientos que ha recibido de la Institución.

Ahora solicita su Séptimo préstamo de 21,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar mas productos como granos básicos harina, manteca, frijoles, maseca, arroz, lácteos, embutidos, etc. y productos de abarrotería.  Con esta inversión espera mejorar aun más sus ventas  y estar mejor económicamente para seguir siendo puntual pagando los prestamos a Odef.

Su meta es trabajar mucho para llegar a convertir su pulperia en una bodega de abarrotería en donde pueda vender por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Elba Esperanza, age 58, is single because she is a widow.  She has two children, and she lives in a neighborhood in the Cofradia Cortes municipality.

Elba has had a grocery store for ten years.  It is through this business that she has been able to get ahead.  She sells staples like flour, lard, beans, instant corn flour, rice, dairy products, sausages, and soft drinks, etc.  She also sells general grocery items like toilet paper, sanitary napkins, children’s disposable diapers, toothpaste, medicine, and herbs and spices, etc.

She says that these products are in great demand in the business because they are basic needs items for the home.  Her business is profitable.  Therefore, she has managed to, little by little, keep it stable with the loans she has received from the institution.

She is now requesting her seventh loan in the amount of 21,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more products like basic grains, flour, lard, beans, instant corn flour, rice, dairy products, and sausages, etc.  She will also buy general grocery store products.  With this investment she hopes to improve her sales even more.  She also plans to be financially better off in order to continue being punctual making her payments for the loan from ODEF.

Her goal is to work hard in order to convert her grocery store into a grocery warehouse where she will be able to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy staples like basic grains, flour, lard, beans, instant corn flour, rice, dairy products, and sausages, etc.  She will also buy general grocery store products.

loans.name: Ronal Cruz

texts.es: Ronal tiene 53 años de edad, tiene dos hijos  menores de edad.  Su negocio consisten en la elaboracion de  muebles para la venta desde hace más de 16 años, cuenta con la ayuda de dos personas que le brindan apoyo en la elaboración de los diferentes muebles que realiza como sillas, comedores, escritorio, cómodas, mesedoras,  roperos, mesas de centros, centro de entretenimientos  entre otras, en la actualidad el esta solicitanodo el credito para la compra de materia prima como: clavos, herramientas, maque, alcohol, tela, pega, tachuelas, junco, mandera  entre otros.
texts.en: Ronal is 53 years old and has two children. His business has been making furniture for more than 16 years. He counts on the help of two people who help him make the different pieces of furniture like chairs, dining tables, desks, beds, rocking chairs, dressers, coffee tables, entertainment centers and other items. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase basic materials such as nails, tools, varnish,  fabric, glue, tacks, reeds, wood and other items.

loans.use: purchase nails, tools, varnish,  alcohol, fabric, glue, tacks, wood and other items.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer de 33 años de edad, de  estado civil casada, vive con su cónyuge e hijos  en la parte rural del distrito de Mochumí, departamento de Lambayeque, solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales. La mayoría de familias viven en estas condiciones.

 La actividad principal que desarrolla Pascuala  es la compra y venta de animales como: cerdos, chivos, patos, gallinas, donde los cría, engorda y comercializa a los mayoristas de la zona, es decir tiene experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Su cónyuge también le apoya en esta actividad.

El monto del  préstamo otorgado es de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, y  se destinara para la compra  de animales como: cerdos, chivos, patos, gallinas, y alimento balanceados como: maíz, polvillo, purina, vitaminas;  actualmente  se ha propuesto  en incrementar su negocio de  animales, esto le va permitir mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 33 year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband and children in a rural part of Mochumi district, in the department of Lambayeque.  The only utility that she has in her house is electricity.  She gets her water from hand-made wells.  Most of the families in this area live in similar conditions.

Pascuala's main activity is buying and selling animals such as: pigs, goats, ducks, and hens.  She feeds them and raises them, and sells them to the wholesalers in the area. She has experience in this line of work.  Her husband also supports her with her business.

Pascuala is requesting a sum of 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy animals such as pigs, goats, ducks and hens, and to buy nutritionally balanced feed such as: corn, rice-based feed, Purina feed and vitamins.  At this time she is proposing to increase her stock of animals, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals such as: pigs, goats, ducks and hens, and to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten them

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia  sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. La socia Sonia  tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niño, ella también hace cubre camas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.
Sonia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar hilos, telas y otros accesorios.  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sonia continues as a member of the "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) communal bank, and lives in the beauticul city of Cusco. Sonia has a little workshop that makes gift clothing for ladies, gentleman and children. She also makes bed covers. For many years now she has dedicated herself to this business and it has done very well.

On this occasion, Sonia needs a loan to buy thread, cloth, and other accessories. She is happy about the loan and commits herself to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth, and other accessories.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married and has four children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for over ten years He has employed one person in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  
He hopes to grow his business and employ more people. He has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy sugar, sweets, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sweets, and rice.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is a 60-year-old married woman who has been residing with her family in a peaceful village of Kampong Chhnang province. She is responsible for four children, three of whom are already married. Being a good mother, Chhay has a strong commitment to providing a good standard of living and further education to her children. She owns and operates a store selling grocery items in her community. She sells canned food, beverages, biscuits, home-use products, and personal care products. She is able to earn in the neighborhood of USD 5.00 per day to meet the needs of her family. 

To further improve her selling business, Chhay would like to increase her inventory of merchandise to satisfy her customers. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase noodles, snacks, sweets, and spices to fill up her store. She believes that she can pursue a higher quality of life through her determination and effort.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, snacks, sweets, and spices to fill up her store.

loans.name: Kpokpogbé Victorine

texts.fr: Kpokpogbé Victorine est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Benin. Kpokpogbé Victorine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris le métier de coiffure. Kpokpogbé Victorine est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont cinq constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Kpokpogbé Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a dix huit ans environs, Kpokpogbé Victorine exerce l'activité de coiffure et vend également du maïs de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Kpokpogbé Victorine s’approvisionne en maïs dans le nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Kpokpogbé Victorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Kpokpogbé Victorine is 42 years old and lives in Benin. Kpokpogbé Victorine stopped going to school after elementary school and learned how to be a hairdresser. 

Kpokpogbé Victorine is married to Alphonse. The couple has six dependent children, and five of the children are their own. All of the children go to school. 

Kpokpogbé Victorine lives with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. Kpokpogbé Victorine has been a hairdresser for about 18 years. She also sells corn on the side, and this allows her to better meet the needs of her family. 

Kpokpogbé Victorine buys her corn in the north of Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clients and with an eye toward improving her business, Kpokpogbé Victorine is asking for a third loan with ALIDé. Her past loans have been reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy hair products and bags of corn.

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es: Cruz Del Socorro con  tres hijos adultos esta emprendedora se ha desempeñado en su actividad economica como es la venta de productos lacteos durante los últimos 23 años, como queso y crema,mantequilla, cuajada, leche, así como otros alimentos, en la actualidad la Sra cruz  ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora, y con mucha experiencia en negocio ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en el negocio y asi poder sastifacer la  demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cruz Del Socorro has three adult children.  She is and enterprising woman who has been selling dairy products for the last 23 years.  She sells products like cheese, cream, butter, curd, milk, and other foods.

Cruz has shown herself to be a responsible, hard-working person with a lot of business experience.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  This way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, butter, curds, milk, and other foods.

loans.name: L'union De Senzidor 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 Group

texts.fr:
Jeanpierre est le coordinateur de son groupe l`union de senzidor. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Jeanpierre a dirigé son commerce de vente de cabrit durant les 3 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait un enseignant

Jeanpierre voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans l'achat des cabrit pour revendre. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de l`union de senzidor ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques et charbon.

Jeanpierre dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants.et vente credit qui lui rend difícil. Il dit que son rêve c`est d`avoir un plus grand grand dans esperanza pour obtenir un plus grand commere.
texts.en:
Jeanpierre is the coordinator of the "Union de Senzidor" group.  He lives in the northern part of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  He has managed his own goat sales business for the past three years.  Before being involved in this activity, he used to be a teacher.

Jeanpierre would like to use his loan to buy goats for resale.  He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.  Other members of the "Union de Senzidor" group need a loan to finance other activities such as food retail businesses or cosmetic and charcoal sales businesses.

Jeanpierre says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers.  Selling merchandise on credit also poses difficulties.  His dream, he says, is to obtain a larger loan from Esperanza in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has 3 children aged 5 years to 20 years old. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area and her primary customers are local residents. 

In addition, Catherine sells eggs and chickens to increase on her income. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables. This is the first loan she is requesting from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chicken to hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married to Jackson, who is also involved in business. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling cereals for the past year with a monthly income of 15,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. Caroline will use the loan to purchase dry maize, beans, and rice for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses and boost her cereal business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize, beans, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 25 years old who is married and lives with his family.

Since 2005, Zeid has owned a shop selling CDs, records and music DVDs. He has more than six years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for $3000 as a “Youth loan“ in order to redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he'll have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years old, married and the mother of nine children, five of whom are enrolled in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a variety store in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been in this line of work for nine years, and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap and other miscellaneous items. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her variety store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima is 33 years old and the mother of six children, five of whom are enrolled in school. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by operating a food stall, selling items she makes at home to her neighbors. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her main challenge is people who fail to pay their bills on time. Her main goals for the future are to have her own kiosk and enough capital to expand her business. She joined Yehu as a way to boost her business, and is requesting a loan for KES 10,000 to buy rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Cony Group

texts.es:
Cony, es un grupo de 9 personas (amigas y vecinas)  a las cuales les interesa mucho hacer crecer su negocio, por lo cual decidieron formar dicho grupo para que cada una de sus integrantes saliera adelante con sus negocios, ya que cada una de ellas tienen diferentes metas que les gustaría cumplir. 
Ma. Guadalupe es una de ellas, quien tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva- usada en mercados y hamburguesas los fines de semana. Ma. Guadalupe tiene tres hijos a los cuales les quiere dar lo mejor por tal motivo decidió entrar en el grupo ya que su negocio necesitaba una inversión para poder tener mayores ingresos; el crédito lo utilizara para comprar un carrito para poder vender sus hamburguesas de manera mas fácil.
texts.en:
The group Cony is made up of 9 women who are friends and neighbors, and all of whom want to grow and develop their businesses. They decided to start this group to get ahead and generate income, since each of them have personal and life goals they wish to attain.

Ma Guadalupe is one of the group members, and she operates a new and used clothing sales business that she attends to during the week. On the weekends, she sells hamburgers. Ma Guadalupe has three children who are her motivation for working hard, since she wants to give them nothing but the best. With her children in mind, she decided to join the group, since her business needed an investment to continue in its operations. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase a cart to improve and facilitate her hamburger sales business.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to improve her hamburger sales business.

loans.name: Ngangala

texts.en:
Ngangala is married and the father of four children who range in age from two to 14 years old. He describes himself as social and someone who enjoys sharing ideas. For the last three years, he has earned a living by operating a retail stall where he sells clothes such as t-shirts, sock and belts. He has one employee, and his stall is located in a busy part of town. Most of his customers are people who come into town frequently. Ngangala supplements his income by farming, and says that his biggest business challenge is a shortage of funds he can use to improve his business. 

He is requesting a loan for KES. 20,000 to buy trousers to add to his inventory. In the past, he received a loan of KES. 10,000 which he repaid fully and on time. His goal for the future is to be a wholesaler of clothes in a nearby town. He also hopes to earn enough money to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy trousers to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a hardworking business man. He sells sugarcane to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He employs three people in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100, 000 Kenya shillings to buy more sugarcane to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is thirty-one years old. He is single but supports his parents financially. He owns a shop where he offers computer services such as photocopying and printing. 

He started this business three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has requested a loan worth KES 10,000 to purchase printing and photocopying paper, stationery and printing ink and toners. 

The anticipated profit will help him expand his business. He dreams of seeing his business registered as a company in the republic of Kenya. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase printing and photocopying paper, stationery and printing ink and toners.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is fifty-six years old. He lives in a small village in Imereti Region, West Georgia with his wife, Inga. Inga and Alexander earn a living through agriculture. They run a dairy farm with two milk cows. The family uses the milk to produce traditional Georgian cheese. They sell on average 40 kg of this product on the local open market. Along with the dairy farm, Alexander is busy with melon growing. He grows melons on the family-owned one hectare of land and sells on average seven tones of melons to local greengrocery retailers. Also Alexander owns a tractor. He provides various agricultural services (tilling, moving) to neighborhood farmers and is paid for this service. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Alexander requested credit to purchase wheels for the tractor. He has to change the old wheels, as they are already damaged and Alexander had to stop using the tractor because of them. After changing the wheels he will continue working and get again the income. In the future Alexander plans to make some savings, to reinvest in the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase tractor wheels.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is a 61-year-old woman with two adult children. She is married to Said and they live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanashabani owns a food stall which has been operating for the last four years. She sells her goods both from home and door-to-door, selling to the neighborhood. The high price of commodities is a major challenge facing her business. Mwanashabani weaves mats as her side business to supplement her income. She aims at opening a café in the future.
The loan of 20,000 KES will enable her to purchase a sack of rice and balers for wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice and balers for wheat flour.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-four years old. A business lady, she is married to Joseph who is a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which she uses to cater for her family's basic needs.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, wheat flour and maize meal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, wheat flour and maize meal.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 41 years old and lives in Centro Hulpa, Tudela. He is married with one child. 

Lucel works as a jeepney driver and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for the repair of his vehicle.
 
Lucel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a month. In the future, he hopes to send his child to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the repair of his jeepney

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn, sixty, has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to the rice farming business. She is a widowed mother who lives with her only child, who is thirty-four, in Kampong Chhnang province. She describes herself as humble and a poorly-educated farmer who just owns a few hectares of farmland to cultivate rice crops. Rice is the main source of income for the family. 

Orn would like to use the loan amount of USD 500 to prepare a religious ceremony in her family. She will buy ropes and presents for the monks, beverages and food to serve her guests. She hopes to receive the loan from our lenders and she is very thankful for a constant help.

loans.use: to prepare a religious ceremony.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is forty-four years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel. She is married with three children. 

Emma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a fishing net, hooks and gasoline.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Emma hopes to have enough savings for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net, hooks and gasoline.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is fifty-one years old. A business lady, she is a widow with three children. She has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her children. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase cloth materials and a modern sewing machine. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Mrs Xuan was born in 1949. She lives in Tien Duong village, Dong Anh district. Both Mrs Xuan and her husband raise chickens, pigs and birds for a living. They started their business four years ago. Their total income is 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong per month. 

Mrs Xuan joined SEDA's credit program in 2005. In this loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for pigs, chickens and birds.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs, chickens and birds.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Emily is married to Gilbert and blessed with six children aged 14, 13, 10, 8, 4, and 2 years respectively. She is a tailor, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase cloth materials for her business. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. 

Her dream is to one day own a boutique shop as well as educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Purevsuren earns a living by making winter clothes for babies and casual clothes for men and women which she sells in a local outdoor market. She lives with her son and mother in the ger (or nomadic tent) area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son attends a secondary school and her mother is a pensioner. Mrs. Purevsuren's business is the main source of her family's income. She started her business in 2002 with little money, but her sales volume has expanded to the point where she has many permanent customers. She gets the raw materials she uses to make her clothes from domestic suppliers and abroad. Mrs. Purevsuren wants to increase her output and business earnings. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy more raw materials and some clothes from her suppliers. Her goal for the future is to own a clothes shop in downtown Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making clothing and some clothes from her suppliers.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married and has four children.

Mona has been a tailor since 2009. She professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and children. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2,400 loan to rent a boutique store to display the clothing. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a boutique store to display the clothing.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking business-man. He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonjargal, forty-four, runs a grocery store in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She lives with her parents-in-law and her husband and two children in her new house. Her husband plants vegetables in their backyard for their private use. She and her husband built a new house in 2010 and some decoration and building parts still have not been completed due to the lack of funding. Previously, they used to live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. Usually a ger is cold and uncomfortable to live in for big families. 

Otgonjargal needs a loan to buy a heated-floor rather than using one of the smoky and harmful coal furnaces. These cost too much, especially in winter time. Coal usage creates a lot of air pollution and is toxic to the air in the cities of Mongolia. In last several years, air pollution and air quality has become one of the biggest issues in most Mongolian households and big cities. 

Otgonjargal is also planning to use some part of her loan to increase the groceries in her grocery store. This will expand her sales volume and increase her business earnings.

loans.use: To buy a heated-floor to heat her house so she doesn't need a smokey and harmful coal furnace.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is thirty-five years old, married, and blessed with two children aged eight and three. She owns a shop, a business she started eleven years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,300. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase tea leaves, sugar, washing detergent, vegetables and tomatoes to sell. 

The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock for her business. Her dream is to see her business expand as well as educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves, sugar, washing detergent, vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a widowed woman. She has three children whose ages range from ten to eighteen. She is their sole provider, so she works hard day in and day out to support them. She describes herself as a customer-friendly and social woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs two staff members. Her business is located near many garages, schools and estates and her primary customers are students, mechanics and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of ingredients.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients to use in preparing meals to sell. She needs cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, flour etc. This is the first loan she is requesting from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to run the restaurant within her own business premise area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her children's school fees and financial needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is forty-nine years old and is a married woman with three children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Beatriz has been in the business of raising hogs for nine years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month from this business. Aside from raising hogs, Beatriz also makes hats out dried buri palm leaves.

Beatriz is requesting a loan to purchase piglets and feed. She hopes her income will increase and will enable her to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 38-year-old man; he is married to Louisa, a 34-year-old lady, and lives with his seven children: Febriana, 15; Christin, 10; Marki, 8; Delfi, 7; Rivan, 4; Riki, 2; and Liani, 2 months. 

As a father of seven children, Bernard works hard to fulfill the needs of his beloved family. For more than 10 years Bernard has been operating a house rental business. The strategic location near a university complex brings good impact for his business to grow. Currently he has 15 rooms and all are rented. Bernard dreams of renovating the older room and building more rooms to be rented but he needs capital assistance to do so. Bernard then submitted a loan application to request IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to purchase building materials such as sand, bricks, cement, zinc etc. Bernard looks forward to seeing the improvement of the business through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand, bricks, cement, zinc, etc. for his rental property

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is married and has a four-year-old child. He sells clothes and necklaces to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He also runs a motorbike transport business to supplement his income. 

Bernard works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to expand his business and employ people.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and necklaces.

loans.use: to buy clothes and necklaces.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is 56 years old and is a married woman with 8 children aged between 12 and 31 years. Prima and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Prima's husband also drives a tricycle for extra income. Prima does her best to keep their farm productive and her family in good health. She has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers and tricycle spare parts. Prima hopes for her income to increase so that she will be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and tricycle spare parts

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-six years old. A business lady, she is married to Stephen who is a business man and they are blessed with one child. She has been running a greengrocer business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joyce will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her cater for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas runs a quarry business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for eleven years.This involves making building blocks and stones. He is forty-three years old, married to Ann, and they have four children aged eighteen, thirteen, nine and seven. 

This will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy more quarrying tools and equipment and thereby increase his rate of production. He also plans to add more workforce by employing more workers so as to be able to meet the high demand of his clients.

In the future, Douglas hopes to grow his business and start building rental houses hence making more income.

loans.use: To buy more quarry tools and employ more workers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is twenty-six years old, married, and blessed with a three-month-old baby. He owns a shop, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase three bales of baking flour, 20kgs of sugar and ten crates of soda.

The anticipated profit will plowed back into his business. His dream is to see his business expand and to support his family by ensuring they lead a good life. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of baking flour, 20kgs of sugar and ten crates of soda.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty-eight. He is married and lives with his wife and his mother.

Hasan has owned a cafeteria since 2008, offering different types of sandwiches and beverages. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for $2400 as “Youth loan” in order to renovate his cafeteria’s walls and floors and to install a ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate his cafeteria’s walls and floors and to install a ceiling.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in school. She operates a food stall where she sells her goods from home to her neighbors. 

Fatuma owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She sells her goods mostly to her neighbors. She joined Yehu to get access to loans. Food is her greatest monthly expense. The loan of Ksh 20,000 will help her to purchase rice, wheat flour, and sugar.

Her goal is to open a café in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is fifty-one years old and is a married woman with two children aged nine and twenty-one. Her husband works as a welder.

Crisanta has had a sari-sari store business for four years. She sells bread, biscuits, shampoo, bath and detergent soap and spices. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP with her business. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods and toiletries. 

Crisanta is hoping for increased sales and profitability. She plans to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Ms. Phuong was born in 1978. She has one child who is now in secondary school. Her husband passed away. She makes votive offerings. She started this job in 2009. Her total income is 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong each month. 

Ms. Phuong joined the credit program of SEDA in 2003. In a previous loan cycle, she borrowed 8,050,000 Vietnamese dong and repaid on the due date. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong to buy votive offerings and build her house.

loans.use: to buy votive offerings and build her house.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George used his previous loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy feed for pigs.  The pigs matured and he sold them hence making good profits.  He used the additional income from his business to expand the pigsty.  He has requested another loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs and feed.

loans.use: To buy feed and pigs.

loans.name: Cay's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cay was born in 1960. She has one daughter who is a student. Her husband is a porter. 

Mrs. Cay’s main income is from collecting scrap and raising chickens. She has worked in this area for eight years. Each month, she earns about 3,000,000 VND and the total income of her family is about 6,000,000 VND. Mrs. Cay has been in the credit program since 2003 and has repaid on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and to raise capital for collecting scrap.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Mrs. Da is 53 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

Mrs. Ly is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and raise capital for collecting scrap.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chi was born in 1976 and has three children. Two of them are at elementary school and the other is at secondary school. Her husband uses a horse to carry goods for customers. 

Mrs. Chi is a worker. She has worked for her company for 4 years. Each month, she earns about 3,000,000 VND and the total income of her family is about 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. Mrs. Chi joined SEDA’s program in 2004 and has repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy an electric bike and pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy an electric bike and pay tuition fees for her children

loans.name: Abdel Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has two children; one of them works.

Abdel Hussein has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to purchase a generator, a split air conditioner and to install a sliding door. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a generator, a split air conditioner and to install a sliding door

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is thirty-eight years old, married to Nelly, and blessed with two children aged seven and two. He is in the transport business, which he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 60,000 to repair and maintain his vehicles. The anticipated profit will help him venture into another line of business. 

He dreams of his business doing well in the future. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his vehicles.

loans.name: Inty Raymi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTY RAYMI” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan  Pablo II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maxima. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en tejido de alpaca, venta de mantas a groche, venta de golosinas y varios, elaboración de chompas, chalinas y guantes, tienda de barrio y venta de verduras.

La señora Maxima, indica que es la primera vez integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración de mantas de vicuña, mismo que aprendió de sus hermanas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lanas), mismos que comprará de la frontera Bolivia Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud y crédito y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The Inty Raymi communal bank will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  It is made up of seven members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Maxima.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses, among which we have alpaca wool handicrafts; blankets; candy and other sales; making sweaters, scarves, and gloves; neighborhood store; and vegetable sales.

Maxima indicates that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend.  Currently she has a business making vicuna blankets, which she learned from her sisters.

The loan she will get now is to increase her capital by purchasing wool, which she will buy on the Bolivia-Peru border.  After production, she will sell on order to customers.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training, the loan, and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace varios años don Francisco se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación son las plagas que invaden al cultivo , ya que el no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder darle el mantenimiento adecuado y así poder  sacar una producción de calidad , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva ya que son muchas las personas que se benefician con este programas para mejorar la producción .El préstamo lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en:
Francisco is a humble farmer in Ticuantepe. He lives with his family and his plan for the future is to improve living conditions.
