Francisco has been growing pineapples for several years.  The greatest problem is infestations that afflict the crop because he lacks sufficient capital to provide proper crop maintenance to attain a quality production.  

He is grateful for the support Afodenic has given him through Kiva loans because many people are benefitted from this program to improve production.  

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Koov

texts.en:
Koov is age 62 and he is a loving father of four children living in Kampong Chhnang province. He devotes his time to a crops-farming business on his own land. He is very diligent in his daily tasks to ensure a comfortable living for the family.

Another part of the family’s income is provided by his wife, who owns and manages a store from their house. She sells grocery things to local people in her commune.

Koov now is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase timber and construction materials to renovate his house. This is his second loan and he already paid off the previous loan successfully. He hopes that this loan will provide a comfortable living status for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber and construction materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. Her husband works a casual labourer. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 11 to 28 years. She describes herself as kind. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, onions, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located along  a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that she is currently sickly.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell; this is her first loan. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler and run a retail shop  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to financially support her family from the profits that will be generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Lucy who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy pigs and animal feed. 


With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs and  animal  feed

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 40-year-old single man, and he has been working in his grocery store for 20 years.

Abass is a hard-working man with a very good reputation. He is well known in his area and liked by most of his customers because of his special customer service.

Abass applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with special spring & summer goods in addition to mobile phone prepaid cards. The prepaid cards are highly requested, that's why he is putting so much effort to invest this loan in them.

He is looking forward to opening a mobile phone sales shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special spring & summer goods in addition to mobile phone prepaid cards.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS” y sigue viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Su actividad económica principal de la socia Nieves es la venta comida, ella sigue tendiendo su restaurante donde prepara ricos potajes, ella con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales que realizó. 

En esta oportunidad Nieves requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras y otros insumos. 
  
La socia Nieves agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nieves continues being a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank and is still living in the city of Cusco.  Her main economic activity is selling food and she continues tending to her restaurant where she prepares delicious stews.  She did very well with the previous loan thanks to the punctual payments she made.

On this occasion, Nieves needs the loan to buy ingredients like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, vegetables and others, for example.

Nieves is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y sigue viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco.
  
La socia Yolanda por el momento se dedica a su casa pero antes se dedicaba a la venta de desayunos pero le fue mal pero su esposo es el soporte de la familia ósea él trabaja en un centro de venta de combustibles. 

En esta oportunidad la socia Yolanda requiere el préstamo para uso personal para comprar medicamentos y para la terapia de lenguaje de su hija. 
 
La socia Yolanda agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is still a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank and still lives in the city of Cusco.  At present, she’s a housewife but she used to sell breakfasts but didn’t do too well.  Her husband supports the family; he works at a fuel distribution center.

On this occasion Yolanda needs the loan for personal use: to buy medicine and for her daughter’s speech therapy.

Yolanda is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for her daughter's speech therapy.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 50-year-old divorced woman who is childless. She has been selling charcoal at the market for the past five years and was previously a farmer. She dreams of opening a charcoal depot in future and hiring employees. 

Fatuma lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. High transport cost is her major challenge while food for family members is her greatest monthly expense. Good Yehu products attracted her to join Yehu. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 30,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 52 years old, married to Bainidu, and blessed with four children over 18 years of age. She sells pawpaws, a business she started 12 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

She has requested a second loan worth KES. 70,000 to purchase more pawpaws for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock. Her dream is to lead a good life in future.

loans.use: To purchase  more pawpaws for sale.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es casado con un hijo. Desde hace cinco años, él se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, cuando se caso. Luego su papá murió y se hizo cargo de sus hermanos menores ya que vive en el terreno de su padre.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una ciudad que esta a diez kilómetros de su casa, debe pagar para que le transporten los insumos hasta su casa, luego debe trasladarlos en carreta hasta el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos.

José solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar: abono, semillas, fertilizantes y para la preparación de la tierra. De esta manera, él pretende mejorar y aumentar el nivel de producción de maíz, al igual que el nivel de vida de su familia.
Él desea construir una vivienda para su familia y continuar mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia con una mejor producción.
texts.en:
José, 22, is married with one child.  He has worked in agricultural labor since he got married five years ago.  Then his father died and he took charge of his younger brothers, because he lives on his father's land.

He buys his agricultural supplies in a city ten kilometers from his house.  He has to pay for the supplies to be transported to his house; then he moves them by cart to the place where he has his crops.

José is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure, seed, and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.  In this way he intends to improve and increase the level of corn production as well as his family's standard of living.

He wants to build a home for his family and continue to improve their standard of living with a better output.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a focused woman. Previously, Hellen was employed at a retail store where she was working as a secretary. She decided to start a new retail store where she provides services such as photocopying, scanning, printing etc. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a busy business environment and her primary customers are students. 

Hellen describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stationery. Her business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will increase the amount of her customers.

loans.use: to buy stationery.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha has two children, one is in college and the other is married. She sells kerosene from her home, a business she has been doing for the past five years. Mwanasha dreams of opening a kiosk in future. Her other source of income includes sales from farm produce. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Price fluctuation is her major challenge and food is her greatest monthly expense. She chose to join Yehu so as to get access to funds.

With the loan of KES 10,000, Mwanasha plans to purchase jerrycans of kerosene to sell.

loans.use: to purchase jerrycans of kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a single man. He has no children yet. Dan works very hard to support himself. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a barber shop where he provides haircut services. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located within a market and his primary customers are people visiting the market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from the customers and frequent power blackouts.

Dan will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a shaving machine. His business goal is to provide the best haircut to his customers within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will use the profits generated for paying school fees for himself in order to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is  32 years old. An enterprising business lady, she is married to Musyoka who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children aged 20, 17 and 10 years. She has been running a greengrocery business in an open air market for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Dorcas will use the loan to purchase green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district, Thol and her family make a living by farming rice and planting cassava. They have been in this business for seven years. Thol is 28 years old and has two daughters who are still in school. Her business usually meets challenges when the price of cassava drops. 

As a leader, Thol and her other group members have requested second loans from VisionFund. Thol used her portion of the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizers and to plough her farmland. She hopes this loan will allow her to grow more crops and then sell them for a higher price so that she can feed her family better and pay for her girls’ education fees.

loans.use: to buy fertlizers, seedlings and to plough her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas”,  ella nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene 5 hijos, 

La socia Felicitas tiene un puesto de venta donde vende fruta como por ejemplo mandarinas, naranjas, plátanos, uvas, papayas entre otros más, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos y con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y con las ganancias pudo invertir en los gastos de económicos de la familia.    

La socia Felicitas en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mandarinas, caña de azúcar, chirimoya y coco.  

La socia Felicitas está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member who continues to participate in the Communal Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women). She was born in the city of Sicuani, but currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Felicitas has a vending post where she sells fruit such as tangerines, oranges, bananas, grapes, papayas, and other products. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who helps her children get ahead. Felicitas did very well with her previous loan and used the earnings to invest in her family's expenses.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for buying merchandise such as tangerines, sugar cane, cherimoya, and coconuts. Felicitas is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy tangerines, sugar cane, cherimoya, and coconuts.

loans.name: Memsa

texts.en:
Memsa is a woman with five children, married to Bakari, who repairs bicycles. Four of their children are in school while the other is still young. For the last 8 years, she has been operating a food stall, selling to the general public. Other sources of livelihood include the sale of coconuts. 

Memsa dreams of opening a restaurant in future. She describes market competition to be her major challenge. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She intends to use her loan to purchase stock of rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are tailors and schools. 

Emma describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from the customers. In addition, Emma does poultry farming to increase her income. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes and shoes for selling. Her business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 35 year old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She operates a food stall, selling from a school to the students. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Mariam has been in this business for the past 10 years, and she aspires to open a kiosk in the future. She gets support from her spouse. Seasonality is her major challenge since her business stops as the schools close. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and cassava.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and cassava.

loans.name: Agboinou Philippe

texts.fr: Agboinou Philippe est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Benin. Agboinou Philippe a appris le métier de broderie et de couture. Agboinou Philippe est marié à une ménagère du nom de Agathe. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge dont deux constituent leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Agboinou Philippe vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a cinq ans environs, Agboinou Philippe exerce l'activité de couture et de broderie ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Agboinou Philippe s’approvisionne en matériels de couture au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder, Agboinou Philippe sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Agboinou Philippe is 32 years old and lives in Benin. Agboinou Philippe learned the professions of embroidery and sewing. Agboinou Philippe is married to a housewife named Agathe. The couple has three dependent children of whom two are their own children. Among the children, certain go to school. Agboinou Philippe lives together with his wife and his children. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together.

For about 5 years, Agboinou Philippe has been practicing the business of sewing and embroidery, which allows him to better meet his family's needs. Agboinou Philippe gets his sewing materials in Nigeria. Seeking to satisfy his clientèle and with the aim of acquiring a new embroidery machine, Agboinou Philippe is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. His previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 39 years old, married and has an 18-year-old child. She cultivates her land to plant rice crops and then sells her harvest at the market. She works hard to keep her farm productive. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor. Elizabeth hopes to produce more rice to sell to her community.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Vung

texts.en:
Vung, 19, is shown in the photograph with her husband in front of their house located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. This couple has given birth to a lovely young child. They work in the same type of business, cultivating rice and seasonal crops on their existing farmland. 

Vung enjoys doing her business because it earns her a good income to satisfy the family. She wants to make improvements to her business by expanding the land size and increasing her production. Due to the shortage of sufficient funds, she would like to apply for a loan from HKL to purchase an additional piece of land to develop her farming business. In the future, she wants to save money for her child’s education and to ensure a bright future for her child. She thanks in advance for the support for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piece of land to develop her farming business.

loans.name: Chrib's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Dambae distric, Chrib and her family have been farming rice and growing cassava to support their living expenses for years. Chrib has three children, of which, two are dependent on the family. 

This is the first time Chrib has applied for a loan from VisionFund. Being a leader, Chrib will use her portion of the loan to cultivate her farmland and to pay labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to better feed her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her farmland and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Gran Sismo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Gran Sismo” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, artesanía en muebles, artesanía en tejidos, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Jessica, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón, chaleco con rayas y polera negra, en su cuello lleva un adorno, y su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de paquetería y también en ventas de comida, se ocupa de estos negocios desde hace 1 año. Trabaja los Sábados y Domingos desde las 11ºº hasta la noche sin horario.
Su mercadería la compra siempre en Santiago ya que es más barato y gran variedad de productos.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para su negocio.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio y poder ampliarlo y así optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus 2 hijos quienes estudian. Sus sueños son poder tener su propio local de comida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente a gusto con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe mucho respeto y confianza.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Gran Sismo” (Great Earthquake) and it has 15 enterprising members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are found: clothes sales, furniture making, textile weaving, fruit and vegetable sales, fast-food sales and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Talca.

Jessica, communal bank president, is standing in the photo in the first row from right to left wearing pants, a striped sweater and black shirt.  She’s wearing a necklace and her hair is loose.

She has a parcel service business and she also sells food.  She’s been in these businesses for a year.  She works Saturdays and Sundays from 11am until night with no fixed schedule.

She always buys her merchandise in Santiago because it’s less expensive and there is a great variety of products.  She will use the loan to buy supplies for her business.  Her goals are to stay in business and to expand it to attain a better quality of life.

She lives with her husband and two children who are studying.  Her dream is to be able to have her own food stand.

She’s very happy and grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza gives her.  She also comments that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and with her communal bank group because there is much mutual respect and trust.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region located in the center of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region it being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.

There is a curious reference to Talca in Chile, the phrase: “Talca, París y Londres.”   Among the myths associated with this, some say this derives from something originally uttered by an Englishman “Talca parece Londres” because of the abundant fog that frequently blankets the city in winter, similar to what happens in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 32 years old. She lives in a small village of Abasha District, with her family: husband – Roman, two children (10 and 7 years old) and mother in law. Both children go to school. 

All adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for them. They have a milk cow and a pig. Shorena produces and sells, on average, 20 kg of cheese per month. Also, the family sells, on average, 10 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns 2 hectares of land, where they grow maize, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. Shorena and Roman work hard on their land, especially during spring and summer seasons. They sell harvested products locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family from agriculture is 450 Laris. The family is regarded to live under the poverty level and they receive monthly social assistance from local government in the amount of 126 Laris. 

Shorena has requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow and will be able to produce 100% more cheese. Her sales will increase and the family will get more income. Shorena and Roman will use the increased income for providing better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Assani

texts.fr: Assani est âgé de 42 ans et vit au Benin. Assani a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris le métier de soudure. Assani est marié à un certain Aline. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Assani vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a dix ans environs, Assani exerce l'activité de soudure et vend également du gaz et des matériels de soudure ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Assani s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Assani sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Assani is 42 years old and lives in Benin. Assani stopped school at the primary level and learned the profession of welder. Assani is married to a certain Aline. The couple has five dependent children of whom four are their own children. All the children go to school. Assani lives together with his wife and his children. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together. 

For about 10 years, Assani has been working as a welder and also sells gas and welding materials, which allows him to better meet the needs of his family. Assani gets his supplies in Nigeria. With the aim of satisfying his clientèle and in order to improve his business, Assani is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. His previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy welding materials and bottles of gas.

loans.name: Danak's Group

texts.en:
Danak is 32 years old and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living for the family, Danak and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for eight years. Danak and the family live in a rural area located in Tbaung Khmum district. 

Danak obtained the first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and that loan has helped her to generate more income as she used it to buy more farmland to grow more crops and as a result sell them for good money. 

Danak is now obtaining a second loan from VisionFund and she also leads a group of three members. As a leader, she used her portion of the loan to buy seedlings for her rice paddy and fertilizers for her crops. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more money so that she can have enough to finance her children's education until they finish school.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a 50 year old woman with five children, three of whom are in school while the other two are over school age. For the last year, she has been operating a kiosk selling to the local residents. Other sources of income include income from the spouse. Mwanasiti describes market competition to be her major challenge and that her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food. She aspires to open a wholesale business in the future. Mwanasiti lives in her own house that has piped water, but no electricity.

The loan of KES 30,000 will enable her add stock of beans, rice, and wheat flour to her kiosk.

loans.use: to add stock of beans, rice, and wheat flour to her kiosk.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
Doña María Paula tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, vive en una colonia del municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara junto a sus dos hijos menores.
Ella  hace 6 años estableció su propio negocio de venta de ropa en general y novedades como adornos, bolsos, champú, cremas, lociones, calzado etc. anteriormente trabajo en una fábrica de jugos pero en busca de generar más ingresos a su hogar decidió establecerlo. Ha solicitado ya cuatro préstamos anteriormente los que le han ayudado a incrementar el inventario con variedad de productos. Actualmente está solicitando el quinto préstamo para mantenerlo surtido de ropa como blusas pantalones, camisas para mujer, niños y hombres y ropa interior e incrementar las ventas. En un futuro ella desea tener un local amplio donde pueda colocar más producto para la venta.
texts.en:
María Paula, 50, is a single mother of five children.  She lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Quimistan, Santa Bárbara with her two youngest children.

Six years ago she opened her business selling clothes in general and miscellaneous items like decorations, purses, shampoo, cream, lotions, footwear, etc.  She used to work in a juice factory but seeking to earn more household income she decided to establish it.  She has already asked for four previous loans that have helped her to stay well-stocked with a varied inventory.

She’s currently asking for her fifth loan to keep it stocked with items like blouses, pants and t-shirts for women, children and men and underwear to increase sales.  In the future she’d like to have a spacious locale in order to display more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her store.

loans.name: G.s. La Holla Y El Comal Group

texts.es: G.S. LA HOLLA está conformado por dos integrantes Rosaura, y Maria Magda estas emprendedora se unieron para apoyarse en los financiamientos que brindad fundación león 2000 para invertir en sus negocios  se han podido llevar muy bien, ya que son emprendedoras responsables, buena pagas, trabajadoras, en la actualidad tienen actividades económica diferentes  pero con gran demanda de sus clientes , Rosaura tiene venta de ropa nueva de forma ambulantes  y en su casa de habitación ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar más productos para invertir en el negocio y así sasfifacer la demanda de sus clientela los productos son:  Camisas de Mujer, de Hombre, de Niño, Faldas de diferentes tamaños , calcetines, ropa interior, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group (G.S.) LA HOLLA is made up of Rosaura and Maria Magda, both of whom are entrepreneurs who decided to form a group to support each other in financing loans with Fundación Leon 2000. They have been doing well in their businesses, since they are responsible, hard-working women who work consistently to keep up with their clients’ demands.

Rosaura makes a living selling clothing from her home, and she also travels around selling clothing in other locations in her area. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase products and invest in her business, with the hope of satisfying customer demand. She plans to purchase: shirts for men, women and children, skirts in various sizes, socks, underwear and other items.

loans.use: to purchase shirts for men, women and children, skirts in different sizes, socks, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 51-year-old tailor in Mombasa. She is married and has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last nine years with great success. She also sells charcoal to supplement her income. 

This is Margaret’s fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth. 

She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build business premises on. She hopes to have a prosperous life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widow. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 22 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store where she sells dresses and fabric. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are schools and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fabric.

She will be using the  Kes 20,000 loan to buy cloth materials, thread, buttons and zips. Her business goal is to expand her business into a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her children's school fees from the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials, threads, buttons and zips.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Yong is 50 years old and a married woman who has been residing in Baray district. She was born and grew up in the family farm. She has been operating a rice faming business for almost 12 years. She cultivates rice crops twice a year along with her husband. Besides farming, Yong operates a fishing business for additional income. From these activities, she is able to make an income in the neighborhood of USD 9.20 per day to cover her daily expenses. 

To further expand her business, she is seeking a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a plot of land for farming purposes. She hopes that she can obtain a good outcome from her investment and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for farming purposes.

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru: Махмадрачаб житель района Дангара. Ему 66 лет. Он женат. У него 10 детей. Его дети живут отдельно с мужьями и женами. Его дочь занимается шитьем. Сам Махмадрачаб агроном, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Он берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки своей жене.
texts.en: Mahmadrajab lives in the Dangara region. He is 66 years old, married, and has 10 children who live apart from their parents with their husbands and wives. Mahmadrajab's wife is a seamstress, while he is an agronomist, working at an orchard farm. He is taking this loan to buy a new sewing machine for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Elsa Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de San Pedro en la ciudad de Cuenca, que se encuentra asentada en un accidente geográfico el mismo que le da su característica especial, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 32 años de edad, está casada concibiendo en su unión matrimonial dos hijos quienes se encuentran de 12 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Elsa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, en el tiempo que tiene libre se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catalogo, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 5 años, labora en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando ropa y cosméticos para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener una buseta escolar para laborar en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the Génesis (Genesis) communal bank and lives in the city of Cuenca’s San Pedro area which is located in a geographic fracture that gives it its special character.  It’s the country’s third most important city economically; it has great natural and cultural richness and its cuisine enchants visitors’ palates.  Its residents still preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Elsa is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 12 and 11 years old.  Her oldest son attends secondary school and her youngest attends the little local elementary school.  Her husband is a private employee and the house she lives in is hers.

Elsa does her household chores and in her free time sells clothes and cosmetics via catalogue; she’s been in business five years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.

She’s been in the communal bank three years and will use her new loan to buy clothes and cosmetics for her business.  Her dream is to have a school minibus to go into this business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es: La socia Carlota sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y sigue viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia Carlota sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa y en esta oportunidad la socia Carlota requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo polos, pantalones, blusas, chompas y otras cosas más. La socia Carlota agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Carlota is still a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank and still lives in the city of Cusco.  She continues selling clothes and on this occasion Carlota needs the loan to buy merchandise like t-shirts, pants, blouses, jackets and other things.  Carlota is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa is 62 years old, married, and lives with his wife in their own house  in Hovd province.  He and his spouse Tsetsegmaa are retired. This borrower started  an agriculture business in 2011. He has 2 hectares of his own land  and he is running a business  planting  and  selling  potatoes and other vegetables. 

Their standard of living is average. They both have a pension as a source of permanent family income. The formation of their characters is good. Bataa is talkative  and open.  "For my whole life I have worked  for the good and  I can not sit on my hands after retirement," he says. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase seeds, fertilizer  and  to cultivate a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer  and  to cultivate a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Yoeng's Group

texts.en:
Yoeng is aged 37 years old and married. She lives with her family in a village located in the Preahnet Preah district. She has three children, two of whom are still dependent on her, and one of the dependent children is still in school. To make a living, she has been raising pigs for several years. Her husband is a paid worker and helps generate income to support the family. With her current business, Yoeng manages to earn around 18,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. Now Yoeng is leading this group of two members to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy feeds for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to raise her pigs to be healthy and fat, and she also hopes to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag, aged 34, is married and lives with her husband and 2 children in her own fenced-in house in Hovd province. She has run a business repairing shoes at the central market since 2005. Her husband helps with her shoe repair business. They built a house with their earned revenue. Their son Gaanjuur, and daughter Gantuya are 13 and 8 years old, respectively, and go to secondary school. Tungalag also works in a kindergarten as a service worker. Their standard of living is average. The formation of their characters is good. They are hardworking and diligent. Tungalag is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase a car which will be used for a new taxi business for her husband. She has planted vegetables in her fenced yard this year. She is thinking of buying her own land for the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a car which will be used for a new taxi business for her husband.

loans.name: Akovognon

texts.fr: Akovognon est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Benin. Akovognon a appris le métier de broderie et de couture. Akovognon est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Emilienne. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois constituent leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Akovognon vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a onze ans environs, Akovognon exerce l'activité de couture et de broderie ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Akovognon  s’approvisionne en matériels de couture au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder, Akovognon sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akovognon is 37 and lives in Benin. He learned the trade of embroidering and tailoring. He is married to a hairdresser named Emilienne. The couple are raising four children, of whom three are their biological children. Some of these children are enrolled in school. 

 Akovognon lives with his wife and children. The couple share in supporting their household.  Akovognon has been working at tailoring and embroidery for about 11 years. This is what best allows him to cover the needs of his family. He buys his tailoring materials in Nigeria. Wishing to satisfy his clientele and also to obtain a new embroidery machine, Akovognon is requesting his first-ever loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Norte Grande Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Norte Grande” está conformado por 16 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente; venta de frutas, artículos para bebes, alimentos, feriantes, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Renca ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Rosa, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pie ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaqueta negra, su cabello lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente a la venta de jugos, y también dulces en general, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días en la feria.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va utilizando los compra en un centro de abastecimiento de frutas y verduras.
Con el crédito comprará frutas para abastecer su negocio. Las metas en su negocio son poder crecer, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto poder optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Rosa vive con su madre y una hermana. Sus sueños son poder tener un negocio propio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Norte Grande” (Big North) and it has 16 entrepreneurs who are merchants specifically fruit selling, items for babies, food, street market sellers, crafts and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Santiago’s Renca commune.

In the photo, Rosa, communal bank secretary, is in the second row, first from left to right, wearing a black jacket; her hair is short.

She’s a merchant who specifically sells juice and candy in general.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and she works every day in a street market. The merchandise and ingredients she uses she buys at a fruit and vegetable wholesale market.

She will use the loan to buy fruit to stock her business.  Her business goal is to be able to grow to generate more income thus obtaining better quality of life.

Rosa lives with her mother and a sister.  Her dream is to be able to have a business of her own.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the group she participates in because they are united; there is respect and trust.

Renca is a commune located in the northwest of the Santiago (Capital of Chile) metropolitan region.  It’s a commune with strong community action among which the community television station, Renca TV, stands out that was created to promote the commune’s cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Shavkidin

texts.ru: Шавкидин добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством, а Шавкидин один работает и содержит семью. Он хочет вырастить своих детей в хороших условиях. Шавкидин является электриком Государственного Унитарного Предприятия Таджикской Алюминиевой Компании. Шавкидин хотел бы получить займ для установки дверей и окон, а также штукатурки стен дома. Шавкидин надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Shavkidin is a kind and hard-working person. He is married and is raising four children. Shavkidin's wife takes care of the household, while he is the only breadwinner in the family, working as an electrician at the State Unitary Enterprise of the Tajik Aluminum Company. Shavkidin would like to provide good living conditions for his children. He would like to obtain a loan to install doors and windows, and to stucco the walls of his house. He is hoping for your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to install doors and windows and to stucco the walls of his house

loans.name: Indyra Samara

texts.es: La joven Indyra , es habitante del municipio de la Concepción , junto a su mamá , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando , La joven Indyra desde hace dos años se dedica a la ventas de zapatos ; ya que con las ganancias paga su universidad para salir adelante , pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos  necesarios para invertir mas y así mejorar sus ingresos .El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mas zapatos ya que tiene varios encargos y no puede satisfacer a sus clientes por sus limitaciones económicas .
texts.en:
Young Indyra lives with her mother in the town of La Concepción.
Her plans for the future are to improve their living standards and stay in school. 
Indyra has been selling shoes for two years, and she uses her income to pay for university in order to get ahead, but she lacks the financial resources she needs to invest further and improve her income.
She needs the loan to purchase more shoes, because she has several orders, and she is unable to satisfy her customers due to financial limitations.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a single woman who has two children attending school. She has been operating a food stall for the past six years, and she aspires to open a hotel and hire employees in the future. Halima also plaits as another source of income. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her two children. Her primary customers are the general public since her food stall is located at the market center. She plans to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Jonaphil

texts.en:
Jonaphil is 20 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel. She is married with two children. 
To earn a living, Jonaphil has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Jonaphil has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase flour, cooking oil, bananas, and sugar. Jonaphil has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jonaphil would like success in her new business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, bananas, and sugar.

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 51ans et le moins âgé a 36ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de bois de chauffe depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au secteur 28 Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les voisins. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Elle est contente de voir ses petits fils grandir.

Elle veut s’acheter  un demi (1/2) camion de bois de chauffe.

Mme veut acquérir son permis urbain d’habitation(P.U.H)  avec  économies. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation et en plus de la vente du bois, elle veut acheter des moutons  pour faire l’élevage.
texts.en:
Mme HAOUA is a widow and mother of five children. The oldest is 51 and the youngest 36 years old. No one attends school. She is responsible for two people. 

She has been selling firewood for 11 years. She buys her firewood in Sector 28, Ouagadougou. Her customers are her neighbors. She is doing well, as is her whole family. She is happy seeing her grandchildren grow up. 

She wants to buy a half truckload of firewood. 

Mme Haoua wishes to acquire her urban habitation permit (P.U.H.) with her savings. She would like to build a house to live in. Besides selling firewood, she wants to buy some sheep to raise.

loans.use: to buy half a truckload of firewood.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 43-year-old businessman in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He operates a cyber café, a business he has been doing for the past three years.

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a photocopying machine. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and upgrade the internet connection in his cyber café. 

He hopes to open another cyber café in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Nomeir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 19 years old. He is single and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Nomeir is a barber. He opened his own shop in 2009. He offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Mery  Antonieta

texts.es:
La Señora Mery es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de los Cerezos en la ciudad de Cuenca, que se encuentra asentada en un accidente geográfico el mismo que le da su característica especial, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Mery tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 25, 24 gemelos, 23, 20 y 9 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, un hijo es casado y vive independiente, un hijo soltero trabaja y vive  independiente, su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico latonero y tiene un taller propio, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Mery se dedica a su hogar y para aportar a la economía de su hogar vende cosméticos por catalogo de varias marcas, tiene este negocio hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra cosméticos de oferta para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es que todos sus hijos estudien para que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the community bank Génesis.  She lives in the Cerezos area in the city of Cuenca, which is located in an interesting geographical epicenter and it is the third most economically important city in the country.  It has a rich natural and cultural base and its varying cuisine is the main attraction for visitors.  The people in the area still retain the culture and traditions of their people.

Mery is 49 years old, she is married, she has six children (25, 24-year-old twins, 20, and 9 years old).  Three of her children work and help support the family.  One of her sons is married and lives independently.  One son is single, working, and lives independently.  Her youngest daughter is studying at a school in the city.  Her husband is a welder and has his own shop.  They own their home.

Mery works at home, and in order to help support her household, she sells a variety of brands of cosmetics.  She has had this business for 3 years and she works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She is seeking her second loan from the community bank to invest in the purchase of cosmetics so she can offer a larger variety of merchandise to her customers.

Her dream is that all of her children will study and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 49 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is single with two children. 
To earn a living, Caroline has a grocery store. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Caroline has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase sardines, sugar, salt, noodles, soft drinks, and shampoo.
Caroline has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Caroline would like success in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sardines, sugar, salt, noodles, soft drinks, and shampoo.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is married and has one child.  He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years. He has employed two people. 

Japheth says he has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  

Japheth hopes to grow his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity paid her previous loans well and on time. This is her third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more  souvenirs/novelties to sell to her customers. 

Purity will use the proceeds from her business to buy a motorbike with which to start a transportation business. In the future, she hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs/novelties to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 28 years old and a businessman. He is married to Florence who runs a retail shop , and they have one son. He operates a motorcycle transport business as his primary business and does mixed crop farming business with an average monthly income of KES.10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs. With the anticipated profit from the business, he intends to continue constructing  a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and add more stock for the retail shop which his wife operates

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase a dairy cows and cultivate her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and cultivate her farm

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 28 year old lady married to Kirwa who is a secondary school accountant. They are blessed with two children aged five years and five months. Risper is a dairy farmer and sells milk that she obtains from their farm to the local residents. She has been in this business for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of KES.5,000. 

She is now servicing her second loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD,after she paid off the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow. 

The profits will be used to expand her dairy farm and increase the number of animals. Her dream is to improve her family's living standards and increase the number of dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisscah

texts.en:
Francisscah is 37-years-old business lady and a single mother of two children.  She has been running a restaurant for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil for use in her restaurant.

The anticipated profits she will use to pay school fees for her children.She hopes to grow her business and in future be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rogilia

texts.en:
Rogilia is married with four children. Rogilia is 59 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City.
Rogilia is engaged in making toasted peanuts to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PhP 5,000 to purchase peanuts, cooking oil, and sugar.
Rogilia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Rogilia hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a woman with four children, three of whom are in school. For the last four years, she has been operating a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors. She aims at opening a café in future. She describes market competition to be her major challenge. Rukia owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her decision to join Yehu was to access loans to boost her business. Her greatest monthly expenditure is on food.
With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: María De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, que se encuentra asentada en un accidente geográfico el mismo que le da su característica especial, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 40 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 20, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para solventar sus gastos personales, sus dos últimas hijas están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica al comercio desde hace 8 años, vende todo tipo de ropa y calzado, su mercadería lo vende recorriendo la ciudad y labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal en su quinto ciclo y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando ropa y calzado.

Su meta es tener una casita de campo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank Génesis.  She lives in the Vecino area in the city of Cuenca, which is located in an interesting geographical epicenter and it is the third most economically important city in the country.  It has a rich natural and cultural base and its cuisine captivates the palates of visitors.  The people in the area still retain the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 40 years old, she is married, and she has four children (22, 20, 13 and 10 years old.)  Her two oldest children work and pay their own expenses.  Her youngest two children are studying in the school in the city.  Her husband is a truck driver.  They own the home in which they live.

María has worked for 8 years selling all kinds of clothing and footwear.  The merchandise she sells comes from the city and she works Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.

This will be her fifth loan from the community bank and she will use it to invest in buying clothing and footwear.

Her goal is to have a cottage.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sururu

texts.en: Sururu is taking out another loan to get medical coverage for himself and his family. Since the last loan, his living standards have improved. In addition, his business is progressing very well. His main aim is to ensure his family does not lack any basic necessity.

loans.use: to get medical coverage for himself and his family.

loans.name: Kadjola Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KADJOLA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Rayéhanath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rayéhanath est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Rayéhanath a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Rayéhanath est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Christophe. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains son scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Rayéhanath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Rayéhanath vend des bracelets et des bijoux par le système de distribution depuis trois ans. Rayéhanath s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Rayéhanath contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Rayéhanath sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KADJOLA.
texts.en:
The group called KADJOLA is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same local, informal savings association. The representative of the group, Rayéhanath, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Rayéhanath is 44 and lives in Bénin. She stopped school at the primary level. She married a chauffeur named Christophe. The couple have five children of whom some are enrolled in school and all are in their parents' care. 

Rayéhanath lives with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the various family expenses. To respond to various household needs, Rayéhanath has been selling bracelets and jewelry through the distribution system for three years. She buys her wares in a town in Bénin. Thanks to the income earned through these activities, Rayéhanath contributes to their various household expenses. To satisfy the ever-growing needs of her clientele, Rayéhanath is requesting a loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the KADJOLA group.

loans.use: to buy bracelets and jewelry.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has two sons, ages 5 and 9. He owns a taxi business to earn a living.  He has been in this business for seven years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business-management skills.  

Peter hopes to own more vehicles for his taxi business in the future. He has requested a loan for 20,000 KES so he can buy business cards that will help promote his business.

loans.use: to buy business cards that will help promote his business.

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Ork is 57 years old. He is a humble villager from the Baray district in the Kompong Tom province of Cambodia. He lives with his family, including his wife and children. 

Ork cultivates rice crops to provide an income for his family. He has been managing this business for nearly 14 years. 

Ork has nine children, five of whom are married. Three of his children are employed in various jobs, including serving as a cleaner, construction worker and dump-truck driver. The children always share part of their incomes to support the family.

As of now, Ork has applied for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a dump truck for his son. He hopes that he will be able to make his son's business viable and provide a good income for the family. He hopes to receive the loan from Kiva lenders, and he is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase a dump truck for his son.

loans.name: Demetrio Celedonio

texts.es: El señor Demetrio , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sobre todo apoyar a su esposa ya que ella sueña con hacer una cocina digna ya que la actual esta bien deteriorada por los años , don Demetrio desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor dificultad que se le presentan son las plagas que invaden el cultivo y él no cuenta con el recurso económico necesario para comprar los fertilizantes necesarios y así darle el mantenimiento adecuado al cultivo .El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en:
Demetrio lives in Ticuantepe with his wife who sells fruits and vegetables to help pay the household expenses.  Demetrio's plans are to improve his family's standard of living, but above all, to support his wife and her dream to have a proper kitchen.  Their current kitchen has deteriorated over the years.

For many years Demetrio has worked as a pineapple farmer.  His biggest challenge is that pests invade his crops, and also that he doesn't have the money to buy fertilizers to adequately care for his crops.

This loan will help him buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 34, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Roland, a tricycle driver, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses.
Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilou earns profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Marilou hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. The fellowship group is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 35 años, es una mujer  buena, amable, trabajadora y muy luchadora. Es soltera pero tiene dos hijos de 13 y 3 años, ellos son su motivo de inspiración y esfuerzo a diario para brindarles lo mejor en educación y alimento. Vive en casa de sus padres, donde también habita su hermana.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de golosinas y otros productos comestibles en su kiosco ubicado en un colegio de su localidad. Trabaja en ello desde hace 6 meses, lo hace sola, ya que todavía no necesita de ayuda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades en su hogar, pues sólo vende en horas específicas del horario escolar (en las entradas, recreos y salidas de los turnos del colegio). Adicionalmente, tiene una tienda en su casa de venta de abarrotes, donde le ayuda su madre. Le está yendo muy bien y espera poder seguir haciéndolo como hasta ahora.

Éste es su octavo préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará productos para implementar su kiosco (gaseosas, caramelos, galletas, golosinas y otros).
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old. She is a good, kind, hardworking woman, and a real go-getter. She is single, but has two children, ages 13 and 3, who are her source of inspiration. She struggles daily in order to offer them the best in education and nutrition. She lives in her parents' home, where her sister also lives.

She works selling sweets and other food products in her kiosk, located at a local school. She has been doing this for six months, and works on her own, because so far she hasn't needed any help. What she likes about her work is that she has time available to do other things at home, because she only sells at particular times of the school day (when kids are going in or coming out of school, and during recesses). Additionally, she has a store at home where she sells groceries with her mother's help. Things are going very well and she hopes to be able to continue what she has been doing so far. 

This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support to move forward with her business. On the other hand, she is committed once again to paying her installments, like she did with her previous loans. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of its members are very responsible and supportive people. 

She will use the requested amount, 1500 soles, to purchase products in order to stock her kiosk (sodas, candy, cookies, sweets, etc).

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with six family members, two of whom work.

Haydar is a blacksmith. In 2000, he opened his workshop for cars blacksmithing. He has more than ten years of experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a $2,400 loan in order to install a sliding door and an outdoor ceiling for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: to install a sliding door and an outdoor ceiling for his workshop.

loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
la Señora Alma Ligia posee un negocio de venta de ropa interior sin embargo acercándose la celebración del día de las madres sus clientela le estaban pidiendo ropa como blusas tanto para damas como para caballeros.

Por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de Ceprodel solicitando un crédito para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela en la compra de ropa y así hacer crecer mas su negocio y por ende tener mas ingreso para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Alma Ligia has a business selling underwear but with the approach of Mother’s Day her customers were asking her for clothes like blouses for women as well as for men which is why she approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to meet customer demand by purchasing clothes to make her business grow more and thus to have more income for her family’s support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Harmoni Indah 3 Group

texts.en:
This is a reloan for Harmoni Indah 3 group. This group has three new members, and one of the old members left the group. With the previous loan, Siti was able to make a small renovation to her store and sell more things. Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy materials to continue repairing her store and also add more stuff to sell in her store. She hopes her business can continuously succeed and she can be an agent to resell to smaller sellers.

Other group members plan to use their part of loan to help their businesses selling bags, noodles and "nasi uduk" (Indonesian rice with coconut flavor).

loans.use: to pay for materials to repair store and add more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: San Isidro De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “San Isidro de Yungaqui” en la comunidad de Yungaqui en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de papa, venta de verduras, venta de leche y queso, engorde de ganado, venta de pollo,  venta de jora, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores y otros hacen servicio de mantenimiento de carros. 
 
(La señora Nelida está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Nelida es casada  y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Nelida es la venta de pollos y pescado. Ya son varios años se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Nelida requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pollos y pescado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank "San Isidro de Yungaqui" in the community of Yungaqui in the District of Anta, which is part of Anta Province in the Department of Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The business activities of the members are as follows: selling potatoes, selling vegetables, selling milk and cheese, fattening cattle, selling chicken, selling maize, selling food, raising small animals, and providing services such as automobile maintenance.

Sra. Nelida (who has her hand raised in the photo) is a member who is married and has three children. Her main business activity is selling chicken and fish. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Nelida is taking this opportunity to request a loan for buying merchandise, such as chicken and fish.

The members, in general, are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete the payments on their various loans according to the established terms.

Cusco is located in the Distrct and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 22 years old and is studying administration at a local university. He has 1.5 years left to finish his degree. To support his education, he works as a taxi driver. He would like a loan in order to buy books for his classes and also to buy new wheels for his vehicle. His dream is to open a small business in the future.

Juan Carlos is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy school books and to buy new wheels for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty tiene 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Vive con su esposo, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 5 años. Ellos trabajan mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, tienen una casa propia donde viven todos juntos. 

Su trabajo consiste en capturar los momentos y sucesos importantes en la vida de las personas por medio de su cámara. Ella presta el servicio de fotógrafa en diversos acontecimientos y eventos de la ciudad. Además de realizar este trabajo, donde le soliciten, tiene un pequeño estudio fotográfico en su casa del cual se hace cargo su esposo. Realiza revelados de fotos, diplomas, certificados y otros del mismo tipo. Llevan realizando este negocio por 12 años, juntos, y son un buen equipo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener dos ingresos, uno es fijo con el estudio en su casa y otro es cuando se va a algunos eventos a solicitud. Al principio, como todo emprendedor, tuvo dificultades y temores, pero con el tiempo se fue asentando en su trabajo y ahora es muy buena y reconocida por lo que hace. Tiene como objetivo agrandar su negocio para así tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Éste es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores donde demostró ser responsable con sus pagos. Está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y siempre están a la expectativa de apoyarse entre sí.
