Con el monto solicitado, 1200 soles, comprará moldes de aluminio, vidrio y materiales para la elaboración de los recuerdos tipo pergamino para las promociones escolares que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Ketty, 34, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband with whom she has two children who are 12 and 5 years old.  They work hard to provide their children with a better quality of life; they own their house where they all live together.

Her work consists in capturing moments and important events in the lives of people by means of her camera.  She provides photography services at various events and happenings in the city.  Besides providing these services wherever she’s required to, she also has a small photography studio at home that her husband runs.  She does film developing, diplomas, certificates and others of the same sort.  They’ve been in business 12 years together and they make a good team.  What she likes about her business is that it allows for two incomes; one is fixed in the home-based studio and the other is when she goes to various events by request.  At the start, like all entrepreneurs, she had difficulties and fears but with time she became settled in her work and now she’s very good and renowned for what she does.  Her goal is to expand the business to have more to offer her customers.

This is her third loan with MFP and she commits once again to make her installment payments like she did with the previous loans where she showed herself to be responsible with her payments.  She’s happy to belong to her communal bank because all are responsible and ready to help each other out.

She will use the requested 1200 soles to buy aluminum frames, glass and supplies to make keepsakes like parchment scrolls for the upcoming school graduations.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 30-year-old business lady in Kilifi. She is a married mother of five. She sells cashew nuts, a business she has been doing for the past three years with success.

This marks her third time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more cashew nuts to sell to her customers. 


She will use the proceeds from the business to educate her children and to repay her loan. She dreams of seeing all children educated to college level.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children, 4 and 11 years old. She describes herself to be an aggressive businessperson and diligent. She operates a salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located within a shopping centre and market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy beauty products. This is the second loan Esther is requesting from SMEP DTM. The first one was in the amount of Kes 20,000, and she managed to repay the whole amount. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked cosmetics shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and has two children.  He sells clothes to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business since 2009. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business in the future for more income generation.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Dauglas

texts.en:
Dauglas is a 30-year-old boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Majaoni, Mombasa. He is single and has been in this business for the last five years. He is doing great. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to become successful in his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years old and single. He lives with eight family members; three of them work.

Karar has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field. He also has a deep understanding of his local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Karar is requesting $1800 as a youth loan in order to renovate his market’s walls and floors and to install a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his market’s walls and floors and to install a sliding door.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and has two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business from 2005. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Vikie

texts.en:
Vikie is married with two children. Vikie is 32 years old and lives in Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
Vikie buys and sells Ready to Wear clothes (RTW) to earn a living and has had this business for 9 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.
Vikie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Vikie hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, 63, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver. Sarah is a mother of one child. By the grace of God, Sarah has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level, a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Sarah. Since Sarah herself has been an undergraduate, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Sarah operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Sarah dreams of being able to see her child finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Oscar Martin

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 45 años pero es un joven de 20 años en espíritu y alegría, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 2 años, a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante y tenga un futuro mejor , su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo hermosas playas y también tiene a las Islas Ballestas, las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol ya que son muy pocas las veces que lo puede hacer ya que su trabajo es muy duro y cansado, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo ceviche con su chilcano. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración de empresas.

Día a día Oscar trabaja en su negocio como pescador, el pesca especialmente mariscos y los ofrece principalmente a los restaurantes de su ciudad, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes de manera semanal; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocido y sobre todo cumplido con sus clientes.

Oscar esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su bote y también para realizar un mejoramiento a su vivienda como mejorar los pisos y ventanas de su casa, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando con vehículo en buenas condiciones y así el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de embarcaciones”.
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old but a young man of 20 in spirit and happiness.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 2, whom he loves very much.  He works very hard so they will get ahead and have a better future.  He only completed secondary school, but he would like to have studied business administration.

His home is located in the city of Pisco, known for its warm climate as well as for beautiful beaches and the Ballestas Islands, which are visited by vast numbers of tourists all year long.  When he has some free time he likes to play soccer, which he cannot do very often because his job is so hard and tiring.  He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious ceviche with a "chilcano" [Pisco and cola cocktail]. 

Every day Oscar works in his business as a fisherman.  He fishes, especially shellfish, and sells them mainly to restaurants in his city.  He works about 12 hours a day in his business and can serve up to 15 customers a week.  He believes it is going well for him in his business because he is very well known and polite with his customers.

Oscar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to perform maintenance on his boat and make improvements to his home, such as improving the floors and windows.  In this way he will be able to continue working with a vehicle in good shape and fighting every day to make his biggest dream a reality: "To have a boat business."

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his boat.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 years old to 14 years old. He describes himself as trustworthy and a team player. 

Peter operates a farm, where he sells potatoes, maize, beans, etc. and works as a blacksmith. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are institutions.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for the expansion of the business. Peter will use the loan of Kes 30,000 to buy plain metal worth Kes 15,000 and blacksmith tools worth Kes 15,000. 

This is the second loan Peter is requesting from SMEP DTM. Earlier on, he had requested  a loan of Kes 20,000  which he managed to repay successfully. His business goal is to establish a permanent blacksmith business and create job opportunities for people within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy his own land.

loans.use: to buy plain metal worth Kes 15,000 and blacksmith tools worth Kes 15,000.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his wholesale shop in Njabini town for the last 10 years. It has been very profitable as he has been able to provide for the needs of his family. He is married to Gladys and supports a family of four.

Having repaid his previous loan amounts well and in good time, this will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy more stock of sugar, rice, soaps and detergents, cooking utensils and also household goods such as mattresses and blankets.This will enable him to meet the growing demands of his customers as well as make more profits.

In the future, Peter hopes to  grow his business and open wholesale shops in other areas of Njabini town and thereby make more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and detergent, etc.

loans.name: Antomy

texts.en:
Antomy is 33 years old and married.  To earn a living, he practices dairy farming.  He has engaged in the business for over five years.  Besides, he practices horticulture to supplement his family's income.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

Antomy hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 46 years old. She is a mother of six children and all go to school. She is married to a security guard. She sells clothes for gents. She has been in the business for more than eighteen years. With the loan, she will buy more shirts to sell. She dreams of putting aside more savings from the profits and having enough capital in the future for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en:
Dolphine is 28 years old and a married mother of two children in Mombasa. She runs a private medical clinic, a business she has done for the past four years successfully. She also operates a chemist's to supplement her income.

This marks her fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more drugs and renovate her clinic. 

She will use the anticipated profits from her business to repay her loan and educate her children. She dreams of having a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs and  also renovate her clinic.

loans.name: Doras

texts.en: Dorcas  sells charcoal at  Edukrom  near  Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now.  Dorcas  is married  and has five children  She uses her income  to help her husband to  feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.  Dorcas  will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business  Dorcas will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 35 years old. She is married and has a three year old child. She sells cell phones, accessories and toys. She has been in the business for one year. She wants to use the loan to buy more cell phones, accessories and toys to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She would love to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones, toys and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be a humble and industrious woman. She operates a poultry farm where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs casual laborers. 

Her business is located at a market, and her primary customers are hotels, butcher shops, and shopping malls.  In addition, she runs a grocery store where she sells kale, milk, and other horticultural items. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of chicken food.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more baby chicks. She received a previous loan of KES 20,000 which she managed to repay well. Her business goal is to venture into renting housing accomodations within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy baby chicks

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is the leader of a Community bank named “Paix Plus”, which is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs, united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Evelyne is 44 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom, four are going to school. Evelyne sells loaves of bread. She has been in business since 2004 with a starting capital of $50. After learning, through her friend, about Hope’s loan program she decided to join one of its groups in November 2007. 

Evelyne has already received eleven loans from Hope DRCongo that she repaid correctly. Currently, her business brings in a benefit of $50 per week. With her next loan she is planning to purchase 400 trays of loaves of bread to increase the inventory of her business. Evelyne’s dream is to open a bakery in her community. She runs her business in the south-western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase 400 trays of loaves of bread to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Milita

texts.es:
Milita tiene 28 años, es una mujer joven con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 4 años. Tienen una casa propia donde comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de educar a sus hijos y día a día brindarles lo mejor, también vive ahí su padre.

Su trabajo consiste en el alquiler de motocarros, desde muy temprano se levanta y espera a sus cuatro choferes, quienes llevan a trabajar a las motos. Ella las da en alquiler y percibe ganancia por cada uno. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y le está yendo muy bien. Le agrada porque le permite tener tiempo libre para realizar otras actividades. Cuando empezó sólo tenía un motocarro, y ahora está aumentando cada vez más. Menciona que lo malo de este negocio es que sus vehículos se maltratan mucho, ya sea por el trato de los choferes o por las malas condiciones de las calles de la ciudad, pero es un riego que debe asumir en este negocio. Ahora se prepara para seguir aumentando su flota, pero primero desea refaccionar sus cuatro unidades.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser una socia muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea dejar mal a nadie y siempre ser muy de confianza.
Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará un motocarro más, ya que ahorró 100 soles y sólo le falta el monto solicitado para poder completar. Con lo que le sobra tendrá que refaccionar algunas cosas de la moto que compre porque será de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Milita, 28, is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives with her spouse with whom she has two children who are 7 and 4 years old.  She has her own house where she shares the joy of educating her children and giving them the best day to day with her spouse; her father lives there with them too.

Her work consists in renting motor vehicles.  She rises very early to wait for her four drivers who put the motor vehicles to work.  She rents them out and earns profits on each one.  She’s been in this business for three years and is doing very well.  She likes it because it leaves her free time for other activities.  When she started out she only had one vehicle and now she’s increasing every time.  She mentions that what’s bad about this business is that the vehicles are damaged because they are mistreated by the drivers or because of the poor road conditions in the city but it’s a risk she has to take on with this business.  She’s now getting ready to increase the size of her fleet but first she must service her four units.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support to advance with her business.  On the other hand, she commits to be a very responsible, punctual member with her payments because she doesn’t want to disappoint anyone and always wants to be trustworthy.

She will use the requested 800 soles to buy another vehicle since she’s saved 100 soles and only needs the requested amount to have the remainder.  With any leftover she’ll have to service the vehicle she buys because it will be a used one.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is aged 49. She is a mother of five children and all of them go to school. She sells different merchandise such as charcoal, beans, potatoes, and bananas. With the loan, she wants to add more charcoal and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more charcoals to sell.

loans.name: Seraphine.

texts.en: Seraphine is 33 years old. She is a mother of five children, all of them going to school. She sells tomatoes and has been in the business for eight years. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes to sell. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 62 year old carpenter in Mariakani. He is a married father of eight. He has been doing carpentry for the past thirteen years with great success.

This marks Richard's fourth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase nails, timber and a jack plane. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for his children’s school fees and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a well established carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase nails, timber and a jack plane.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal mujeres de confianza  está conformado por 8 integrantes ,grupo se mantiene unido desde que se formaron, ellos mismo se apoyan y se motivan para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo en cada uno de los negocios que tienen cada uno de ellos.  Reyna  Isabel  es parte de este grupo en cual su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a una pulpería y está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, Jabón, azúcar,  gaseosas, bolsas plásticas , detergente entre otros productos que demanda sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres de Confianza" (Women of Trust) consists of eight members. This group has maintained unity from the time they started. They support and motivate one another to get ahead in each of their businesses, and to improve their quality of life.

Reyna Isabel is part of this group. Her business activity involves managing a store. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business by purchasing basic grains, oil, soap, sugar, sodas, plastic bags, detergents, and other products that are demanded by her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soap, sugar, sodas, plastic bags, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva tiene 41 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Está casada y es madre de tres hijos de 21, 19 y 15 años, quienes son estudiantes y aun dependen de ella para su educación, alimentación y demás necesidades. Tienen una casa propia, la que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo, donde comparte sus días a lado de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo viaja continuamente a otras ciudades a realizar trabajos eventuales.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta, al contado y al crédito, de productos de panadería, ella se encarga de hacer pedidos al por mayor a una fábrica panificadora que tiene diferentes productos: piononos, panes integrales, queques, etc. En su casa tiene una pequeña tienda donde tiene sus productos. Lleva realizando este trabajo 8 años y lo hace sola, pero Eva es una mujer que no se queda atrás, ya que también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, además de sembrar tomates en ciertas temporadas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar todas sus actividades, con lo que tiene ingresos de diferentes fuentes y así puede afrontar las cuotas programadas de sus créditos. En adelante, le gustaría emprender un nuevo proyecto, tener un restaurante.

Éste es su préstamo número 18 con la institución MFP. Por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos. Le agrada mucho pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues sus integrantes son muy responsables y sobre todo solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 3800 soles, comprará más productos para su venta. Además de algunos ingredientes y utensilios necesarios para iniciar con su negocio de restaurante.
texts.en:
Eva is 41 years old. She is a good, kind, and very responsible woman. She is married and is a mother of three children, who are 21, 19, and 15. They are in school and still depend on her for their education, food, and other needs. The family lives in their own home, which she was able to buy with her husband through much struggle. Here she spands her days with her children, while her husband constantly travels to other cities to work temporary jobs. 

She works selling bakery goods for cash and on credit. She orders wholesale from a bread factory offering various products: cakes such as "piononos" and "queques," whole-wheat breads, etc. She has a small store at home, where she keeps her products. She has been doing this for 8 years and works on her own, but Eva is not a woman to be easily outdone: she also works raising poultry, and growing tomatoes during the season. What she likes about her work is that it allows her time to do all of these things, so that she has several sources of income. This allows her to cover her scheduled loan payments. From now on, she would like to start a new project: to have a restaurant.

This is her 18th loan with the MFP institution, so she is committed once again to pay her installments, as with the previous loans. She really enjoys belonging to her communal bank, because its members are very responsible, and most of all, supportive.

She will use the requested amount, 3800 soles, to purchase more products to sell, as well as some ingredients and utensils she needs to start her restaurant business.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Doña Flor de María posee un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de diferentes tipos y estilos en el departamento de León desde hace 7 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la demanda ha aumentado por aproximarse el día de las madres,  y para aprovechar la venta  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  blusas, camisas y ropa interior de diferentes estilos y así satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.
texts.en:
Flor de María has had a small business selling all types and styles of clothing for seven years in the department of León.  This business supports her family.

It is worth mentioning that demand has increased because of Mother's Day.  To make the most of these sales she is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shirts, and lingerie in various styles to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 35 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene cuatro hijos; de 18, 16, 6 y 4 años. Ellos estudian, pero también ayudan en las cosas del hogar. La casa que tienen es propia y es donde comparte sus días a lado de su pareja y sus cuatro hijos, quienes son el motivo de esfuerzo y sacrificio, ya que ella trabaja mucho para poder brindarles lo mejor.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes y otros productos comestibles en una pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa. Desde muy temprano está a la espera de sus clientes, quienes van muy seguido, pues tienen la seguridad que siempre encontrarán lo que buscan. Ella trabaja sola y lo hace en este negocio por 4 años, lo que le gusta es que le da el tiempo para poder realizar algunas cosas más, como preparar refrescos para venderlos, algunos chupetes y otro tipo de negocio donde crea que puede sacar alguna ganancia. Ahora le está yendo mejor, cuando empezó no tenía ni idea de cómo era, se arriesgó sin saber nada. Es por ello que ahora desea agrandar su tienda, pues sabe que mientras más grande sea, mejores ganancias tendrá.

Éste es su préstamo número 6 con MFP. De igual manera que en los préstamos recibidos anteriormente, se compromete a ser puntual y muy responsable, ya que todos en su banco comunal son así y no desea ser la excepción.
Con el monto solicitado, 1600 soles, comprará más mercadería (gaseosas, conservas, lácteos, jugos, y otros) para vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
Noemí, 35, is a kind, enterprising woman.  She lives with her spouse with whom she has four children who are 18, 16, 6 and 4 years old.  They study but also help with household chores.  The house they have is theirs and it’s where she shares her days with her spouse and four children who are the motive behind all her efforts and sacrifice since she works much to give them the best.

Her work consists in selling groceries and other food items in a small store she set up at home.  She awaits her customers from very early on; they come by often because they are sure to find what they are looking for always.  She works by herself and has been in business for four years.  What she likes is that it gives her time to do other things like make refreshments like lollipops to sell and other types of business where she thinks she might be able to earn a profit.  Now she’s doing better because when she started out she didn’t have a clue as to how it was; she took a risk not knowing anything.  This is why now she’d like to enlarge her store because she knows that the bigger it is the better profits she’ll have.

This is her loan #6 with MFP.  Like with the loans she got previously, she commits to be punctual and responsible because everyone in her communal bank is that way and she does not want to be the exception.

She will use the 1600 soles requested to buy more merchandise (soft-drinks, conserves, dairy products, juice and others) to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 27 year old business lady in Kilifi. She sells second hand clothes and handbags, a business that she has been doing for the past three years with success. She is still single and supports her two siblings.

This is Diana's second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, handbags, trousers and skirts. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her siblings. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers and skirts.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is married and has four children. He sells fruit to earn a living. He has been engaged in the business for four years. He has employed one person in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

Philip hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested for 80,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of fruit to his business.

loans.use: to add stock of fruits.

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39 year old Suzan from Harare, Machipisa. She is married and has three children, two attending school. Suzan runs a clothing business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge she faces is not having a proper shelter for doing business. Suzan has requested a loan of $500.00 to buy more clothes and footwear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Suzan plans to own her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old, a motorcycle operator in Mariakani. He is married, and a father of two children. He has been operating this business for the past year. He is doing great. 

This marks Simon's first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila sells mangose and gari at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Leila has been in this business for the past 10 years now. She is married and has 7 children, her husband is a farmer. 

Leila uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their family. Leila will use her loan to purchase mangoes and bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes and bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Isidra de Jesús  se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de frutas y verduras, con la que ha desarrollado su familia.
Ella se levanta muy de mañana 5:00 am para realizar las compras a los comerciantes que vienen de otros departamentos para después trasladarse a su puesto de venta y terminar a las 4:00 pm

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar frutas y verdura al por mayor por eso acudió a  Ceprodel para poder ser beneficiado con un crédito y seguir comercializando las riquísimas y jugosas frutas de la temporada y así satisfacer la demanda de su gran clientela y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 14 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Isidra de Jesús earns her living buying and selling fruit and vegetables. With the income from this job she supports her family. Isidra gets up early at 5am to buy produce from the merchants who come from other areas. Then she transports it to her stall and finishes work at 4pm. 

One of the necessities for her job is to buy the fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices so she has approached Ceprodel for a loan so she can buy delicious, juicy fruit in season and satisfy her many customers’ demands. In this way she will earn more money for her family. Isidra has been doing this job for 14 years, and sales are going well.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La venta de calzado es el negocio que desarrolla el la Señora Martha Lorena en el departamento de León desde hace 3 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la demanda ha aumentado por aproximarse el día de las madres,  y para aprovechar la venta  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  sandalias de diferentes estilos y así satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.
texts.en:
Selling footwear is the business Martha Lorena is in.  She’s been in business in León Department for three years; this business is her family’s source of support.

It’s important to mention that demand has increased due to the approach of Mother’s Day and to take advantage of sales she’s asking for a loan to buy sandals in various styles to thus meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy various styles of sandals.

loans.name: Yasmin Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Yasmin Esperanza tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, ropa, sandalias este negocio lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 19 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La señora Yasmin realiza las compras para su negocio en la ciudad de Managua, posteriormente ofrece desde muy de mañana a toda su clienta en su puesto venta cerrando su negocio a las 4:00pm.

En estos días que se acerca en Nicaragua la celebración del día de las madres la demanda ha aumentado por lo que se acerco a Ceprodel, esperando recibir el apoyo para surtir su negocio y así aprovechar la ocasión y satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.
texts.en:
Yasmín Esperanza has a business selling cosmetics like perfume, creams, clothes and sandals.  It’s located in one of the markets in the city of León and she’s had it for 19 years; the business is her family’s support.

Yasmín makes the purchases for her business in Managua and then sells from very early in the morning to her clientele in her stand; she closes at 4pm.

In these days when Mother’s Day in Nicaragua is approaching, demand has increased which is why she approached Ceprodel hoping to get help to stock her business to take advantage of the occasion and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bulk groundnuts.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Ofelia del Carmen se dedica a la  actividad  de venta de ropa y marisco en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 9 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora se presento a  la oficina de Ceprodel a solicitar crédito para incrementar su inventario con nuevos productos ya que se aproxima  el día de las madres, para  aprovechar las ventas y tener mayores ingresos y lograr un mejor nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Carmen has been selling clothes and seafood in one of the city of León markets for nine years; this business is her family’s support.  

It’s worth mentioning that she came by Ceprodel’s office to request a loan to increase inventory with new products because Mother’s Day is approaching so that she can take advantage of sales and earn higher income to attain a better standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, towels, bedspreads, children's outfits, aprons and underwear.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, located in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. For the past 10 years, Loy has been working hard to manage her health clinic, which sells medicine.

To help expand her business, Loy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more medicine for resale, and this will help her to generate greater profits. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build up more rental houses.

Loy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is in her early thirties and got married recently. About fifteen years ago, she and her family immigrated to Italy, just like many other Albanians, seeking a better life. “It was extremely difficult in the beginning. I can’t describe it now,” she says. However, thanks to her attitude towards work and help from the Italian employers/people, she was able to work and save some money for buying necessary furniture and items for her newly built home that is located in the breathtaking scenery and nature of the Albanian North coast settlement. She continues saying, “Not only that I saved some money, but I came back a different person with improved people and communication skills also.” 

She is now enjoying living in her native country and is building a store from scratch. Unfortunately, she has run out of money to complete the store and is requesting a loan. Kindly note here that she has prepaid for the inventory. 

She is confident that with her entrepreneurial mind, excellent customer service skills and an inventory of high quality items, added to the fact that her store would be the only one in this busy little town, she will succeed. 

Liza is grateful to VisionFund Albania and KIVA for the opportunity she’s been granted, because this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: To complete building the store she started sometime back

loans.name: Dilore

texts.en:
Dilore has four children; 20, 17, 15 and 13 years of age. The oldest one study in university and three of them are attending the secondary school. Dilore and her husband have been in the livestock business for over seventeen years. They are passionate about the whole process: raising cattle and producing cheese, cottage cheese and butter. 
Their business was doing very well, especially over the past almost five years. They sold dairy products and cattle in small cities and villages around their living location. Unfortunately, this past winter, the snow and extreme cold hit North Albania very harsh and thousands of animals died including Dilore's cows. 
The demand for dairy products is high throughout Albania, thus, like many others who are involved in the same business, they were fortunate enough to generate some income through it. With that money they were able to feed the children and build a house and improve living conditions. When Dilore started describing the living conditions they were in before, she became very emotional.
Now, she plans to add three more cows to the once they already have and build a little stable so that animals no longer live outside during the cold and snowy winters. This is the fourth time that Dilore is applying for a loan. Thanks to her responsible actions, she remains an excellent client of VFA.

loans.use: To purchase three cows and repair stable

loans.name: Okpeyemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKPEYEMI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Mondoukpè Simone est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mondoukpè Simone est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè Simone a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Mondoukpè Simone est mariée à un certain Damien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mondoukpè Simone vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Mondoukpè Simone vend des tissus, chaussures et autres articles depuis quinze ans, dans une boutique du Bénin. Mondoukpè Simone s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Mondoukpè Simone contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Mondoukpè Simone sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OKPEYEMI. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Okpeyemi group is composed of 3 people who live in the same district and are friends. Mondoukpè Simone, the group's representative, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. She is 44 years old and lives in Benin. Mondoukpè Simone left school during secondary level. She is married to Damien and the couple have 3 dependent children who all study. Mondoukpè Simone lives together with her husband and children and the couple share the household responsibilities.

In order to meet the different household needs, Mondoukpè Simone has been selling fabrics, shoes and other items in a shop in Benin for 15 years. She gets her supplies in a town in Benin. She is able to contribute to the various household expenses thanks to the income generated by her business.

In order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, Mondoukpè Simone is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Okpeyemi group. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en: Providence, 36 years old, has been selling bed covers for the last 10 years. She is requesting this loan to buy more bedsheets for resale. The profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, located in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and improve his family's living standards. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a supermarket.

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but operate businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 26-year-old married man. He and his wife have two sons, and he lives with his family in Gaza.

For the past two years, Salman has been running a grocery store, which has been a profitable project. His dream is to expand his store and to become the main supermarket in his town.

Salman asked Ryada for this youth loan to help him cover the cost of purchasing a variety of products and groceries for re-sale purposes, including: rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil. He would also use the loan proceeds to buy a refrigerator. This loan would enable Salman to provide customers with all of the types of groceries they often request, which will increase his sales and improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (such as rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil) and a refrigerator

loans.name: Pro Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Pro Desarrollo” en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, venta de verduras, compra y venta de ganado, engorde de ganado, venta de comestibles, venta de golosinas y otros hacen servicio de costura o sastrería.  
 
(La señora Noemi está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Noemi nació en la comunidad de Molletapa del distro de Anta de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Noemi es la artesanía de tipo cerámica, tejidos, bisutería, miniaturas y otras más. Ya son 18 años se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Noemi requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de lana, pulseras, collares, maletines de cuero y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal para no estar presentes en la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank "Pro Desarrollo" (Pro Development) in the District of Pisaq in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The business activities of the members are as follows: selling handicrafts, selling vegetables, buying and selling cattle, fattening livestock, selling food, selling candy, and other services such as sewing and tailoring.

Sra. Noemi (who has her hand raised in the photo) is a member who was born in the community of Molletapa in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco. Her main business activity involves handicrafts such as ceramics, woven goods, trinkets, miniature figurines, and other items. She has been in this business for 18 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Noemi is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as wool sweaters, bracelets, necklaces, leather cases, and other items.

The members, in general, are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete the payments on their various loans according to the established terms. (The members who appear in the smaller photos requested permission from the Communal Bank's Board of Directors to be absent from the meeting.)

Cusco is located in the Distrct and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy wool sweaters, bracelets, necklaces, leather cases, and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with two children. His wife is a trader.

To earn a living, John works as a carpenter. John has been a carpenter for three years now. He explains that he uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees.

John is seeking this loan to purchase additional wood for his carpentry work. With the profits he expects to generate in the future as a result of the loan proceeds, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Esperanza Para Todos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Esperanza para todos” está conformado por 22 emprendedores quienes se dedican  a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de papas fritas, venta de plantas, venta de ropa, venta de frutas y verduras, confites, artículos de aseo personal, almacén, kiosco, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Puente Alto ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
María, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón color azul, encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color negro, usa su cabello tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente a la venta de artículos de aseo, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 1 año, trabaja sola en un puesto en la feria. Su mercadería la compra en un centro de abastecimientos de artículos de aseo.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio.
Sus metas son poder hacer un negocio en su propia casa para generar mayores ingresos.
María vive junto a su marido quien trabaja con ella, y sus 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años. Sus sueños son crecer con su negocio y que su hija salga adelante con sus estudios. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Esperanza para Todos” (Hope for All) and it has 22 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work among which are: fried potato sales, plant sales, clothes sales, fruit and vegetable sales, snacks, personal hygiene products, kiosk and services among others.  All belong to the city of Santiago’s Puente Alto commune.

María, communal bank secretary, is in the first row seated in the first place from right to left.  She’s wearing blue pants and a black vest; her hair is gathered.

She’s a merchant specifically selling cleaning supplies.  She’s been in this business for a year and works alone in a stand in a street market.  She buys her merchandise at a cleaning supplies store.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business.  Her goal is to be able to open a home-based business to generate higher income.

María lives with her husband who works alongside her and her two children who are 11 and 8 years old.  Her dream is to grow with her business and that her daughter continues forward with her schooling.

María is very happy and grateful with the loan and services gotten from Fondo Esperanza.  She also comments that she feels very comfortable at the meetings and with her communal bank because there is generosity and unity there.

Puente Alto is a commune in north Santiago, Capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small rural village at the end of the 19th-century but due to population growth is now one of Chile’s most populous communes with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It’s the doorway to one of the metropolitan region’s foothill areas known as Cajón del Maipo, a sector with hiking trails, bridal paths and rafting, among other activities as well as accommodations and food services.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Djrodagbe 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJRODAGBE 3 est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Hounssikpè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hounssikpè est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin. Hounssikpè n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Hounssikpè est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Le couple a huit enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Hounssikpè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Hounssikpè vend des canaris, des paniers et divers articles depuis quinze ans, à son domicile. Hounssikpè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Hounssikpè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Hounssikpè sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJRODAGBE 3.
texts.en:
The Djrodagbe 3 group is made up of 3 people who belong to the same mutual funds group. The group's representative, Hounssikpè, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 53 years old and lives in Benin. Hounssikpè did not go to school. She is married to Gilbert and the couple have 8 children, 3 of whom are still in their charge and all of whom have been, or are going, to school. Hounssikpè lives together with husband and children and the couple both take care of the various household expenses.

In order to be able to meet the household's various needs, Hounssikpè has been selling canaries, baskets and other items for 15 years from her home. She gets her supplies in a town in Benin. She is able to contribute to the different household expenses thanks to the income generated by her business.

Hounssikpè is requesting a loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Djrodagbe 3 group, so that she can satisfy the needs of her growing customer base.

loans.use: to buy canaries, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
ROSA MARIA tiene 38 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres y los dos hijos en Chimo Provincia de Bolìvar.

ROSA MARIA tiene un molino de agua vende todo tipo de harinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar granos cómo habas, arveja. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los granos para hacer más harin y aumentar el negocio para tener buena rentabilidad.

Las compras lo hará en San Miguel y las ventas en Chimbo.

 El sueño e spoder incrementar el negocio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la competencia y la tegnología.

En el timpo libre le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 38 years old and the single mother of two children.  She lives with her parents and children in Chimbo in the Bolivar Province.

Rosa Maria has a water mill and sells all types of flours.  She is requesting a loan to buy grains like beans and peas.  With the help of a loan she could buy grains to make more flour and grow her business for increased profitibility.  She makes purchases in San Miguel and sells her products in Chimbo.

Rosa Maria's dream is to be able to grow her business.  She faces competitive and technological challenges.

In her free time, she likes to work in the fields.

loans.use: to buy grains such as beans and peas.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom currently attend school.

For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small business of selling dried food items like maize and beans. To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more maize for re-sale purposes, and would help Joseph generate greater profits to pay for his children's school fees. In the future, Joseph hopes to be able to buy a maize miller.

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase additional maize.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married and has a six-year-old child.

To earn a living, he runs a cyber cafe. He explains that he has been in this business for six years. He employs one other person in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he received business management training. He hopes to grow his business and to employ more people.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 75,000 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee is 35 years old. She has three children, who are between the ages of six and eleven years old.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a hardware store. She is seeking a loan so that she can add more metallic materials and wood for re-sale purposes. The profits she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods such as metallic materials and wood

loans.name: Oluwashehoun Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWASHEHOUN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies habitant le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Odette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Odette est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Odette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Odette est mariée à un certain Séïdou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Odette vend des sachets et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques depuis trois ans, de façon ambulante. Odette s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Odette contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Odette sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWASHEHOUN.
texts.en:
The Oluwashehoun group is made up of 3 friends who live in the same district. The group's representative, Odette, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 27 years old and lives in Benin. Odette did not go to school. She is married to Séïdou and the couple have 2 dependent children, both of whom attend school. Odette lives together with husband and children and the couple both cover the various household expenses.

In order to meet the household various needs, Odette has been selling small plastic bags and phone recharge cards on the street for 3 years. She gets her supplies in Nigeria. Thanks to the income generated by her business, she is able to contribute to the household's various expenses.

Odette is requesting a loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Oluwashehoun group, so that she can satisfy the needs of her growing clientele.

loans.use: to buy small plastic bags and phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria es una emprendedora  su  actividad, es el  servicio de costura.. Ella comienza su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen la buena calidad de prendas que elabora. Actualmente Ana necesita un préstamo para comprar hilos, tela, dedales, tijeras, cintas y bordados, ella ha logrado tener una herramienta de trabajo gracias al apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado con los financiamientos para capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Ana Maria runs a sewing business. She starts work at 7am and finishes at 9pm. Her customers know that the work she does is of high quality. Currently Ana needs a loan to buy thread, material, thimbles, scissors, ribbon, and embroidery silks. She managed to get a sewing machine thanks to the help provided through a loan from Fundaçion Leon.

loans.use: to buy thread, material, thimbles, scissors, ribbon, and embroidery silks

loans.name: Serey's Group

texts.en:
Serey, aged 38, is married and has three children, one daughter and two sons, who are dependent on her. Her children are still in school. She earns a living through growing rice and selling grocery items such as seasoning, soap, eggs, etc., in front of her house. She has been in this business for more than ten years. 

Serey has been with Kiva's partner VisionFund for three cycles and has successfully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to make a better living, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. With her good business skills, she is leading this group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodia rials (KHR) each. As the leader, Serey is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes that this loan will make her business prosper and make more income to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more grocery items for her store.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and lives with her husband and their five children at Edukrom near Cape Coast in Ghana.

To earn a living, Mercy sells footwear. She explains that she has been in this line of business for five years now.

Mercy is seeking a loan to purchase more footwear to sell to her customers. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like to acquire a shop of her own to make it easier to sell her goods.

loans.use: to purchase additional footwear

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is 33 years old. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more bed sheets to re-sell to her customers. She plans on saving the profits she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional bed sheets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is a widow with two children, who are both currently in school.

For the past ten years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells medicine. To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of in the amount of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more medicine for re-sale purposes, and would help Sarah generate additional profit so that she can pay for her children's school fees. In the future, Sarah hopes to start a health clinic.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine for re-sale purposes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old. He lives in a small village with his family: his wife who is a housewife and  his 17-year-old son who still goes to school. The family runs an agricultural business.
David has a little plot of land where he grows cucumbers. He sells his cucumbers on the local open market. David is also a private worker; he helps people in his village look after their agricultural business. Seasonally he goes into the woods and prepares firewood for the local population and gets service fees. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari. 

David has requested a loan for purchasing cucumber seeds, as he wants to plow the land and sow more cucumbers. With this loan he will be able to take good care of the land. Thus, he wants to expand his agricultural business. David will sell his harvested product on the local open market. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income he will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cucumber seeds.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married, 32-year-old woman supporting a family of five. For the past five years, she has been operating a grocery shop business. She explains that her monthly income is approximately 19,000 KES.

She is seeking her first loan in the amount of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. With the loan proceeds, she intends to get more supplies of various fresh fruits and vegetables for her grocery store. She believes that the proceeds will assist her to re-stock her goods and to provide more goods for her clients. The anticipated profits from the business will be reinvested. Her future plan is to have a bright and stable future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (fruits and vegetables) for her shop

loans.name: Sègla Augustin

texts.fr: Sègla Augustin est âgé de 35 ans et vit au Benin. Sègla Augustin a appris le métier de broderie et de couture. Sègla Augustin est marié à une marchande du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont cinq constituent leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Sègla Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a douze ans environs, Sègla Augustin exerce l'activité de couture et de broderie ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Sègla Augustin s’approvisionne en matériels de couture au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder, Sègla Augustin sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sègla Augustin is 35 years old and lives in Benin. Sègla Augustin learned the professions of embroidery and sewing. Sègla Augustin is married to a trader named Rosaline. The couple has six dependent children of whom five are their own children. Among the children, some go to school. Sègla Augustin lives together with his wife and his children. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together. 

For about 12 years, Sègla Augustin has been in the sewing and embroidery business, which allows him to better meet the needs of his family. Sègla Augustin gets his sewing supplies in Nigeria. Seeking to satisfy his clientèle and with the aim of acquiring a new embroidery machine, Sègla Augustin is requesting his first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom currently attend school.

For the past seven years, Betty has been working hard to manage her stationary and printing business, where she sells exercise books and provides printing and photocopy services. To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy another printer and computers, and should help Betty generate greater profits to allow her to continue to increase and improve her fixed assets like printers. In the future, Betty hopes to be able to start a computer training center.

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase another printer and computers

loans.name: Odette's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Odette est mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés. Elle est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Odette s'est spécialisée dans la vente des savons, macaronies et des bois de chauffage à son domicile depuis dix ans. Odette s'approvisionne sur les marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est composée de femmes. Odette a envie de stocker du bois en cette saison pluvieuse et d'agrandir son fonds de commerce. Elle a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa  coéquipière un micro crédit auprès de Finadev afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et de participer à la scolarisation des enfants. Odette se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: 33 years of age, Odette is married and the mother of five children, all in school. She is the representative of this  two-person group. Odette specializes in selling soap, spaghetti and  firewood. She has been selling out of her home for 10 years. Odette stocks up at the markets of benin. Her customer base is large and varied, composed mainly of women. Odette would like to stock up wood in this rainy season and bolster her working capital. She has requested and obtained, together with the other member of her team, a microloan from Finadev, taken out with the goal of meeting customer demand and helping with the education expenses of her children. Odette appears on the left in the photo.

loans.use: six boxes of soap of various kinds and  a stack of firewood.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 44 años divorciada, madre de una hija de 19 años con quien vive en "Santo Domingo" el cual es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Desde hace 3 años Gloria abrió un local de suministros y oficina y un poco de artículos de bazar. Todos los días atiende su negocio por 8 horas y la ayuda su hija. Le ha ido bien durante este año, los ingresos le han servido para llevar una vida modesta y a pesar de las carencias que pueda tener, ha sabido salir adelante con su hija. En la región costa las clases en las escuelas y colegios inicia, por lo que Gloria ha decidido invertir en útiles escolares, ya que la demanda de los mismos sube durante esta época. Esta emprendedora se valdrá de un crédito para poder comprar la mercadería para su tienda y así tener un mayor ingreso que les permita mejorar la calidad de vida.

La vida no ha sido fácil para esta mujer ya que es duro criar a su hija sola, a pesar de tener su casa propia ella sueña con poder arreglarla y así dar mayor comodidad a su hija.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 44 year old woman who is divorced and the single mother of a 19 year old daughter.  They live together in Santo Domingo, which is a Canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  It is one of of the mostly densely populated areas of Ecuador.  It is an attractive place to live as there are various monuments dispersed throughout the city, including the "Monumento al Indio Colorado" (a monument honoring the indigenous people of the area) and an area known as the “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo is an exceptional Canton full of marvelous, hardworking and enterprising people who work tirelessly for development and progress.  They welcome tourists with open arms and introduce them to their marvelous culture and environment.

Three years ago, Gloria opened an office supply store which carries some other miscellaneous items.  She is open everyday for 8 hours and has her daughter's help.  This last year has gone well for her, and the income from the store has allowed her to have a modest lifestyle.  Despite occasional shortages, she and her daughter have learned to keep moving forward.  Because the primary and secondary schools in the coastal region are starting up, Gloria has decided to invest in school supplies.  There is a lot of demand for them, especially at this time.  This enterprising woman will make use of the loan to purchase merchandise for her store and to therefore have a better income which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Life has not been easy for this woman.  It is difficult to raise a daughter alone.  Even though she owns her own home, Gloria hopes to fix it up to give her daughter a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for re-sale.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина- опытный фермер.Свою деятельность начала со вступления в ячейку фермеров, получала консультационные услуги от MEDA. В хозяйстве ей помогает муж и сын, который живет в селе со своей семьей, дочь проживает в городе,а старший сын инвалид живет вместе с ними.

Для выращивания клубники и земляники необхолимо приобрести агроволокно, что ускорит процесс созревания и облегчит труд семьи.

Финансово это очень тяжело т.к. Галина получает маленькую пенсию, свободное время проводит с сыном-инвалидом. Мечтает приобрести новую машину для транспортировки сына на лечение.В фермерских целях приобрести столбики, клубнику, минитрактор.

Галина нуждается в вашей помощи чтобы профинансировать покупку агроволокна
texts.en: Galina is an experienced farmer.  She started her work by joining a group of farmers and received consultation services from MEDA.  Her husband and son, who lives in the village with his family, help her with the business.  Her daughter lives in the city, and the oldest son is disabled and lives with the parents.  It is necessary to buy spun-bond material, which will increase the ripening process and ease the work for the family.  It is very difficult for Galina financially because she receives a small pension and spend her free time with her disabled son.  She dreams of buying a new car for transporting her son for treatments.  Her farming goals are to buy poles, strawberries and a mini tractor.  Galina needs your help to finance a purchase of spun-bond material.

loans.use: to purchase spun-bond material for strawberries

loans.name: Oscar Geovany

texts.es:
OSCAR GEOVANY tiene 39 años de edad es divorciado tiene dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad, vive con los hijos en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

OSCAR GEOVANY se dedica a la venta de vehículos. Solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos cómo refrigerador, microhondas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los electrodomésticos que tanta falta le hace. 

Los deasfíos a los que se enfrenta es poder educar a los hijos. 

El sueño e spoder incrementar el número de vahículos en el negocio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Oscar Geovany is 39 years old.  He is divorced and has two children who are 7 and 9 years old.  He lives with his children in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.

Oscar Geovany makes his living selling cars.  He is requesting the loan to purchase electrical appliances, like a refrigerator and a microwave.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the electrical appliances that he really needs.

He challenge is providing an education for his children. 

He hopes to be able to increase his business's vehicle stock.

In his free time, Oscar Geovany likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances like a refrigerator and a microwave.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children at Edukrom near Cape Coast. Aba sells gari, onions, and maize, which she has been doing for a year. She uses her income to support her husband and feed their children.  Aba will use this loan to purchase bags of gari, onions and maize to sell. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari, onions, and maize to sell

loans.name: Paca Karina

texts.es:
PACA KARINA tiene 23 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

PACA KARINA es empleada doméstica. Solicita el crédito para comprar muebles, armario, mesa. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la casa. Las compras lo hará en Guaranda.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener lo necesario para vivir comodamente. El sueño e spoder tener todo lo necesario para vivir comodamente.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la competencia, En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar, caminar, pasear.
texts.en:
Paca Karina is 23 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Chimbo in Bolívar province.

Paca Karina is a domestic worker. She is asking for the loan to purchase furniture, a dresser and table. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for the house. She will make the purchases in Guaranda. 

The challenge she faces is to have what she needs to live comfortably. Her dream is to be able to have everything she needs to live comfortably.

The challenge she faces is competition. In her free time, she likes to play and take walks.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, a dresser and table

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: EL Sr. Oscar tiene 51 años, es casado. El señor se dedica a brindar sus servicios como fontanería, electricidad y mantenimiento de líneas telefónicas. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre lo buscan para que realice sus trabajos. Tiene 30 años de ejercer esta profesión a pesar de que no es fácil ha sabido aprovecharlo, para el bienestar economico de sus familia.  El motivo del crédito es para la compra de herramientas, alambres, pinzas, destornilladores entre otros productos
texts.en: Oscar is 51 years old and married. He provides services including plumbing, electrical work, and maintenance of telephone lines. Most of his customers always look for him to do their work.
