To help support the family's daily living costs, Soun has been farming rice for approximately 20 years. Although her children have incomes, the family still does not have enough food. 

Soun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Her group member has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. 

They are now requesting another loan after completely paying their previous loans. As the group leader, Soun will use a portion of the loan to cultivate her rice field, buy fertilizers for her crops and pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her family to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice field, buy fertilizers for her crops and pay labor fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Because the price of feed is high, the Babi Rahayu group requested a loan for the same amount. Each member gets 1.5 M IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, two members could not attend due to illness.

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she already has enough savings, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: To buy two superior piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Internet cafe business in the Philippines. Arlie has been in this business for six years. Arlie earns additional income from wholesaling and retailing soft drinks.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer for her Internet cafe business.

Arlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 31 years old and a loving mother of two school-age children. She and her husband raise their children in a peaceful village in the Prey Chor district of Cambodia. 

Aside from helping her husband manage his farming business, Chea devotes her time to selling drinks such as water, tea, juice, coffee, milk and syrup to the local people in her community. From this business, she is able to earn approximately $2 per day. 

Chea would like to improve her business but due to a shortage of capital, she is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to renovate her store and purchase snacks, sweets, spices, canned goods and home-use products to sell in her store. 

Chea hopes to acquire the loan to further develop her business more successfully. In the future, she plans to save the extra income generated to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to renovate her store and purchase snacks, sweets, spices, canned goods and home-use products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tseeleisuren

texts.en:
Tseeleisuren is 49 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger in Uvs, Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter. The older daughter, Enhee, is 22 years old and studies at the Mongolian Pedagogical University. The youngest, Narangerel, is 19 years old and is in the eleventh grade in secondary school. 

Tseeleisuren has been in the agricultural business since 2001. Starting in 2010, she began planting sea-buckthorn and is now selling it. She is planning to build a greenhouse to expand this business. 

The family atmosphere is warm; they have lived in this area since 2005. Tseeleisuren is gentle and hardworking. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and to build a greenhouse.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun is 37 years old, an industrious woman from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has a common relationship with her husband and has a single child attending school. She is in the business of cultivating rice for income. Her husband has an animal-trading business. He buys and sells animals in a local market of the province and earns a good income. 

In order to maintain and support in her husband’s business, Moeun decided to borrow some funds to supplement her capital to buy six head of cattle for trading in the future. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve the family-owned business, and she hopes that she will be successful in managing the business.

loans.use: to supplement her capital to buy six head of cattle for trading in the future.

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth is 37 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

To earn a living, Reth and her husband have been farming rice for the past 20 years. Their business very often encounters obstacles such as not having enough capital. 

Reth has been with VisionFund since 2011. She is now requesting a third loan while her other group member is requesting her fourth loan. 

As the group leader, Reth will use her portion to cultivate her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to save enough money to buy a proper house for her family.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice farmland.

loans.name: Bres

texts.en:
Bres, age 28, has owned and managed a rice-farming business for nearly seven years. She is married and has been blessed with two school-age children. She lives with her family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is happy because she has her husband's help in the maintenance of their rice field. This couple works hard to provide their children with the basic necessities and a good education.

Bres would like to request a loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase farming supplies to improve the growth of her rice crops. She believes that she could have a plentiful harvest this coming crop season. Bres is strongly committed to providing a good standard of living for her children in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to improve the growth of her rice crops.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren is 50 years old, married and living with her husband and two sons in Selenge province. Her husband is 58 years old and transports goods by  his Russian truck Zil-130. An older son, Battsogt, is 30 years old and he runs a private business. The younger son, Bayarbat, is 20 years old and he is a student.  

Lhamsuren has been planting potatoes and other vegetables within her fence for more than 10 years. Also, she started a food-selling business in 2008 and has got selling channels. She is hardworking and responsible.  

"I would like to be honoured by paying the loan on time," she says. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to plant potatoes and vegetables.

loans.use: To plant potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom and her family live in a rural area located in Thmor Koul district and they have been farming rice for 14 years to support the family. 

Mom is a mother of four and all of them are still in school. Mom and her other two members are new to VisionFund. As a leader, Mom used her portion to rent a combine harvester for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow rice with a good yield and hence sell it for a good price so that she can have sufficient money for sending her children to school and have a proper house.

loans.use: To rent a combine harvester.

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din is 36 years of age and she continuously operates her rice-farming business alongside her spouse as a main source of the family’s income. Her business provides a great help to the family and enables her to send her two children to school. 

Din would like to acquire a loan of USD 1,200 as additional capital to pay for labor costs and to purchase potato plants to grow for sale. She hopes to enlarge her profit for the welfare of her family. 

She has been a noble and honest client of HKL for many years. With her previous three loans, she paid off successfully, and this will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and to purchase potato plants to grow for sale.

loans.name: Lempapa

texts.en:
Lempapa is 29 years old and single. He has run a motorbike transport business for the last two years. His monthly incomes is KES 80,000.

He has applied for a second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase spare parts to service his motorbike. This will help him operate efficiently and increase his route coverage. 

The anticipated profits will support his business. His future plan is to acquire more motorbikes

loans.use: To buy spare parts to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.es:
Lisi tiene 28 años, es una mujer joven, soñadora y muy amable. Con su pareja tiene dos hijos, de 8 y 5 años. Tiene una casa propia donde viven todos juntos. Ambos trabajan mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Su trabajo es la venta de zapatos, trabaja de forma ambulatoria en un mercado cerca de su casa. Además tiene un puesto donde se queda su pareja a vender, ya que trabajan juntos. 
Se siente muy a gusto haciendo su trabajo, ya que le es retribuido con los buenos ingresos que tiene, pero calcula que necesitará de alguna ayuda adicional, pues ya se quiere preparar para la campaña navideña próxima. Sus planes es hacer su negocio más grande y próspero.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además se compromete a ser puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con el lindo grupo al que pertenece, y al cual desea pertenecer por mucho más tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado, 1200 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de calzado (sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos) y algunos otros productos hasta donde alcance su presupuesto.
texts.en:
Lisi, 28, is an idealistic and very friendly young woman.  She and her partner have two children, who are 8 and 5.  They all live together in their own house.  Both she and her partner work hard so that they can give their children a better quality of life.

Lisi sells shoes, which she sells by walking around a market near her home.  She also has a stall, where her partner stays to make sales, since they work together.

She really enjoys doing this work, since the compensation is the good income they have, but she thinks they need some additional help because they want to prepare for next Christmas's sales. Her plans are to have a bigger and more prosperous business.

This is her second loan with microfinance partner MFP.  She is very happy that she knows she can get financial support, as it makes her feel secure about making her business grow.  In addition, she promises to pay punctually, since she wants to stay on good terms with the wonderful group of which she is a part and of which she wants to remain a part for a long time.

With the sum requested, 1200 soles ($450), she will buy a larger quantity of shoes (sandals, flip flops, shoes) and some other products until she uses up her budget.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn, 29, is married and has three children. 

She is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. Genalyn primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs to supplement her income. 

Genalyn is a hard-working mother and only wants the best for her children. It is her goal to send them to school and provide a healthy home for her family.

Genalyn has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, piglets and feed. She hopes for her income to increase so that she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo, a driver. They have two children. One is in college level and one is already working. 

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining child all the way through college. This is a dream for Filipino parents like her as she herself is an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jocelyn operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 330 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Jocelyn dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials like fabric and thread needed in her business.

loans.name: Jessiery

texts.en:
Jessiery is 25 years old and is a married woman with two children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol, with her family. 

She has been in the business of raising hogs for almost two years. She earns about 5,000 PHP per momth doing this hog-raising business. Jessiery also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store to help with her family's daily needs.

Jessiery is requesting a loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Jessiery hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old and married. She has four children. With all the children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Mercy has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 42-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to Samuel and they have four children between 18 and 25 years old.

Rosemary operates a soft drink business in Kisumu. She has had this business for 12 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is now taking a second loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy 10 crates of soda, milk, water and other drinks. Her profits will be used to add more stock to the business.

Her dream is to have a big soft drink business.

loans.use: To buy 10 crates of soda , milk, water and other drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of tomatoes, onions, lemons and garlic.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena works hard to support her family. Azucena is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Azucena has been in this business for 15 years now.

Azucena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishnet, bamboo and other fishing equipment for her business.

In the future, Azucena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, bamboo and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Monad

texts.ru: Монад 1960 года рождения, она замужем имеет 5 детей. Торгует на рынке продуктами питания а точнее печеньем и другим сладостями.Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 4 года. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. У нее есть клиенты, которые постоянно у нее приобретают товар. Монад  получает очередной кредит для расширения ассортимента. Она старается увеличить и разнообразить свой ассортимент товара, для того что бы увеличить потребителей. Монад в будущем планирует открыть свой  продуктовый магазин. Надеется на поддержку от  Арванд.
texts.en:
Monad was born in 1960, she's married and raising five children. She's sold cookies and sweets at a local market for the past four years and has obtained regular customers. Monad is asking for another loan in order to increase her product assortment, which will attract additional clients. In the future, she plans to open her own grocery shop.
Monad has been associated with MDO Arvand since 2008 and is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to purchase additional

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He works hard to provide them with a good and healthy living. Mahdi has worked in agriculture for 10 years. It is his only source for earning a living. That's why he puts so much effort into expanding it and taking care of his cattle.
Mahdi applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary food for his cattle.
This is his first experience with Al Majmoua, and he hopes that the future ones will be invested in increasing his heads of cattle.
Mahdi trades with his cattle's milk and meat. The dairy products that he produces are with a very good quality according to most of his customers.
Mahdi is planning to increase his number of cattle in the near future and hopes to own a big dairy products factory of his own.

loans.use: to buy necessary food for his cattle.

loans.name: Qamariddin

texts.ru: Камариддин проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Сам Камариддин занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и садоводством. В этой области он 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Qamariddin lives in the Jilikul region of Tajikistan. He's married and has one child. He's been growing various crops and plants for the past sixteen years. 
He's asking for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Jesus

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el cual es conocido por su clima cálido, también se desarrolla la agricultura  en especial el cultivo de algodón. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos de su barrio, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Carlos trabaja con mucho esfuerzo en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el le dedica a sui trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo es muy responsable cuando conduce, por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Carlos esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, productos de limpieza para el hogar, menestras, gaseosas, entre otros, para iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, entre otros; así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un auto”.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old and lives in the Parcona district, which is known for its hot climate and agriculture production, especially cotton. When Carlos has free time, he likes to play soccer with his neighborhood friends. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Ceviche," a fish dish. He only completed secondary studies but he would have liked to study Mechanical Engineering.

Carlos works hard in his business as a taxi driver. He works around 10 hours a day and service up to 40 customers in one day. He believes that his business is going well because he is friendly and, above all, always very responsible when he drives. For this reason, people always recommend him.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help that they ave given him, he will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, household cleaning products, mixed vegetables, soft drinks among others to start his grocery business, among other products. This way, he will be able to increase his income and quality of life, and to keep working in order to achieve his greatest desire: to have a car.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, household cleaning products, mixed vegetables, soft drinks, among others).

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса-фермер из Украины. Она начинала свою деятельность агрономом в сельском хозяйстве,а теперь со своей семьей занимается фермерством на паевых участках. Посадила участки черешни и абрикоса,также занимается виноградарством,овощеводством(помидоры,огурцы). 

В последнее время, после смерти мужа-главного помощника по хозяйству Раисе стало трудно справляться одной. Конечно же ей помогают дети,но в свое свободное время.23-х летний сын,окончив Агротехнологическую Академию работает пожарником, 17-ти летняя дочь учится на художника оформителя в культпросвете.Семья покойного мужа также помогает Раисе по хозяйству.

Обрабатывать участок площадью 10 га семье очень сложно поэтому необходимо нанимать работников.К сожалению у семьи нет таких средств. Приобретение мотоблока значительно ускорит процесс подготовки земли к посадке растений,уменьшит количество сорняков. 

Раиса нуждается в помощи, мечтает в будущем поставить теплицу для посадки клубники, купить опрыскиватель, очень важную вещь в хозяйстве.Развивая свою ферму помочь сельскому хозяйству Украины расти и процветать!

Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока.
texts.en:
Raisa is a farmer from Ukraine.  She started her work as an agronomist at an agricultural collective and is now involved in farming together with her family on privatized land.  She planted areas of cherries and apricots and is also involved in growing grapes and vegetables (tomatoes and cucumbers).  Lately, following her the death of her husband, who was the primary farm-work helper, it became difficult for Raisa to work alone.  Of course, the children help her, but only in their free time.  Her 23 year-old son works as a firefighter after graduating from the Agrotechnological Academy, and the 17 year-old daughter studies to become an artist-decorator in Kulprosvet.  The family of her late husband help Raisa with the business as well.  
It is difficult for the family to work on ten hectares of land, and this is why it is necessary to hire workers.  Unfortunately, the family does not have such means.  A purchase of farming machinery would significantly speed up the process of preparing the soil for sowing plants and reduce the number of weeds.  Raisa needs help and in the future dreams of building a greenhouse for planting strawberries, buying a sprayer - a very important thing in the farming business.  She wants to help agricultural businesses of Ukraine to grow and flourish by developing her farm!  She needs your help with financing farming machinery.

loans.use: to purchase farming machinery

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Более 8 лет Шаходат занимается купле- продажей скота. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Шаходат старательная женщина, работает усердно чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. Шаходат начала свой бизнес, получая займ от «ИМОН Интернешнл» и успешно развивала его. Имеет большой богатый опыт. Она также занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и продает местным жителям. Она также выращивает корм для скота. Шаходат запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shahodat is a married and diligent woman, focused on improving her quality of life. She has one child. For over eight years, Shahodat has made a living by buying and selling cattle. She began and expanded this business with a loan from "IMON International". Additionally, she grows crops for sale to the locals. Leftover crops are used as fodder. 
Shahodat is asking for a loan in order to purchase some cattle and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr: Latyr est un homme marié et père de huit enfants. Il pratique le commerce de bétail dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui se tiennent le long de  la semaine dans les différentes localités de sa région. Il élève aussi des boeufs avec la méthode de l'embouche bovine pour les  les revendre.Ces deux activité lui permettent d'avoir des revenus assez importants pour prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famill ainsi que ses propres besoins. Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 2 boeufs. Son ambition est de renforcer d'avantage son activité.
texts.en: Latyr is married and the father of eight. He sells livestock at the weekly market that are held throughout the week in different villages of his region. He also fattens cattle for resale. These two business activities allow him to gain sufficient revenues in order to take care of the everyday needs of his family as well as his personal needs. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 West African francs to purchase two cows. His goal is to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: 71-1Ro De Mayo Dos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 71-1ro de Mayo Dos está  compuesto por nueve integrantes, seis mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. ANGELICA tiene 34 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el que tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 13, 7 y 1 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta  que se encuentran en la zona los pinos,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Angelica va a usar este préstamo para compra juegos de mesas por su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela y le hace falta las mesas para brindar comodidad a su clientes. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es  la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Angelica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener estabilidad  y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, la Sra. Angelica se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado a ella y a su compañeras de grupo ya que son personas trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank 71-1ro de Mayo Dos is made up of nine members, six woman and three men. The president of the bank ANGELICA is 34 years old. She is not married but lives with her partner. They have had three children together who are 13, 7 and 1 years old. She earns her living selling food at her food stall which is located in the los pinos area. 

She is asking for a loan to buy sets of tables and chairs for her business since she has many customers but she does not have tables for the comfort of her  customers. She is asking for this loan because she does not have working capital. Angelica faces the challenge of a lack of stability in her business. She is going to use the profits to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Angelica feels happy and is grateful to the institution for the support it has given her and her colleagues from the group, since they are hard-working people who, in most cases, help improve their family’s situation.

loans.use: to buy sets of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Evert Jose

texts.es: EL Sr. Evert José de 36 años edad tiene como actividad económica como conductor está solicitando el financiamiento para la construcción de una perded perimetral costado este de la casa el  deseaba  construir dicha recamara la cual no había podido debido a las limitantes  económicas, en la actualidad  el ha exteriorizado que  ha mejorado su nivel de vida gracias al apoyo que fundación le ha brindado, con el crédito  comprara  material de construcción como :  cemento, hierro, cal, zinc, arena, clavos, bloques, piedrín entre otros.
texts.en: Evert José, 36 years old, works as a driver and is requesting a loan to build a side perimeter of his house. He wanted to build this room but he had not been able to due to financial limitations. Currently, he has shown that he has improved his standard of living thanks to the help given to him by the foundation. With this loan, he will buy construction material such as cement, iron, lime, zinc, sand, nails, blocks, gravel, and other products.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, lime, zinc, sand, nails, blocks, gravel, among other products.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 30 years old, married and a father of one child. He has been successfully selling clothes for the past two years. 

This marks his third loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop and repay his loan. He hopes to excel in business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers to sell

loans.name: Afifa

texts.en:
Afifa is a 49-year-old married woman, mother of four children, who has been working in clothing sales for 19 years. Through visiting neighbors, friends and relatives she sells her products.

In March 2012, Afifa decided to settle. She opened her own clothes and lingerie shop. She is very happy and excited with the step she took. She is a hard worker, well known in the region. Her shop is located in a densely populated area with different nationalities. Afifa has to be always updating her business to attract different visitors everyday. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with special spring and summer collection.

Afifa hopes to start wholesale trade in the near future.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special spring and summer collection

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Delma has been in this business for 25 years.

Delma requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, nylon cord, etc. for her fishing.

In the future, Delma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon cord, etc. for her fishing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married and the mother of seven children. For the last 12 years, she has worked hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 NWTF to buy fishing equipment. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao was born in 1949 in Tien Duong village, Dong Anh district. Her husband has retired. Her main income has been from growing rice, raising pigs and chickens for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000,000 VND and total income of her family is about 5,000,000 VND. Dao has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2004. In this loan cycle, she needs a loan amount of 9,810,000 VND to buy food for pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and chickens

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la Provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el centro poblado de Yanahuara, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica de la socia Marcelina es la venta de mermeladas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Marcelina requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa osea va refaccionar las paredes y las puertas. 

La socia Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Marcelina was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, Cusco Department but currently lives in the settlement of Yanahuara.  She’s 38-years-old and in a common law relationship; she has three children.

Marcelina’s economic activity is selling marmalade.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She needs the loan to do some home repairs, that is, she’s going to upgrade the walls and doors.

Marcelina belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “San Martín de Yanahuara” communal bank in Cusco Department.

loans.use: to upgrade walls and doors in her home

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años, es una buena mujer, amable y muy responsable. Con su pareja tienen cuatro hijos de 10, 19, 7 y 1 año. Juntos viven en su casa propia, desde donde viven la ilusión de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Su trabajo es el transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, pero ella no es la que se dedica a manejar los vehículos, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, quien maneja el carro. También posee un motocarro, el cual lo da a un chofer que se encarga de trabajar a diario y pagar una suma en forma de alquiler. Lleva dos años con este negocio y le gusta porque le permite tener el tiempo disponible para estar a lado de su familia y poder brindarles los cuidados necesarios. Tiene planes de comprar otro vehículo para aumentar sus ingresos.

Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus proyectos. Se compromete a seguir siendo la cliente puntual y muy responsable como es hasta ahora. Espera seguir trabajando con su banco comunal, ya que son muy buenos, amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará llantas y piezas que su vehículo. Esto debido a que se deterioraron por el paso del tiempo y necesita ser refaccionado.
texts.en:
María is 43-years-old, is a good, friendly, and very responsible woman.  With her partner she has four children of the ages 10, 19, 7, and 1.  Together they live in their own home, from where they live out the illusion of offering a better quality of life for their family.  

Her work is transporting cargo and passengers within the city, but she is not the one devoted to driving the vehicles; for this she relies on the help of her son, who drives the car.  She also has a motorcycle, which she gives to a chauffeur who is in charge of working every day and who pays a sum in the form of rent.  She has two years of experience in this business and enjoys it because it allows her to have time available to spend on the side with her family and to be able to offer them the care they need.  She has plans to buy another vehicle in order to increase her income.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, therefore she hopes to continue with her plans.  She promises to continue being a punctual client and as responsible as she has been up until now.  She hopes to continue working with her communal bank because they are very good, friendly, and responsible people.  With the amount she has asked for, 2000 nuevos soles, she will buy tires and parts for her vehicle.  This is because it has deteriorated with the passage of time and needs to be repaired.

loans.use: to fix her motorcycle.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 65 years old and married with five children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Conchita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 31 years.

Conchita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Delta

texts.en: Delta is 57 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last 25 years, she has worked very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional items, such as sugar and soap, to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to build up and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 38 years old and married. Carmela has two children, who are in school.

Carmela is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Carmela has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Carmela has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is married and has four children. He sells beer and soft drinks to earn a living. He has been in the business for 8 years. He also does farming to supplement his income. Jacob has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a repair shop and also sells spare parts. Her husband is a engine mechanic and does the repairs in their business. Teresita has requested this loan to purchase tools and spare parts. She hopes for their income to increase so that they would be able to pay for their children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos vive en la localidad de Achacachi y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería por más de nueve horas al día, es por eso que requiere el crédito para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para aumentar sus volúmenes de producción de leche y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y poder mantener a su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer de ambulancia y no gana mucho; solo les alcanza para los gastos familiares, es ella la que cubre los gastos alimenticios y estudios para sus hijos.
Rosa solo estudio hasta la primaria y la casa donde vive es de adobe y el piso de tierra y tampoco cuentan con seguro medico.
El sueño que tiene Rosa, es mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mas ganado para obtener mejores ingresos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has four children.  She lives in the town of Achacachi, where she works nine hours a day as a farmer and livestock breeder.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a pair of dairy cows to raise her milk production volume.  This will increase her income so that she can support her family.  Her husband is an ambulance driver and does not earn much money, so she is solely responsible for obtaining what is needed to cover the family expenses, such as food and an education for her children.  

Rosa only has an elementary school education.  The house in which she lives is made of adobe and has dirt floors.  She does not have medical insurance.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life and have more cattle so that she can generate a better income to help pay for her children's education.  

This is the first time Rosa has worked IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela con su credikiva compró mercancía como ropa fantasía, cosméticos, papelería  y surtió su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual ampliará su gama de artículos de fantasía y surtirá una vez más su vitrina. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por la oportunidad que me dieron para invertir en mi negocio eso es lo que uno quiere que lo tengan en cuenta, que nos sigan apoyando para poder llegar lejos………. sé que eso es lo que voy a lograr”.
texts.en:
Graciela used her Kiva loan to buy merchandise like costumes, cosmetics and stationery supplies and stocked her store.  She’s now applying for a Kiva loan to expand the range of costume items and once again stock her display case.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the opportunity you gave me to invest in my business; it’s something one wants you to be aware of and that you continue supporting us so that we can get far….I know that’s what I will accomplish.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 39 años, es una buena mujer, amable y muy responsable. Está casada y es madre de dos hijos de 7 y 5 años. Vive en una casa alquilada a lado de su esposo y sus dos menores hijos, por quienes trabaja mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Su trabajo es la venta de herramientas, ya que tiene una ferretería ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, en una zona muy concurrida. Lleva recién 9 meses con este negocio, tiene el respaldo y apoyo de su esposo, con quien trabaja. Como todo nuevo negocio aun está entrando al mercado y espera poder crecer de a pocos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que está a lado de su esposo, pues se entienden bien. Le está yendo bien, ya que el movimiento es diario, no como quisieran, pero al menos están teniendo suficientes ganancias. Espera consolidar su negocio y crecer mucho más en su faceta de empresaria ferretera.

Éste es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará mercadería para surtir su ferretería y así continuar con su proyecto de agrandarla.
texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and a good woman, kind, and very responsible. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 7 and 5. Patricia lives in a rented house along with her husband and her 2 minor children, for whom she works hard to offer a better quality of life.

Patricia sells hardware. She has a hardware store located in the center of the city, in a much traveled zone. Patricia has had the business for 9 months and she enjoys the backing and help of her husband, with whom she works. Like all new businesses, it is still entering the market and she hopes to be able to grow, little by little. What she likes most about her work is being beside her husband, because they get along well. The business is doing well; it grows daily, not as much as they would like, but at least they are making sufficient profits. She hope to consolidate the business and grow much more as a hardware business person. 

This is Patricia's 3rd loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue with her objectives. And in addition, Patricia promises, once more, to comply with her payment schedule, as in her earlier loans. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive persons.

With the amount requested, 1,000 new sols, she will purchase merchandise to re-stock her hardware store and, thus, continue with her expansion project.

loans.use: to expand the merchandise in her hardware store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy the ingredients she needs to make more food items to sell to her customers. In the future, Catherine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Hermana

texts.en:
Hermana is married and has children.  She has a bakery business in the Philippines, which she has had for 15 years.  She works hard to support her family. 

Hermana is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy ingredients for her bakery.  In the future, Hermana would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Susime

texts.en: Susime is married and has worked hard to support her family for the last 26 years by running a salted shrimp business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more salted shrimp to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more salted shrimp to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s electrical repairs business. He operates his business from a nearby market and  as well as repairing electrical items for his clients, he also sells wires, bulbs and other electrical products. 

Robina is the mother of three daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying while her son is still under school age. 

With the loan investment, Robina's husband will buy tools so that he can offer a better quality service to his clients. He will also buy bulbs, wires, and other items to sell. He is very experienced in his business and Robina is confident that the business will grow after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy electrician's tools and electrical items to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a vinegar retail business in the Philippines, which she has had for 30 years.  She also earns additional income from hog raising.

Isabelita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more vinegar to sell to her customers.  In the future, Isabelita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more vinegar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. For the last six years, she has worked very hard to provide for her family by running a variety store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the past, she  has received other loans through Kiva. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old, married, and has one child.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.  She earns additional income from farming rice. Helen works hard to provide for her family. 

Helen is requesting her twelfth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell such detergent, soft drinks, and bread. Helen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as detergent, soft drinks, and bread.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more cosmetics for her beauty parlor business.

NWTF is relisting Gerlie 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Isela Claribel

texts.es:
Isela Claribel, es casada tiene 23 años de edad, vive en San Pedro Sula con su esposo y una hija de 2 años de edad.
Anteriormente Isela trabajo en una maquiladora, pero decidió establecer su taller de confección en su casa para atender también a su familia. Ella vende y confecciona cortinas, forros para muebles y juegos de sabanas y también prendas de vestir. Este negocio lo estableció hace un año con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Con este préstamo de 5,000.00 lempiras se va abastecer de insumos como Telas, hilos, zíperes, agujas y otros que necesita para la confección de sabanas, cortinas que le han solicitado sus clientes. El préstamo le ayudara a salir de los compromisos de entrega pendientes y a incrementar los ingresos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio para llegar a tener una mini maquila y contratar  personal que le ayude con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Isela Claribel is 23 years old and married.  She lives in San Pedro Sula with her husband and their two year old daughter.

Isela previously worked in a factory.  However, she decided to establish her seamstress shop in her house in order to also take care of her family.  She makes and sells curtains, slipcovers, sheet sets, and clothing.  She started this business a year ago with the hope of helping her husband with the household expenses.

She will use this loan for 5,000 lempiras to stock up on supplies like fabric, thread, zippers, needles, and others that she needs to make sheets and curtains that her customers have ordered.  The loan will help her fill the current orders and increase her income.

Her goal is to grow in her business in order to have a mini-factory and to hire people to help her with the work.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, zippers, trim, and lace, etc. to make curtains, sheets, and slipcovers.

loans.name: Olmedo

texts.es:
Olmedo tiene 45 años, es un hombre separado, padre de dos hijas de 16 y 15 años. Ellas viven a lado de su madre, pero él de manera mensual les envía para sus gastos y necesidades. Ahora vive en la casa de sus padres con su hermana y la familia de ella.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Anteriormente trabajaba como electricista hasta que un lamentable accidente le causo la mutilación de tres dedos, al no poder seguir con esa actividad decidió que tenía que hacer alguna otra actividad y empezó a trabajar como mototaxista. Así pudo trabajar poco a poco y empezó a generar buenos ingresos, es por eso que decidió comprar otro motocarro y seguir creciendo con su negocio. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene tiempo libre para poder realizar sus cosas, se siente más tranquilo porque aunque corre algunos riesgos con algunos conductores distraídos, este trabajo es más seguro que el anterior.

Éste es su quinto préstamo con MFP. Le va bien en su grupo, gracias a los prestamos recibidos anteriormente pudo comprar una moto más, y espera seguir pagando sus cuotas de manera puntual, siendo responsable como hasta ahora.
En esta oportunidad solicita 3500 soles, para la reparación sus dos motocarros, ya que están deteriorados por el uso y el mal estado de las pistas. También comprará el seguro obligatorio y la tarjeta de circulación.
texts.en:
Olmedo, 45, is separated and the father of two daughters, ages 16 and 15.  They live with their mother but he sends them money on a monthly basis for their expenses and necessities.  Now he lives in his parents' house with his sister and her family.

He has worked in passenger transportation for two years.  He used to work as an electrician until an unfortunate accident caused the mutilation of three fingers.  Unable to continue with this job, he decided that he had to do some other job and began to work as a motorcycle taxi driver.  Little by little he managed to work and he began to generate good income.  For this reason he decided to buy another "motocarro" [three-wheeled motorized vehicle] and continue growing with his business.

He likes his job because he has free time to be able to do his things.  He has greater peace of mind because, although he runs some risks with some distracted drivers, this job is safer than his previous one.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and it is going well for him in his group.  Thanks to the previous loans he managed to buy one more motorcycle.  He hopes to be able to continue making his payments punctually, being responsible as he has been thus far.

This time he is requesting 3500 soles [PEN] to repair his two vehicles, which are deteriorated because of use and bad road conditions.  He also will buy the required insurance and driver's license.

loans.use: to repair his "motocarros" [three-wheeled motorized vehicles].

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 20 años, es una joven madre muy alegre y amable. Junto a su pareja tienen un hijo de un año. 
Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, que está ubicada en una concurrida calle. Vende comestibles y otros productos de tocador y perfumería. Lleva realizando este trabajo por un año y medio, y le está yendo bien. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede tener tiempo libre para hacer algunas otras actividades, además el dinero que genera en su negocio es diario.

Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse más con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1200 soles, comprará más productos para su bodega, ya que le hace falta algunas variedades de jabón y detergentes, también leche, que son las cosas que demandan a diario.
texts.en: Rosa is 20 years old, a young mother and very cheerful and nice. She has a one year-old son with her spouse. She sells basic everyday items in a small grocery shop in her house, located in a very busy street. She sells foodstuffs as well as perfume and beauty products. She has been in this business for the last year and a half, and things are going well. She likes her work because it allows her free time to do other activities and because it brings in money every day. This is her second loan with field partner Microfinanzas Prisma; she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support that will give her greater peace of mind and will help her move her business forward. She promises to pay her monthly repayments on time and to become more involved with the members of her communal bank, who are very supportive. With the 1,200 soles she asks for, she will buy more products to sell at her shop, since she is lacking some brands of soap and detergent, as well as milk: all products which are in demand every day.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Isis Adonia

texts.es:
Isis, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 años y 11 meses de edad, residente de la ciudad de san Pedro Sula.
Doña Isis se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de bisutería como ser aretes, cadenas, pulseras, gargantillas y  anillos. Además tiene el servicio de alquiler de sillas y mesas para eventos especiales que le genera otros ingresos.
Estos productos los elabora de piedras como de Jade, perlas, amatista, turquesa etc. cristales de distintos colores, mostacillas, y otros. Es un producto que se vende mucho porque es muy bonito.
Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF, este es de 21,000.00 Lempiras y lo necesita para comprar dos vitrinas de vidrio para exhibir el producto que elabora, aprovechando la oportunidad que le están dando en un supermercado local y también va comprar insumos de bisutería para surtir el negocio.
Esta inversión le va ayudar a incrementar las ventas y en un futuro tener su propio local ya que es su sueño tenerlo en un área comercial.
texts.en:
Isis is 36 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 11, in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Isis makes jewelry like earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and rings.  She also has a service of renting chairs and tables for special events, and this generates other income.  She makes her products with stones like jade, pearls, amethyst, and turquoise, etc.  She uses different colors of crystals, beads, and others.  It is a product that sells a lot because it is so pretty.

She is requesting her third loan from ODEF for 21,000 lempiras.  She needs it to buy two glass display cases to exhibit the product that she makes.  She will be taking advantage of the opportunity of putting her product in a local supermarket.  She will also buy jewelry supplies to stock the business.

This investment will help her increase sales.  It will also help her to have her own place in the future; her dream is to have a place in a commercial area.

loans.use: to buy two glass display cases and jewelry supplies to stock the business.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou est un agriculteur qui exerce en même temps l'activité d'embouche bovine.Durant toute l'année, il fait au moins quatre opération d'embouche.Il achète ainsi des boeufs qu'il engraisse et revend à de bons prix. Ceci lui permet de générer des revenus constants pour la prise en charge correcte des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter 1 bœuf.Il ambitionne d'augmenter le nombre de boeufs à élever.
texts.en: Saliou is a farmer who also raises cattle.  Over a one-year period he completes at least four cycles of fattening cattle. He buys cattle, fattens them and resells at a good price. This allows him to have  a steady revenue   as needed to take proper care of his family’s needs. In order to start a new cycle, he is seeking a loan of 250,000 West African francs to purchase one cows. His goal is to increase the number of cattle heads to raise.

loans.use: to buy one cow.

loans.name: Denia Osiris

texts.es:
Denia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos y vive en Cofradia, Cortes.
Hace 10 años que Denia decidió junto con su esposo establecer su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, abarrotes, vanidades, refrescos, etc. Su  negocio lo ha mantenido surtido reinvirtiendo sus ganancias y con varios préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF, actualmente solicita un préstamo por 25,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de productos de abarrotería y otros como granos básicos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, etc. con el fin de incrementar las ventas y las ganancias y ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes.
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Ten years ago Denia decided, together with her husband, to establish her own business selling staple products like basic grains, dairy products, meat, grocery store items, beauty products, and soft drinks, etc.  She has kept her business stocked by reinvesting her earnings and with the various loans that she has requested from ODEF.

She is currently requesting a loan for 25,000 lempiras to stock grocery products and things like basic grains, cleaning products, and soft drinks, etc.  She will do that in order to increase sales and income and to provide new products for her customers.

Her goal is to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 35 años, es una buena mujer, amable y muy responsable. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años. Viven con su padre, y junto a su esposo trabajan mucho para poder brindar lo mejor a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida. Vende almuerzos diarios en su casa, pero sólo a personas con las que hace contrato. Trabaja en este negocio por al menos hace 10 diez años, y lo hace sola. Los domingos se va a los colegios donde haya alguna actividad deportiva y aprovecha para vender comida (parrilladas, cebiches y otros platos). Sus clientes saben cómo cocina y esperan con ansias para deleitarse con su exquisita sazón. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene independencia, además de poder manejar su tiempo como mejor le parece. Le está yendo bien, ya que genera buenos ingresos, además tiene el apoyo de su pareja quien también trabaja para el sustento de la familia.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas, como en sus créditos anteriores. También está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará materiales para mejorar la infraestructura del local (de su casa) para su negocio. También comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platos.
texts.en:
Rosario, 35, is a good, kind, very responsible woman.  She and her spouse have three children who are 15, 11 and 6 years old.  They live with her father and she and her husband work hard to give their children the best and to improve their quality of life.

She works selling food.  She sells lunches at home but only to people she contracts with.  She’s been in this business for at least 10 years and she does it alone.  On Sundays she goes to schools where sports activities may be taking place to sell food (grilled meat, marinated seafood and other dishes).  Her customers know how she cooks and anxiously await her to enjoy the tasty dishes.  She likes her work because it gives her independence and she’s able to manage her time as she pleases.  She’s doing well since she generates good income.  In addition, she has her spouse’s support who also works to support the family.

This is her MFP loan #5 so she’s hoping to continue with her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually like she did with her previous loans.  She’s also very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy materials to improve the infrastructure of her locale (her house) and will also buy ingredients and supplies to continue preparing her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Caña Brava  (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las 14 socias y los 2 socios del Banco Comunal Caña Brava. Las mismas que se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio en general.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene  44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 9  hijos, 7 de ellos ya son mayores de de edad y los 2 menores estudian en colegio, con ellos también vive un pequeño nieto que tiene 5 años y estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar trabaja en una casa realizando quehaceres domésticos, también se dedica al comercio ya que vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días aunque sus ventas las realiza por las noches o los fines de semana, sus hijos le ayudan en sus ventas cuando ella está trabajando, deja a crédito sus prendas  y cobra cada quince días. Ella compra su mercadería  en  Portoviejo en un lugar donde le dejan a muy buen precio. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto pueden sus hijos seguir estudiando.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es ver que sus últimos hijos se realicen como profesionales.

En la última fila de la foto está un socio que no se le ve el rostro, por tal motivo se le tomó una foto individual aparte.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscape and for its beautiful fresh water resorts that are highly visited by many tourists, every 15 days the 14 female members and 2 male members of the Caña Brava Communal Bank meet.  The same members who make a living through agriculture, raising animals, and general commerce.
 
In this place lives Señora Mercedes, who is 44-years-old and maintains a  common-law marriage of which she has 9 children, 7 of whom are already older and the two younger children are in high school.  Also living with them is a small grandson who is 5 and studies in kindergarten.  Her husband makes a living in agriculture.

Our friend, with the intention of earning something for her account and with this be able to help with the household expenses, works in a home doing housework.  She also makes a living through commerce by selling clothing of all kinds, which she sells in the form of going door to door.  She works every day although her sales are carried out during the nights and weekends.  Her children help with her sales when she is working, leaving her garments by credit and charging every 15 days.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo in a place where they sell at a very good price.  She has spent more than 8 years making a living through this work, and thanks to this her children are able to keep studying.
 
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, shirts, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and likes it for the help they give her to succeed.

Her dream is to see that her last children become professionals.

In the last row of the photo there is a member whose face you cannot see; for this reason they have taken a separate individual photo.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is married and has seven children. She works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. 

Vicenta is requesting her seventh loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Velda

texts.es:
Velda tiene 35 años, es una buena mujer, amable y muy trabajadora. Con su pareja tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años. Junto viven en su casa propia, donde también están sus padres y su abuelo, a quienes ella y su pareja atienden y brindan comodidades necesarias para que puedan tener un buen estilo de vida.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida. Desde muy temprano sale al mercado a buscar las mejores verduras y las carnes más frescas, así vuelve a su casa donde se pone a preparar sus deliciosos platos de comida, los que venderá por la tarde en un espacio que acondiciona en el frontis de su casa. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y está muy feliz de tener muchos clientes que se sienten a gusto con ella y van a diario en busca de su buena atención y excelente sazón.
Le gusta su trabajo porque puede darse el tiempo para hacer las cosas de su hogar, además que tiene buenos ingresos, aunque al principio le fue difícil ganarse a los clientes, lo logró a base de esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio, además de dar buen trato y tener una excelente sazón. Para más adelante, espera poder aumentar su variedad de platos, para ello necesita de una ayuda para su inversión.

Éste es su tercer préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio y poder seguir creciendo. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia responsable, como fue en el préstamo anterior. Además, menciona estar muy contenta de trabajar con el banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que todos son buenos y sobre todo muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará una cocina industrial, algunos utensilios para seguir con su trabajo, así como ingredientes e insumos necesarios para sus exquisitos platos de comida.
texts.en:
Velda, 35, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  She and her spouse have two children who are 9 and 6 years old.  They live together in their own house where her parents and grandfather also live and who she and her spouse care for providing necessary comforts so that they can have a good lifestyle.

She works selling food.  She heads out to the market very early to look for the best vegetables and the freshest meat returning home to start preparing her delicious plates of food that she’ll sell in the afternoon in a space she has set up in front of her house.  She’s been in this business three years and is very happy to have many customers who feel good with her and go daily in search of good service and excellent tasting food.

She likes her work because she can have time to do her household things and because she earns good income.  Although it was difficult at first to acquire customers based on effort and much sacrifice added to the good service and tasty dishes, she eventually succeeded.  For later on, she hopes to expand the variety of her dishes but to do so needs help for the investment.

This is her 3rd MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she will feel surer of advancing with her business and be able to continue growing.  On the other hand, she commits to continue being a responsible member like she was with the previous loan.  She also mentions that she’s very happy to work in the communal bank she belongs to because all are good and above all very mutually supportive.

She will use the 1500 soles requested to buy an industrial stove and some utensils to continue with her work as well as some ingredients and supplies needed for her exquisite dishes of food.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and other utensils.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  Mary Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. Mary Rose earns additional income raising livestock.

Mary Rose is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  Mary Rose aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 57 years old, widowed, and has three children. Evangeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Evangeline is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Moises Flavio

texts.es:
Moises tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, Ica Perú. La ciudad de Pisco en una ciudad muy visitada por los turistas ya que aquí encontramos a las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas” en estos lugares hermoso encontramos un paisaje bellísimo en el cual podemos relajarnos y apreciar su belleza. Cuando Moisés tiene un tiempo libre le gusta salir a jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrios, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Estofado de Pollo”. Moises solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Gastronomía.

Con mucho esfuerzo Moisés trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 23 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos y porque cocina con mucho gusto.

Moises está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera, caña de guayaquil entre otros para remodelar su negocio ya que ha podido encontrar un terrenito donde tener su local de venta de comida; de esta manera el podrá tener un local mas cómodo para su clientes  y así mejorar su ingresos y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Moisés, 28, lives in the city of Pisco in Ica, Perú.  The city of Pisco is a city that’s visited by many tourists because the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum are found here; they have beautiful scenery where one can relax and enjoy its beauty.  When Moisés has any free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors and also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Estofado de Pollo.”  Moisés only studied up to fifth grade of secondary school but would have like to have studied Gastronomy.

With much effort Moisés works in his business selling food; he spends about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 23 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he prepares tasty dishes and because he cooks with much joy.

Moisés is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy wood and cane stalks from Guayaquil to remodel his business because he’s found a small lot where he can install his food stand and thus have a way of providing more customer comfort and improve his income to continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy lumber and can stalks.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Loeng is a 24-year-old married woman and a resident of Baray district. She has a small young kid who is under her care. She is a local rice cultivator who has been operating this business for many years. But due to experiencing financial difficulties, she decided to work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city in order to lift her family out of poverty. 

With the loan amount of USD 800, she would like to purchase a used motorcycle for personal use so that she can travel to work by herself every day without paying for transportation fees as she did previously. This loan will enable her to cut down on some expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Guadalupe is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Guadalupe has a electronics repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

Guadalupe has been in this business for three years. In the future, Guadalupe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her electronic repair shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years.

Susan is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy groceries to sell in her store.  Susan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marielisa Genoveva

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marielisa, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
 
Nuestra amiga es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos días más que todo por las mañanas, además  tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Ella está desde que se inicio el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique y comprar un carro para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Productivo” (Productive) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its pre-colonial culture and crafts that are famous nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Marielisa, 33, lives here and is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 10 and 7 years old and attending school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Our girlfriend is a great housewife who in order to earn her own income sells food and Avon and L'Bel products via catalogue (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works every day especially during the morning.  She also has several customers who come by her house to buy her products.  She sells on credit and collects every weekend.  She’s been in this line of work for more than five years and does very well.
 
This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank since the start and likes it because of the benefits gotten from the institution.  Her dream is to have a boutique and to buy a car to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Urubamba en la provincia  de Urubamba  departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria; la socia tiene 59 años, separada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable, ella trabaja todos los días en su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas y golosinas para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, venta de artesanía, librería, tienda de abarrotes y otros socios trabajan como docentes, recepcionista de hotel, preventista de productos de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Las Margaritas” (The Daisies) communal bank located in Urubamba Province’s Urubamba District in Cusco Department.

María, 59, is separated and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with a grocery business.  She sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.  She’s been in this business for some time and supports her family by means of it. She’s a cheerful, responsible person who works in her business every day.  She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family. She’s asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks and snacks for her business.
