The other members are clothes merchants, sell crafts, stationery shop, grocery store and others work as teachers, hotel receptionist and in grocery store products presales.

She is grateful for this means of facilitating credit and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos 2 dos quais ainda continuam com seus Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele. 
É do quadro do Ministério da Defesa Nacional (militar) e com presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, areia, pedra e outros) para pode dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.

No futuro pretende continuar com os seus estudos para aumentar a sua renda mensal em sua casa. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Cesar is married and has three children; two of them still go to school. He lives in his own house with his family and supports a nephew who lives with him.

He is employed by the Ministry of National Defense (as a soldier), and he intends to use this loan to buy construction materials (cemente, blocks, sand, stone and other materials) to continue building his house.

In the future, Cesar plans to continue his studies so he can increase his household's monthly income. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out more loans.

His challenge is to finish his house so he can make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Assane est un sapeur pompier qui sert dans sa localité au centre du Sénégal.Il est marié et père de famille.Il sollicite un prêt de 200000f pour compléter son capital afin de faire des constructions dans sa maison.
texts.en:
Assane works as a firefighter in his hometown at the center of Senegal. He is married with children. 

He is seeking a loan of 200,000F to bolster his home improvement budget.

loans.use: to finance home improvements projects.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Estrella is requesting loan for  10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.  In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Eiva

texts.es:
Eiva tiene 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Su pareja es Oswaldo, quien es técnico en refrigeración y con quien vive al lado de sus dos hijos Oswaldo de 18 años y Héctor de 15 años de edad. La casa que habitan es propia, pues la lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo.

Su negocio es el mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración, para eso han instalando un pequeño taller en su casa, empezando con pocos pedidos, pero esperan seguir creciendo. Se inició en este negocio hace más de 5 meses, por idea de su pareja, ya que cuenta con los conocimientos necesarios. Considera que es rentable por la demanda que tiene, ya que por el clima caluroso de su zona estos equipos son muy usados. Le gusta su actividad por sentirse ocupada y le permite relajarse, estar en casa y poder atender a sus hijos, así como el ingreso económico que le genera y le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un taller más grande y mejor equipado, y así lograr ser una prospera empresaria.

Este es su préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, considera a los miembros de su banco comunal buenas personas y puntuales, se apoyan entre sí. Por tanto, seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más préstamos.
Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles comprará motores de refrigeración valorizados en 80 dólares americanos cada uno, además de balones de gas valorizados en 250 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elvia, 39, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Oswaldo who is a refrigeration technician and they live with their two children, Oswaldo, 18, and Héctor, 15.  The house she lives in his theirs since they managed to buy it with much effort.

Her business is refrigeration equipment maintenance and to do so they’ve installed a small workshop at home.  They’ve started out with few orders but hope to continue growing.  The business started more than five months ago as an idea of her spouse since he has the necessary skills.  She believes that it’s profitable because of existing demand; due to the hot climate in the area this equipment is used very much.  She likes her activity because it keeps her busy but allows her to relax because she can be at home caring for her children.  In addition, the income it generates allows her to cover household expenses.  Her plan is to expand the business and set up a larger, better equipped workshop to attain business prosperity.

This is her MFP loan #11.  She believes that the members of her communal bank are good, punctual people who are mutually supportive.  Because of this she will continue to be punctual with her payments to have good credit history and be able to access more loans.

She will use the 1000 new soles to buy refrigeration motors valued at 80 American dollars each as well as gas tanks valued at 250 new soles.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration motors.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 40 years old, married, and has one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  Lanie earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Lanie is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  Lanie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rehana

texts.fr: Rehana est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de six enfants dont les quatre fréquent l'école primaire.Elle gère un restaurant devant son domicile.Elle propose à ses clients le petit déjeuner et le diner.Elle parvient avec les revenus tirés de son activité à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires.Son ambition est de construire et de bien équiper son, restaurant.
texts.en:
Rehana is a married mother of six children, four of whom attend primary school. She runs a restaurant service in front of her house, offering breakfast and lunch. This activity brings in the income necessary to support her family. 

To strengthen her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 200,000F to buy foodstuffs. Her goal is to have a fully equipped restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, pues le gustan los nuevos desafíos. Su pareja, Abel, es empleado dependiente y padre de sus dos hijos; Sergio de 15 años y Marcelo de 14 años. La casa donde viven es propia, la cual compraron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Su oficio es la costura, actividad que aprendió de su madre desde muy joven, y ahora le sirve para generarse un ingreso económico desde su hogar. Paralela a esta actividad, se dedica a la compra  y venta de semillas, las cuales compra a los productores y las envía a otras ciudades, según el pedido. Lleva dedicándose a la costura hace más de 11 años; y a la venta de semillas, hace 2 años, para esto contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta sus actividades, pues le generan ingresos económicos, con los cuales paga sus gastos, y puede conocer y relacionarse con otras personas. Comenta que le gusta la costura desde muy joven, siendo bastante requerida por la calidad de su trabajo y tiene un clientela fiel que siempre la buscan. Tiene planes de ampliar y mejorar su negocio comprando una máquina de coser semindustrial.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener una línea de crédito para alcanzar sus objetivos. Además, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como telas, hilos y otros necesarios.
texts.en:
Carmen, 41, is a hardworking, cheerful, enterprising woman because she likes new challenges.  Her spouse, Abel, is an independent employee and the father of their two children, Sergio, 15, and Marcelo, 14.  The house they live in is theirs; they bought it with much effort and dedication.

Her occupation is sewing, an activity she learned from her mother when she was very young and that now serves as a way for her to earn income from home.  Alongside this activity she also is a seed merchant; she buys them and ships them to other cities to order.  She’s been sewing for 11 years and selling seeds for two and her husband helps her with this.

She believes that the business is quite profitable because of the good profits it produces.  She likes her activities because they generate income she can use to pay her expenses and she can get to know and relate to other people.  She comments that she’s enjoyed sewing since she was very young and she’s quite sought-after because of the quality of her work; she has a loyal clientele that always seek her out.  Her plan is to expand and improve her business buying a semi-industrial sewing machine.

This is her MFP loan #8 and she feels grateful for the opportunity offered to have a line of credit to reach her objectives.  In addition, she comments that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible and mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread and other necessary things.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 49 years old and married with four children.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Elvie has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Elvie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 41 years old and married with five children.

Annabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Annabel has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Annabel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria tiene 55 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, madre de 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y ya se casaron pero a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el amor que solo una madre puede dar por los hijos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de , su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo hermosas playas y también tiene a las Islas Ballestas, las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja en su negocio de venta de jugos y refrigerios, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se esfuerza mucho y sus jugos le salen riquísimos.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda ya que a raíz del terremoto ocurrido en el año 2007, su vivienda se inundo ya que su casa está cerca al mar y con el movimiento el mar salió unos metros, esta mejoras serán reforzamientos de paredes, así ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una vivienda en buenas condiciones y tener un cafetín en la universidad”.
texts.en:
Maria, age 55, is hardworking and enthusiastic. She is the mother of three grown children who are already married, so she moves forward alone and with great effort. Above all, she possesses the love that only a mother could have for her children. Her home is located in the city of Pisco, which is known for its warm climate and beautiful beaches. Pisco is also known for the Ballesta Islands, which are constantly visited by tourists throughout the year. With great effort and dedication, Maria works in her business of selling juices and refreshments. She works approximately 10 hours a day and is able to serve up to 15 customers in a day. Maria believes she is doing well in her business because she tries very hard and the juices she sells taste good.

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have provided, she will be able to make improvements to her home, which was impacted by the earthquake in 2007. Her house was flooded since it is located near the sea. The movement of the ground forced a few meters of water into her home. The improvements she will make include reinforcement of the walls, which will allow her to have a better quality of life. Maria continues to strive each day to fulfill her greatest dream of having a home in good condition and opening a cafeteria at the university.

loans.use: to reinforce the walls of her home.

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es:
Mitzy tiene 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Carlos, quien es empleado dependiente y padre de su único hijo, Fabrizzio de 3 años. Viven en su casa propia que lograron comprar gracias a bastante esfuerzo.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con una boutique que logró abrir en un espacio que acondicionó en su propia casa. De esta manera  ahorra gastos de alquiler, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento se dedica ella sola. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de empleado en una empresa privada, así como contar con tiempo libre para atender a su pequeño hijo.  Lo considera rentable porque ha logrado ganarse clientes regulares, por eso cuenta con ingresos permanentes. Tiene planes de abrir otro negocio de venta de comidas los sábados y domingos en sociedad con su madre.

Este es su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con ese apoyo financiero. Seguirá siendo puntual en sus pagos y así tener acceso a más préstamos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos  soles, invertirá la mitad en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos traídos desde la capital; la otra mitad la usará como capital de trabajo para su nuevo negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Mitzy, 27, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Carlos who is a salaried employee and father of their only son, Fabrizzio, 3.  They live in their own house that they managed to buy thanks to much effort.

The activity she does is selling clothes and women’s accessories.  To do so she has a boutique she opened in a space she set up in her house.  
This way she saves rental costs and she takes care of her customers kindly.  She’s been in business for more than three years and for the moment works by herself.  

She likes her work because she earns income to help her husband with household expenses since often his salary as an employee in a private firm was insufficient and also because she has free time to care for her little boy.  She considers it to be profitable because she’s succeeded in securing regular customers so she can count on permanent income.  She’s planning to open another business selling food on Saturdays and Sundays in partnership with her mother.

This is her MFP loan #5 and she feels happy to be able to count on this financial support.  She will continue to be punctual with her payments in order to have access to more loans.

She will use the 2500 new soles requested to invest half in the purchase of various styles of clothes brought from the capital and the other half will used as working capital for her new food business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y deseosa de progresar. Está casada con Ermes, quien es empleado dependiente y padre de sus tres hijos; Mónica de 18, Víctor de 14 y Ermes de 10 años de edad. 
Su actividad es la costura. Elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir a pedido, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Aprendió este oficio gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional. Comenzó con una máquina de coser que logró adquirir gracias a un préstamo hace más de 9 años, siendo el tiempo que lleva en este negocio. Le gusta su actividad por contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su esposo. Le ha gustado coser desde muy pequeña y gracias a ello tiene una ocupación. Ahora cuenta con regular cantidad de pedidos que la mantienen ocupada, tiene una clientela fiel y siempre la buscar por su buen trabajo. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, renovarlo comprando una nueva máquina de coser.

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal. Le gusta poder compartir con otras personas y considera a todos sus miembros ser buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos y demás materiales de costura, ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar. También adquirirá una remallayadora valorizada en 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Judith, 37, is a hardworking, dynamic woman who very much wants to make progress.  She’s married to Ermes who is a salaried employee and the father of their three children: Mónica, 18, Víctor, 14 and Ermes, 10.

Her activity is sewing.  She makes all types of articles of clothing for women, men and children.  She learned this occupation thanks to courses she took at an occupational education center.  She started with a sewing machine she managed to acquire thanks to a loan more than 9 years ago which is how long she’s been in this business.

She likes her activity because she has a reliable source of income to cover household expenses and help her husband.  She’s liked to sew since she was little and thanks to this she has an occupation.  Now, she has a steady number of orders that keep her busy; she has a loyal clientele who always seeks her out because of her good work.  Therefore, she plans to expand the business completely, renovating it purchasing a new sewing machine.

This is her MFP loan #14 and she feels good with the work of her communal bank.  She likes to share with other people and considers all the members to be good people.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other sewing supplies because she has pending orders to fill.  She will also buy a darning machine valued at 700 new soles.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and a darning machine.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 49 years old and has seven children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Eleuteria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with two children.  With both children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store.

Emma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Emma would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 40 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora que le gusta ser productiva. Está casada con Armando, quien es policía. Fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 12 años, que es lo mejor que le ha dado la vida.  Viven en una bonita casa que logró construir con la ayuda de su esposo.

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso abrió una bodega en su casa. También se dedica a la venta de vestuario policial, la confecciona en su pequeño taller instalado en su casa. Confecciona previo pedido de las instituciones y/o individualmente. 
Se inició en este negocio gracias a sus relaciones en el ambiente policial, debido a su esposo, haciéndose de esta manera muy concomida y solicitada por el buen acabado de sus trabajos, dedicándose a esta actividad hace 5 años. Le gusta su trabajo porque está ocupada, se siente productiva y con deseos de surgir como una pequeña empresaria haciendo lo que le gusta, la  costura. Pero el problema está cuando vende al crédito y algunos de sus clientes se han retrasado en sus pagos, pero ella no deja que esto le afecte en sus compromisos y obligaciones con la institución MFP. Tiene planes de poder ampliar su bodega y aumentar su stock de mercadería.

Este se su cuarto préstamo 4 con MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal, y desea seguir contando con este apoyo. Seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más préstamos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para surtir su bodega, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen. También comprará ropa traída de la capital para venderla en su tienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 40 years old. She is a happy and hardworking woman who likes to be productive. She is married to Armando who is a policeman. They have a 12 year old son who is the best gift life has given them. They live in a lovely house that she was able to build with her husband’s help.

Her business is selling grocery staples and to do so she opened a store in her house. She also sells police uniforms that she makes in a small workshop installed in her house. She sells the uniforms to both institutions and individuals.

She started the latter business thanks to relationships developed through her husband in the police environment, where she has become very well known and in demand because of the fine quality of her work. She has been engaged in this business for the past 5 years. She enjoys her work because it keeps her busy and she feels productive. She wants to develop into a small businesswoman doing what she loves, sewing. However the problem is that when she sells on credit, some of her customers are late in paying her. Nevertheless she does not let this affect her commitments and obligations to MFP.

She has plans to expand her grocery store and increase her stock of merchandise.

This is Doris’ fourth loan from MFP. She feels good about the work of her communal bank and wants to continue relying on this support. She will continue being punctual in her payments and thus maintain a good credit record so that she will have access to more loans.

With the sum of S/. 3000 she has requested she will purchase general groceries to restock her store and will look for the best prices and buy in volume. She will also purchase clothes brought from the capital to sell in her store.

loans.use: to expand her merchandise.

loans.name: San Pablo Apostol Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 12 integrantes, todas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son muy trabajadoras y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar sus vidas.
Pascuala es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una mercería surtida con todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, artículos de bazar, zapatos y demás. Gracias a la variedad que tiene siempre, ya pudo formarse una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella.
Pascuala pide el crédito a kiva y fundacion paraguaya para poder abastecer su negocio con prendas, artículos de bazar y demás tipo de productos para poder tener bien surtido su local.
texts.en:
The committee has 12 members who are all friends and neighbors from the city of Caacupé.  They joined together in order to work together and be able to help each other out by this means.  They are very hardworking and very much want to get ahead and improve their lives.

Pascuala is one of the group members.  She’s a merchant.  He has a general store stocked with all sorts of things like clothes, housewares, shoes and others.  Thanks to the wide variety of goods she always has she’s formed a good clientele that always buys from her.

Pascuala is asking Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for a loan in order to be able to stock her business with clothes, housewares and other types of products in order to have her store well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy clothes and general merchandise.

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es:
Selmith tiene 60 años, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre. Es viuda y vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 41, 39 y 30 años de edad, más sus cinco nietos, a los que quiere y engríe mucho.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual compra en la ciudad y en ocasiones trae a pedido desde la capital. Las ofrece en zonas alejadas de la ciudad, como caseríos ubicados a los márgenes del río, donde realiza viajes cortos, siendo muy conocida por esas zonas, en la mayoría de los casos entrega a pedido. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad hace más de 3 años, realizándolo, en ocasiones, con el apoyo de algunos de sus hijos, que la acompañan en sus viajes por el río.
Le gusta su trabajo por tener un ingreso económico para sus propios gastos y darse algunos gustos, cómprales regalos a sus nietos. Lo que no le gusta es que debido a su edad, le resulta cada vez más pesado hacer estos  viajes, pues termina muy cansada, pero comenta que es su única fuente de ingreso económico, por lo que desea continuar y mantenerlo.

Este es su quinto préstamo con la institución MFP. Le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal, y espera seguir contando con este apoyo financiero. Se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros. También adquirirá una máquina de coser valorizada en 500 nuevos soles y materiales para incursionar en la costura.
texts.en:
Selmith, 60, is a tenacious, hardworking, very cheerful woman.  She’s a widow living with her three children who are 41, 39, and 30 years old as well as her five grandchildren who she loves and pampers very much.

She sells clothes that she buys in the city and sometimes brings from the capital.  She sells them in areas away from the city like settlements along the riverbanks.  She makes short trips and is well-known in these areas; most of her sales are to order.  She’s been in this activity for more than three years occasionally getting help to do it from some of her children who accompany her on her trips along the river.

She likes her work because it provides regular income for her own expenses and for occasional treats, like buying gifts for her grandchildren.  What she dislikes is that due to her age it’s more difficult each time to do these trips because she ends up fatigued but she comments that it’s her only source of income so she wants to continue and stay in business.

This is her fifth MFP loan.  She likes the work in her communal bank and hopes to continue to have this financial support.  She commits to continue being punctual with her installment payments.

She will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy various styles of clothes for all genders.  She will also buy a sewing machine valued at 500 new soles and supplies to go into sewing.

loans.use: to buy clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y deseosa de progresar.  Está casada con William, quien es policía y padre de su hijo José, de 15 años, a los que quiere mucho.
Se dedica a la costura, oficio que aprendió ayudando a una amiga en su taller, con los ingresos logró comprar su propia máquina de coser. Inició hace más de 10  años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado hacerse conocida y hacer crecer su negocio, contando ahora con la ayuda de una amiga a la que paga  por trabajo o pedido entregado. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su actividad por tener un ingreso económico con el cual ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su esposo, además le gusta la costura, pues se siente una mujer productiva. Le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio, instalar más maquinas y abrir un taller grande donde atender a sus clientes, sabiendo que esto le generaría mejores ingresos económicos, así  como el dar empleos a otras personas, como ella inició.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con la institución MFP. Le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal porque se siente cómoda y a gusto. “Espero seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución”, comenta. Será puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas.
Con el monto prestado, de 1500 nuevo soles, los invertirá en materiales de costura, como telas e hilos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Doris, age 44, is a hard-working, enterprising, and happy woman with the desire to progress.  She is married to William, a policeman and father of her 15 year old son, José.  They love their son very much.

She is a seamstress, a trade that she learned by helping a friend in her shop.  With her earnings she managed to buy her own sewing machine.  She started over ten years ago.  During that time she has managed to make herself well-known and to make her business grow.  She has help from a friend, who she pays for her work or completed order.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the good income it gives her.  She likes this business activity because she has an income that she uses to help her husband with the household expenses.  Also, she likes sewing, and she feels like a productive woman.  She would like to be able to expand her business, install more machines, and open a large shop where she could tend to her customers.  This would generate greater income and give work to other people, like how she started.

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She likes working with her communal bank because she feels comfortable and at ease.  “I hope to continue to count on the institution’s support,” she says.  She will be punctual with her payments.

She will use the loan for 1,500 soles to buy a greater quantity of sewing materials like fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur with an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for that business.

NWTF is relisting Anita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for abaca weaving.

loans.name: Momath

texts.fr: Momath est un tailleur qui gère un atelier de couture depuis bientôt quatre ans. Il est marié et père de deux enfants.Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il vend en même temps des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.Son ambition est d'élargir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Momath is a tailor who has been running a sewing shop for nearly four years. He is a married father of two. 

To boost his revenue, he also sells cosmetic products out of his shop. 

He is seeking a loan of 200,000F to buy fabrics and sewing notions. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing notions.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, a 33-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani, is a married father of three who has been conducting this business for the past six years with great success.

Said was recently introduced to KADET LTD, and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and finance the gradual expansion of his shop. He hopes to eventually expand it into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man, father of four children. He has been working in refining drinking water for eight years. Ali was a soldier till he retired and started his own business.

Ali is well known in the region, and this business is much requested in his region because of the high pollution level found in the water there.

Ali is applying for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new water bottles and refining filters for his business. This business is Ali's main livelihood, and he has to keep on updating and improving it, to keep up with his customers' demand and to keep it capable of providing his family a good income.

Ali hopes to expand his business to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy new water bottles and refining filters for his business

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
El Comite LAS GUERRERAS esta en el primer ciclo, las integrantes están empezando a aprender a trabajar juntas, tienen mucha esperanza de que podrán salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Perla es una de las miembros, ella es la presidenta y comenta que siempre trata de ayudar a sus amigas y motivarlas a trabajar juntas y seguir luchando por el bien de todas. Perla se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y es gracias a este trabajo que ella ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, jeans, y demás tipos de prendas con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Las Guerreras” (The Warriors) committee is in its first cycle.  The members are starting to learn how to work together.  They are very hopeful that they’ll be able to get ahead and help each other out.

Perla is one of the members; she’s the president and comments that she always tries to help her girlfriends and motivate them to work together and to continue striving for their mutual wellbeing.  Perla sells all types of clothes and thanks to this work she helps her family and covers day to day expenses.

She asks for the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans and other types of clothes so that she can have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Gregorio nace mediante el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo y  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra.  Salvadora, presidenta del grupo tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias de sabanas, frazadas, prendas y demás tipos, gracias a lo cual ha podido mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, prendas y demás productos con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio committee is born thanks to support among a group of women that was working in that place.  The committee is in the city of San Lorenzo and the members of the group established each member’s personal and business growth as their main goal.

Salvadora, 45, is group president.  She’s a very enterprising woman capable of leading a large group such as this.  She’s demonstrated a drive for self-improvement during all the cycles.  She sells general merchandise like sheets, blankets, clothes and other types.  Thanks to this she’s been able to improve her income and help her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy sheets, blankets, clothes and other products to stock her business and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, clothes and other products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años, es una mujer emprendedora y alegre, muy trabajadora.  Está casada con Esteban, quien es empleado y padre de sus dos hijos: Naida de 18 años y Brayan de 16 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de un sobrino, al cual apoyan en su educación.

Su actividad es la venta de comida por las noches, tales como arroz chaufa, pollo frito, asados de pollo y demás, los cuales vende en una mesa que instala en el frontis de su casa los sábados y domingos. Esta actividad la realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos, paralelo vende bebidas, para lo cual cuenta con un congelador para mantenerlas a la temperatura que les agrada a sus clientes. En ambos negocios se inició hace más de 7 años. Le gusta su trabajo, pues tiene un ingreso económico, con el cual apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con el sueldo de empleado público de salud no les alcanza. Se siente contenta de ser una persona productiva y le distrae. Con el trascurso del tiempo desea hacer crecer su negocio de bebidas comprando otro congelador.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Se siente a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal y desea seguir formando parte, debido a que considera que sus miembros son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más bebidas, víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and she is an entrepreneurial, cheerful, and very hard-working woman.  She is married to Esteban who is employed and the father of their two children.  Naida is 18 years old and Brayan is 16 years old.  They live together in their own home and their nephew also lives with them, so that they can help support his education.

Rosa sells food in the evening, such as fried rice, fried chicken, barbeque chicken, and other dishes such as these.  She sells the food from a table in front of her home on Saturdays and Sundays.  Her children help her with the business.  They also sell drinks that they keep cold (which their customers like) in a refrigerator.  She began both businesses 7 years ago.  She likes to work and have an income with which she can help her husband pay the household expenses, especially since the salary of public employees doesn't pay enough to provide healthcare.  She is happy to be productive and busy.  In time, she hopes to grow her beverage business by buying another refrigerator.

This is her seventh loan from MFP.  She likes working with the community bank and hopes to continue to be a part of it, especially since the members are all considered responsible and dependable people.

With this loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase more beverages, food, and ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 44-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells knitted clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. 

Salome describes her biggest business challenge to be the increasing cost of yarn. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy yarn and fabric. This is the first loan Salome is requesting from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail tailoring shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy knitting thread and fabric.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba  produces "kenkey" (fermented maize dough) for sale at Asebu  near Cape Coast. She has been selling kenkey for 3 years. She is married with three children.  Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their children. She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" production. With the new profit, Aba wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" production.

loans.name: Marlince

texts.en:
Marlince is a 43-year-old lady and is married to John, a 45-year-old man. From their marriage, they are blessed with six children, namely, Hendro, 20; Valen, 18; Cindro, 15; Putri, 11, Exel, 7; and Gio, 5. Marlince and her family live together in their modest house.

Marlince and her husband often get into difficulties in meeting the living costs of their family. Marlince then tried to assist her husband by initiating a business selling wood planks. She buys wood planks from community members in her village and resells them to several furniture businessmen. 

Recently the demand for  wood planks has increased and Marlince intends to buy more. The limitation in capital drove her to apply for a loan from TLM of IDR 5,000,000. The loan really means a lot to her in adding more wood planks to resell.

loans.use: to buy more wood planks to resell

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma, a 47-year-old resident of Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, is married and has four children. She has owned a retail store to earn a living for three years, each month earning PHP 5000.

A member of PMPC for one year, Guillerma is requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase rice to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to retail.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales el mayor vive con su padre, mientras que los dos menores de 12 y 11 años viven con ella y su actual pareja. Viven en la casa de la madre de Ana, con sus hermanos. Ella se esfuerza mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños.

Su trabajo consiste en el la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulatoria, entre las cosas que ofrece son: juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y otros accesorios, sobre todo para las niñas. Sale a diario en busca de sus clientes por las calles, lleva trabajando con esta actividad 3 años, lo hace sola y aunque ahora está muy bien preparada para hacer su trabajo, cuando empezó tuvo muchas dificultades, como no saber qué estrategia usar para llegar al cliente, ahora es muy buena en lo que hace y día a día se supera más y más. Le agrada su trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo, además tiene muy buena ganancias, ya que gana un promedio del 50% de su inversión. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda, pero por ahora lo que más desea es aumentar su capital invirtiendo más en su negocio.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy emocionada al saber que tiene un respaldo económico. Asimismo, se compromete a ser una socia muy cumplida y realizar sus pagos siempre a tiempo. También espera que en el banco comunal con el que está empezando a trabajar le reciban de buena manera para que se pueda compenetrar rápidamente.
Con el monto solicitado, 1200 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and the mother of three children. Her oldest child lives with his father, while the two younger ones (ages 12 and 11) live with her and her current partner. Ana lives at her mother's house with her siblings. She strives very hard to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Her work consists of selling accessories as a street vendor. Among the items she offers are toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other items for little girls. She leaves her home every day and walks through the streets in search of customers. Ana has been working in this business for three years. She works alone and is now well-prepared to handle her job. When she started, she had many difficulties. Ana did not know what strategies to use to attract customers. Now she is good at what she does on a daily basis and is always getting better. She is grateful for her work because it enables her to make use of her time and she generates good earnings with an average return of 50% on her investment. In order to move forward, Ana hopes to open a store, but for now she just wants to increase her capital so that she can invest more into her business.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Ana is very excited to know that she will have financial backing. She promises to be a committed member who always submits her payments on time. Ana notes that her Communal Bank is starting to work well together, so she hopes that trend will pick up quickly. The loan amount of 1,200 PEN that she requested will be used to by merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité tiene 15 mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras como integrantes, ellas son jefas de familias, que se esfuerzan y siempre luchan por dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Elva es la presidenta del grupo, y nos dice que ella siempre se esfuerza en lo que hace, pues sabe que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela porque siempre ofrece buena variedad a sus clientes.
Elva solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, cebollas, locotes, lechugas y demás frutas y verduras para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes la variedad a que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 15 hard-working and determined women.  They are the heads of their families, for whom they struggle and fight in order to provide everything they need every day.

Elva is the president of the group and tells us that she has always struggled for everything that she has.  She knows that her work will help her family.  She sells fruits and vegetables and says that she has great customers because she always offers a variety of products.

Elva is seeking this loan so that she can purchase tomatoes, onions, green pepper, lettuce, and other fruits and vegetables so that she can continue offering her customers the variety of produce that they are used to buying from her.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, green peppers, lettuce, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en:
Perpetual is an itinerant petty trader   at  Asebu  near Cape Coast. She sells ladies' and children's dresses, underwear,  jeans and shoes,  which she has done for 2 years now. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bill. 

Perpertual will use her loan to   purchase more ladies' and children's dresses,  jeans and shoes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business Perpetual  wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods out of.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and children's dresses,  jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 22 years old and comes from Gaza. He has owned an advertising office for two years. He needs this youth loan in order to expand his business and buy paper and printers for banners and brochures.

His ambition is to fullfill his dreams, make ends meet, and to improve his financial situation which will help him get married.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy paper, printers for banners and brochures

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Unidas es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las miembros son muy conocidas en el barrio por su unión y su trabajo en conjunto. Su meta es poder ayudar a sus familias y que no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades.
La Sra. Zunilda, tiene 29 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Nos comenta que ella siempre trata de apoyar a sus compañeras y de esa forma motivarlas a seguir trabajo juntas y así ayudar a sus familias. Zunilda se dedica a la venta de ropas y con este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, ella nos comenta que su meta es poder tener una gran tienda donde dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse con camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su negocio y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United Ones) committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The members are very well known in the neighborhood because of their unity and teamwork.  Their goal is to be able to help their families so that they will not go through any privations.

Zunilda, 29, is married and has three children.  She comments that she always tries to support her fellow members motivating them to continue to work together and thus help their families.

Zunilda sells clothes and through this work has been able to get ahead and help her family.  She comments that her goal is to be able to have a great store where she can offer a wider variety to her customers.

She asks for the loan to stock up on shirts, t-shirts, pants and other supplies needed to stock her business and continue to provide a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Primavera”, está integrado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty,  ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy emprendedoras. Gracias al trabajo en conjunto ya están en el tercer ciclo y su meta es poder seguir juntas hasta el máximo nivel del programa.
Rufina todos los días trabaja duro en su despensa, tiene clientes desde muy tempranas horas por lo que empieza todos los días desde muy temprano. Ella se define como una persona con muchos sueños y metas que cumplir, por los que lucha día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás artículos de primera necesidad, que son los que más venta tiene. Rufina y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que reciben de kiva y fundacion paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Spring) committee is composed of 11 women from the city of Curuguaty.  They are hardworking women who are above all entrepreneurs.  Thanks to their teamwork they are already in their third cycle and their goal is to be able to reach the maximum level of the program.

Rufina works hard in her grocery store every day; she gets customers starting at very early hours so she starts working very early too.  She defines herself as a person with many dreams and goals to reach; she strives towards them daily.

She’s asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other basic staple items which are the ones that sell best.  

Rufina and her group are grateful for the support they get from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Ellas asumieron el compromiso de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras en todo lo que puedan. Su meta es poder ayudar a sus familias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Gabriela es una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que su trabajo es un poco pesado. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, fundas, y demás. Comenta que está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio fijo y no tener que recorrer mas por las calles.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, colchas, frazadas y demás productos para la venta, ya que son los que mas salida tienen
texts.en:
The committee "Pretty Kuña" was formed by the union of several neighbors from the city of Santaní. They made ​​a commitment to work together and help each other in any way they can. Their goal is to help their families and improve their living conditions.
 
Gabriela is a very self-sacrificing woman, and her work is a bit heavy. She works as a street vendor selling all kinds of products, including sheets, blankets, covers, and more. She says she is proud of what she does because it is a decent and honest job. Her dream is to have a fixed business locale so that she wouldn't have to roam the streets.

She is requesting a loan to buy sheets, comforters, blankets and other items for sale, as these items are in greatest demand.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, blankets and other items for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua  is married and has one child.  Efua sells charcoal at Asebu Brebia, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.

 Efua will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profits, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou, age 50, is a noble farmer who has been residing in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She and her husband are growing various kinds of crops to sell, primarily planting and harvesting rice. She has been blessed with two children, one of whom is employed and works in the construction field.

Nou would like to improve her farming practices and increase her household income. Now she is borrowing a loan of USD 1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help ensure proper growth of crops in her rice field. In the future, Nou hopes to obtain a good income from her business and provide a standard of living to the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Evelyne Hortense

texts.fr: Hortense est une jeune femme de 34 ans divorcée, mère de 4 enfants dont l' âge varie entre 8 et 18 ans, elle une autre personne en plus à sa charge. Elle ouvert et  gère une mini alimentation depuis deux ans dans laquelle elle commercialise les produits de premières necessité et crédit de communication. Elle achète les marchandises qu'elle revend en petite quantité dans sa boutique et est obligée d'aller au marché tout le temps. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle grandissante en achetant en cartons pour détailler et lui évitera les allez et venus mais aussi augmentera son profit. Les benéfices générés par ce crédit lui permettront d'économiser pour la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hortense, age 34, is a young divorced mother of four children aged 8 to 18. She also has another dependent in her care. 

She opened a small grocery store two years ago where she sells staples and communication credits. She buys merchandise to sell in small quantities in her store, which requires her to go to the market often to replenish her stock. 

She will use this loan to purchase large quantities to sell at retail in her store, thus avoiding frequent visits to the market. This will help her to meet the needs of her growing customer base and to increase her revenue. The profits earned will help her to save for her children’s tuition

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives together with her husband and  four children. She produces charcoal  to sell  at  Asebu  near  Cape Coast, which she has done for 20  years now.  She uses her income  to help her husband to  feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.   

Efua   will use her loan to purchase firewood  to  produce the charcoal she  sells.  With the new profit from her expanded business,  Efua will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase firewood  to  produce the charcoal she  sells.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 64 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling a variety of snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Alicia has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alicia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: San Miguelito Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Miguelito” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades juntas para poder ayudarse. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Mirian es parte del grupo, y ella comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, fundas, y algunas prendas. Cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que ella recorre por las calles para vender sus productos y de esa forma obtiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Su sueño es tener una tienda y así no tener que ir mas en forma ambulante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos que vende, como las frazadas, sabanas y demás, ya que quiere poder ofrece variedad a sus clientes y cumplir con pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The “San Miguelito” committee formed thanks to the union of several neighbors from the city of Santaní.  All the group members carry out independent activities but also carry out group activities to help each other out.  The members formed a very united group that’s capable of carrying out joint activities that strengthens their team spirit.

Mirian is part of this group and she comments that she sells all sorts of products like blankets, sheets, pillowcases and some clothes from place to place.  She comments that her work is very demanding because she wanders the streets to sell her products thus obtaining the means to be able to help her family.  Her dream is to have a store so that she doesn’t have to sell from place to place any longer.

She’s asking for the loan to buy the products she sells like blankets, sheets and others because she wants to be able to offer variety to her customers and fill the pending orders she has.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and others.

loans.name: Manduara Group

texts.es:
El comité “Manduara” se encuentra en el Tercer ciclo del programa de de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 14 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción, todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Liz, la presidenta del grupo comenta que su comité es muy organizado y que siempre trabajan juntas para poder ayudarse, es por eso que les está yendo bien. Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y con este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que les será muy útil.
texts.en:
The group “Manduara” is in the third loan cycle in the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya.  The group is comprised of 14 members from Asunción, all of whom are selfless women that want to get ahead and help their families.

Liz is the president of the group and says that the group is very organized and always works together to help one another.  Because of this, everyone in the group is doing well.  

She tells us that she sells all types of clothing and this work helps support her family.  She is seeking a credit so that she can purchase winter clothing because the cold winter season is approaching.  She wants to have a variety of clothing ready for her customers.

Liz and her group are thankful for the help that they are receiving as it will be very useful.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Letecia has a general store that sells variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, and candies.  She has had this business for three years. 

Letecia is requesting a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items for her general store.  Letecia has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La Sra. Fanny es casada y nos cuenta que es comerciante, tiene un bar hace más de 5 años, el que está en una muy buena ubicación, lo que le da mayor ventaja y tiene así muchos clientes. 
Fanny es una mujer muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y seguir creciendo,  comenta que al principio su negocio era pequeño, pero que después gracias a su trabajo y a su arduo empreño ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma también mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, como ser carnes, fideos, yerba, arroz, etc. Los cuales utiliza para poder elaborar las comidas de su bar. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Fanny is married and she tells us that she’s a merchant; she’s had a snack bar for five years that’s in a good location which is a good advantage because she has many customers that way.

Fanny is a very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and continue to grow.  She comments that at the beginning her business was small but afterwards thanks to her work and arduous effort she’s been able to grow and improve her and her family’s income.

She asks for the loan to buy ingredients like meats, noodles, tea, rice, etc. that she uses to make the food for her snack bar.  She’s very grateful for this opportunity she’s getting since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, tea, rice, etc.

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.ru: Муродбек проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он шесть лет проработал в школе. На сегодняшний день Муродбек арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую и детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. В будущем он хочет купить автомашину.
texts.en: Murodbek lives in the Qumsangir region. He is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker and his children are going to school. He has a higher education in teaching and has worked in a school for six years. Murodbek is renting out a vendor spot where he sells men's and children's clothing. He is taking a loan to increase commodity circulation. In the future he wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es una persona muy trabajadora, y nos cuenta que hace  cinco años se dedica a la albañilería. Está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos.
 Alfredo comenta que se sacrifica diariamente para poder dar a su esposa y a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por las necesidades que el paso. Quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales, que estudien y se superen.
 Alfredo solicita el crédito para la compra de una máquina mezcladora para de esa forma agilizar más su trabajo e generar mayor ingreso en su hogar. El nos dice que está muy agradecido por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues la mezcladora le hace mucha falta, y le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very hardworking man who tells us he’s been working in construction for five years.  He has a spouse and two children.

Alfredo comments that he sacrifices daily in order to be able to give his wife and children everything they need so that they will not have to go through the privations he had to endure.  He wants his children to become professional; that they study and improve themselves.

Alfredo is asking for a loan to buy a cement mixer to make his work easier and generate higher household income.  He tells us that he’s very grateful for the help he’s getting because he very much needs a cement mixer that will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Sofira

texts.en:
Sofira is a 45-year-old lady and is married to Lodovikus, 48 years old. They have five children: Ronald, 23, working; Maria, 20, graduated from Senior High school; Fabianus, 19, in the 3th grade of Senior High School; Atriana, 11, in the 1st grade of Junior High School and Ogil, 5. 

Sofira spends her days planting mango seedlings at the farm. She plants and tends them for a month then sells them to the reseller, up to hundreds of mango seedlings a year. The income from selling the seedlings has been used to cover her household expenses and the educational expenses of her children. In addition, Sofira plans to add more varieties of mango seedlings. To implementing her dream, Sofira submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer. Sofira really hopes that her dream will come true because of the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase mango seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married and has two children.  He operates a butcher shop, which he has been doing for five years.  He employs one person in his business.  

Wilson is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy meat.  He has expanded his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  He hopes to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Maria Charina

texts.en:
Maria Charina is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.  Maria Charina has a general store business and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.  

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Stevany

texts.en:
Stevany is a 24-year-old woman who is married to Hendro, a 25-year-old man. They have two children, namely: Evan, 4, and Dirta, 1. 

Stevany is running a petrol stall business to help her husband in meeting their family needs. She has been operating the business for one year. The income generated from the business enables her to assist her husband in producing extra income for her family necessities. Stevany dreams of expanding her business to generate more income for her family, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. The situation led her to request a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more petrol to resell.

loans.use: to buy more petrol to sell

loans.name: Alis

texts.es:
Alis tiene 37 años, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 18, 11 y 4 años, quienes viven junto a ella en su casa propia. Durante sus días alado de su familia aprendió que para progresar hay que trabajar mucho y es por eso que siempre está en constante actividad.

Su trabajo empieza muy temprano cuando termina su turno en el centro de salud donde es enfermera. Vuelve a su casa a ver a sus hijos y por la tarde sale en busca de sus clientes a quienes ofrecer la ropa que vende. Lleva en este negocio 5 años, antes no trabajaba en la posta, así que era su única fuente de ingreso. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da el tiempo para hacer las actividades de su casa y otras cosas. Espera poder mantenerse así y quizás más adelante poder tener una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará ropa para seguir con el negocio, además de invertir en algunos accesorios para poder exhibir mejor sus prendas.
texts.en:
Alis, 37, is a responsible, very hardworking woman.  She and her spouse have three children who are 18, 11 and 4 years old; they all live together in her own house.  During the time she spent alongside her family she learned that in order to make progress one has to work hard and this is why she’s always constantly active.

Her work starts very early when she finishes her shift in the health center where she’s a nurse.  She returns home to see her children and in the afternoon she heads out looking for customers to sell clothes to.  She’s been in business five years.  Before, she didn’t work in the clinic so this was her only source of income.  What she likes best about her work is that it gives her time to do household and other chores.  She hopes to stay in business and eventually have a small, home-based store.

This is her fourth MFP loan.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel surer of advancing with her business this way.  On the other hand, she once again commits to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy clothes to continue with her business and will also buy some accessories to be able to display her items better.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia, 54, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo. At this time, she is working hard to be able to cover her family’s financial needs. 

Sonia operates a dressmaking business. She mainly offers clothing like dresses, blouses, and shirts. She directly sells the clothes to her neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sonia dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials needed in her business

loans.name: Colonne De Feu Plus Group

texts.en:
"Colonne de Feu Plus" is a Community Bank made up of 18 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Josephine. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Josephine operates a drugstore in the mid-western area of Kinshasa. She is 50 years old, a widow and the mother of seven children who are between the ages of 10 and 28. All of them attend school. She began her business in 1993. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Josephine has seen her business prosper and has permanent customers to keep it up. Her business generates about $40 of profit per week. Her strengths are in her case the purchase of appropriate drugs for her customers. 

Josephine has already received three loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and successfully repaid them. She is planning with the next loan to expand her business by buying more medicine needed by her customers. Her ambition is to open another drugstore and to be a medicine provider in her environment.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her drugstore with medicine needed by her customers.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is 23 years old.  He is a partner in a barbershop and lives in a refugee camp. Ibraheem has been working in the barbershop for a year and needs this youth loan to decorate the barbershop and purchase razors and new equipment. His goal is to develop himself and his work in order to get married and have his own family.

loans.use: to decorate the barbershop and purchase razors and new equipment.

loans.name: Diana Karina

texts.es:
Diana tiene 19 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer de mototaxi y también como agricultor, juntos tiene 2 pequeños por los cuales trabaja mucho y sobre todo les da mucho amor y cariño ya que cada vez que ella los ve es un motivo para seguir adelante a pesar que algunos días se sienta un poco preocupada o triste por los percances que pueden suceder. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, se caracteriza por que se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros, así como también por sus playas y su clima acogedor. Hace ya 2 años ella se animo en tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes, en el cual trabaja actualmente ya que veía la forma de cómo poder ayudar a su esposo y por ello lo inicio; Ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo trabaja con muchas ganas.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios para poder exhibir sus productos de manera más ordenada y sus clientes se sientan mas cómodos; así ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena profesión y una vida feliz a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Diana is 19 years old and lives with her husband who works as a motorcycle taxi driver and a farmer. They have two small children, so they work very hard and provide them with much love and affection. Every time she sees her children, Diana is motivated to continue forward even though there are some days when she feels worried or sad about the unfortunate events in life that happen. Her home is located in the city of Imperial, which is known for the development of its agriculture, especially its crops of cotton, corn, and other commodities. Imperial is also known for its beaches and its warm climate. For the past two years, Diana has been excited about having her own grocery business. She started working because she saw it as a way to help her husband. Diana works approximately eight hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers in a day. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is extremely friendly and, above all, works with tremendous drive.

Diana is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have provided, she will be able to buy scaffolding in order for her to display her products in a more organized manner so that her customers feel more comfortable. Diana will continue working so that she can fulfill her greatest dream of finishing the construction of her house and seeing her children with a good profession and a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding for organizing and displaying her products.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.fr: Athanse est jeune homme de 30 ans marié, père de deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 7 ans, et tous deux vont à l'école il ouvert un atelier de couture qu'il gère lui même depuis 4 ans pas très loin d son domicile. Il achète souvant les tissus qu'il cout pour revendre et ça rapporte plus de bénéfice. Il veux avec l'approche des congés coudre en grande quantité pour revendre aux vacanciers d'où la necessité de ce crédit, qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire un bon nombre de personne, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Ces bénéficec l'aiderons à satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de sa petite famille et dans l'avenir à acheter une nouvelle machine pour ouvrir un autre atelier.
texts.en: Athanase is a 30-year-old married father of two children aged 2 and 7 who both go to school. He opened a sewing shop near his home four years ago. He often buys fabrics to sew and sell for a boost in revenue. With the holidays coming soon, he would like to sew a large quantity of items to sell to vacationers.This is why he is seeking a loan, which will allow him to meet customer demand and bolster his profits. This income will help him to provide for his family’s daily needs and, in the future, he will be able to buy a new sewing machine for second shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 5 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells hardware items. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items like iron sheets for resale, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and increase her inventory. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large to be eligible for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items such as iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Marie Claire est une femme de 54 ans divorcée mère d'un enfant agé de 28 ans qui va toujours à l'école. Elle a cinq autres personnes à sa charge (petits fils et neuveux). Elle vend des fruits et vivres frais ( piments, plantains, maïs...etc) depuis 20 ans à un marché de la place.
