Elle achète en petite quantité pour revendre et aimerai avec ce crédit augmenter le stock de de ses marchandises.  Ce qui lui permettre de vendre plus de d'augmenter de bénéfice, profit qu'elle économisera  pour la scolarisation de ses petits fils et agrandir son activité dans le temps.
texts.en: Marie Claire is a 54 year old woman who is divorced. She is the mother of a 28 year old who is still in school. She has 5 dependent children (grandchildren and nephews). She has been selling fruits and food supplies (peppers, plantains, corn, etc.) at the marketplace for 20 years. She buys a small amount to resell and would like to use this loan to increase her inventory. This would allow her to increase her profits. She would save her profits for  her grandchildrens' schooling and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has a five-year-old child.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years.  She also sells shoes to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

Margaret hopes to grow her business more in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a checker. She has three children and one of them is already working. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Carmen earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 380 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Carmen hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 58-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working in the food business for five years, but he opened his own restaurant in 2010.

His restaurant is specialized in preparing and selling freshly made pancakes with special ingredients, highly recommended by most of his customers. His shop is located in a very good region; it's on the main road, clear to everyone passing by.

Karam is planning to expand his business, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary interior decoration for his shop.

His shop is well known for its cleanliness and good taste, and highly recommended. He hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more to provide his family the best living.

loans.use: To do necessary decoration for his shop

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es:
El señor Arnulfo de 44 años de edad, es casado tiene 3 hijos. El nos comenta que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar para su vehículo propio, se inicio desde muy joven siendo taxista, y hoy en día ya tiene una clientela variada y numerosa ya que es de muy buen trato.
Arnulfo nos dice que su taxi es su medio de trabajo, y es por eso que quiere poder invertir en el, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para poder reparar su taxi, ya que quiere mejorar su chapería, y de esa forma darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues quiere poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, que son a quienes el más quiere.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnulfo is 44 years old, married and has 3 children.  He tells us that after a lot of work he was able to buy his own vehicle.  He started being a taxi driver at a young age and currently has a diverse and large customer base because of the good service that he provides.
Arnulfo says that his taxi is his way to make a living and that is why he wants to be able to invest in it.  He is requesting the loan to be able to repair his taxi.  He wants to improve the body and this way provide better service to his customers.
He is thankful for the help that he is receiving.  He wants to be able to continue working and helping his family, who are the ones that he loves the most.

loans.use: to fix the body of the taxi.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Ms. Judith is 30 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Ms. Judith has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of work. Ms. Judith has requested a loan amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients.

Ms. Judith has been a member of PMPC for this year.  In the future, Ms. Judith would like to use the profits to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack food vending

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has three children.  She runs a salon to earn a living. She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ more people.  She has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair treatment products and hair braids.

loans.use: To buy hair treatment products and hair braids

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental; she is married with 4 children. To earn a living, Agnes has a business selling snacks foods. She earns about 4,400 PHP each month doing this type of work. Agnes has requested a loan for 5,000.00 PHP to purchase snacks for her snack food business.

Agnes has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, she would like to use the profit from her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy snacks for her snack food selling business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo su anterior credikiva lo invirtió en el mejoramiento de las instalaciones locativas del restaurante y su negocio ahora se ve más elegante y sobre todo está confortable. Su negocio gradualmente ha aumentado su clientela y ahora aun más, por eso planea invertir una vez más en él y comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, porque su nuevo mercado necesita una respuesta inmediata y esto es lo que logrará con su nuevo credikiva. Él dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por el apoyo  recibido, el cual me sirvió de gran ayuda en mi negocio, espero continúen apoyándome  y también a muchos microempresarios. “
texts.en:
Pablo invested his previous Kiva loan in improvements to the facilities in his restaurant.  Now his business looks more elegant and, above all, it is more comfortable.  His customer base gradually increased and now he plans to make another investment.  

Pablo will buy supplies in large volumes because his new market of customers requires an immediate response.  He will be able to do this with his new Kiva loan.  Pablo would like to tell the Kiva lenders, "Thanks for the support you have given to me since it has been a great help to my business.  I hope that you will continue supporting me and many other micro-entrepreneurs."

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro, tiene la edad  57 de  años, está separado, actualmente vive con una mueva pareja sentimental. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el abono y plaguicidas para mantener su almacigo en optimas condiciones para la siembra. El tiene un terreno ya sembrado de café en condiciones regulares y quiere aumentar su producción de café por lo cual sembrara un almacigo que tiene en crecimiento. El espera este año aumentar las producción y generar más ingresos para su bienestar familiar y su futuro económico más estable.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Álvaro, age 57, is separated from his spouse and currently living with his new romantic partner. He intends to use this loan to buy supplies, such as compost and pesticides, for maintaining optimal conditions of the seedbed he uses for planting. Álvaro has a plot of land on which he has already planted coffee under normal conditions. He wants to increase his coffee production, so he has planted a seedbed where his new crops can grow. Álvaro hopes to increase his production this year and generate more income for his family. He also wants to have more financial stability in the future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Álvaro has not had any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for maintaining his coffee seedbed.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 46-year-old business lady. She is married to Francis, a coffee farmer. Salome has been selling timber and firewood for the past 11 years as her primary business and also sells livestock as her secondary business. She receives an average monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family of four. 

This is her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to add more stock of timber and firewood to her business. Salome will use the profit to expand her livestock selling business. 

Her dream is to expand her two businesses, educate her children comfortably, and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To add more stock of timber and firewood

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 54 años, es un hombre muy bueno y responsable. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Él vive en el fundo de su jefe, ya que trabaja cuidándolo, pero también lo usa para sus sembríos y como granja para sus animales.
Produce yuca, plátano, ají y otros. Los animales que cría son: gallinas, patos, pollo y vacas. Este trabajo lo hace en la chacra de su patrón, ya que al ser su empleado puede utilizar la tierra para sembrar sus productos. El trabajo lo realiza solo, y cuando es necesario con algunos peones para poder ayudarlo en la siembra. Le gusta mucho su actividad porque está siempre en la naturaleza, además que tiene tiempo libre para muchas actividades. Espera mantenerse con su producción y poder comprar, más adelante, su propio fundo donde pueda él mismo trabajar con sus siembras y animales.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, siempre fue buen socio de su banco comunal, donde lo quieren mucho porque es muy responsable y solidario. Espera el préstamo que será un respaldo para su trabajo. Está convencido que seguirá siendo puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará granos y algunos palos de yuca; también contratará a algunas personas para que le ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old and a good and responsible man.  He and his spouse have three children, they are all grown and independent.  He lives on his boss's farm since he maintains it.  He also uses the land for his crops and as a range for his animals.
He grows yucca, plantains, peppers and others. The animals that he raises are chickens, ducks, and cows.  He does this on his employer's land, since he works for him and is allowed to use it for grow his crops.  He does the work by himself, and when necessary gets some laborers to help him with the planting.  He likes his work because he is always outdoors and has free time for many other activities.  He is planning to support himself with his production and be able to buy his own farm in the future, where he can work with his crops and animals.
This is loan number 6 with MFP.  He has always been a good member of his community bank where they are very fond of him because he is very responsible and supportive.  He is looking forward to getting the loan which will support his work.  He assures us that he will continue to be punctual and continue to make his payments on time as he has done with previous loans.
The amount requested, 1500 soles, will be used to buy grain, some yucca trees and will also contract some people to help with the planting.

loans.use: to purchase grain and contract laborers.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 33 years old and is single. He sells cows and he has been in this business for three years. His business is open from 6 a.m to 6 p.m every day per week and he currently employs three people to help him. 

Alfred has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Dorthy

texts.en:
Dorthy is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Dorthy has been working hard to manage her butcher shop, which sells fresh meat. 

To help expand her business, Dorthy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh meat for resale, and will help Dorthy generate greater profits and improve her style of living. Dorthy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a successful business. 

Dorthy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorthy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh meat for resale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has three children.  She runs a tailoring business to earn a living. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Mr. Edelberto is 39 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is married with four children. 
Mr. Edelberto is a landscaper and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to buy lumber for housing repair. 
Mr. Edelberto has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Mr. Edelberto hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for housing repair

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am is 57 years old, married, and a proud farmer who has been managing around two hectares of farmland in Ang Snoul District. Her husband is a supportive man and helps her manage the maintenance of the rice field. Together, they are able to generate approximately USD 5.00 per day to cover her daily costs. Presently she has a child who is already married.

Am would like to make her business more profitable, so she needs additional capital to purchase cows for farming purposes. She believes that she can ensure good growth of her rice crops and thereby make more income to better her family’s living status.

loans.use: to purchase cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul used his previous loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and cosmetics.  He was able to serve his customers in a better way with the additional beauty products.  Since receiving the loan, he has witnessed a lot of growth in his business.  He has also managed to employ five people in his business.  
He has requested another loan of 110, 000 Kenya shillings to buy beauty products and renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and renovate his business premises

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 32 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 4 and 8. He also takes care of three people who work for him. He sells cows, a business he has been in for three years. His business is open from 6 a.m to 6 p.m every day. He currently employs three people to help him. Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for re-sale.
